loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Saturnina is 47 years old and has six children who are in school.

Saturnina has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing materials.

Saturnina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with six children. She is 40 years old and five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elena has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell on her stall. Elena has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Hrushik

texts.en:
Hrushik is 66 years old and she lives in the Gugark village of the Lori region. She has a vocational education and the specialty of accountancy.  She has worked at her specialty as an accountant for 40 years.  She is very respected and a recognized specialist in this sphere. 

Hrushik is a widow and now she lives alone.  With a lot of time, Hrushik works long hours and tries to be aware of all the innovations in her field. 

Now she needs this loan to take part in training courses in computers and accountancy. She is sure that these courses will help her to have more success in her work, and she hopes that she can find better work with more income.

loans.use: to take training courses on computers and accountancy

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is 56 years old and she lives in Ijevan city of the Tavush region. She has a vocational education and a specialty in nursing, but she never worked in the medical sphere. For a short period of time she worked as a secretary, and then with her husband she was engaged in food trading in their small shop. 

Unfortunately after her husband died she did not manage to keep their small business, and since then till today she has engaged in farming and agriculture. Now she lives with her parents-in-law and her single son. 

Melanya is interested in swine breeding and poultry. She also has a nice orchard, where she so properly raises and takes care of apple, fig, mulberry, pear, and apricot trees. So the sale of these fruits, and also the sale of pork, poultry, and eggs, makes her farm income, thanks to which she covers her family’s minimum needs. 

This Kiva loan she will be happy to receive as she wants to buy one more pig for her farm and also fodder both for her pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy one more pig for her farm and also fodder both for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 58 years old and married with three children.

Lina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Lina has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy eggs, chickens and chicken feed to nourish them. She hopes to fulfill her orders so she can continue progressing economically.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Chwele village, situated in the Bungoma area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley. Land in Chwele is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Chwele practice agriculture. Elizabeth, and her husband, own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their three children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last nine years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk.

Elizabeth is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Elizabeth needs to boost her milk production to earn more income. With your loan, she will be able to afford a high-yielding dairy cow. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic waste from neighbors and resell it to recycling companies to produce sachets for drinking water.

loans.name: Luz Fabiola

texts.es:
Luz Elena es una comerciante de 49 años de edad, que se dedica principalmente a la venta de calzado, esta actividad la adopto como necesidad económica pues quedo desempleada y aprovecho su experiencia que gano trabajando en empleos similares.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es muy correcta con sus pagos, responsable una madre muy amorosa, tiene una hija de 17 años de edad su objetivo es generar los recursos para que esta muchacha pueda estudiar, pueda capacitarse, para ella es algo primordial ya el resto de deudas se las sortea con su marido y trabajara arduamente porque su cometido se cumpla.
 Este año será el comienzo de su gran reto puesto que su hija ya termino el ultimo grado de educación escolar y está ahora dispuesta a iniciar una nueva aventura en la universidad.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de calzado, el monto lo justifica en que al ser una persona muy correcta compra solo mercancía legal, original y con factura, no quiere problemas ni líos con los entes reguladores ni con clientes por cuestiones de calidad.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is a 49-year-old businesswoman, who sells mostly shoes. When she became unemployed, she took advantage of her experience working in similar jobs and started her own business out of economic necessity.

She is a hard-working woman, makes all of her payments, is responsible and a loving mother of a 17-year-old daughter. Her objective is to generate the needed resources for her daughter to study, to be able to get her qualifications; for her this is top-priority. For all the rest of the expenses, she sorts them out with her husband. She'll work arduously because she fulfills her commitments.

This year will be the beginning of the challenge, as her daughter finished her last year of school and is determined to start a new adventure in university.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of shoes. She justifies the amount of the loan because she does what is right, which is that she only buys legal, original merchandise with receipts. She doesn't want to have any problems or cause a fuss with regulatory bodies or clients who question the quality.

loans.use: buy shoes.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, residente en la vereda la clarita, trabaja junto con su pareja, con la que tuvo 3 mujeres y un hombre, todos ellos depende exclusivamente de su actividad económica.
Martha logro consolidar un negocio de venta de abarrotes y paralelo a este su esposo atiende un negocio en Medellín se llamaría “deposito”, en este vende arena, tubería, varillas, concreto, materiales para la construcción en general.
Este es el único negocio en la vereda por lo que tiene una gran responsabilidad de mantenerlo surtido y abastecido.
Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido para la tienda, para el “deposito”, comprar una nevera de dos columnas.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman. She is a resident in the La Clarita district. She works with her partner, with whom she had 3 daughters and a son, all of whom depend only on her income.

Martha succeeded in establishing a grocery store business. In conjunction with this, her husband manages a business in Medellín, which sells sand, pipes, bars, concrete, and other materials for construction.

This is the only business in the area, so she has a big responsibility to keep it well stocked.

Martha requests a loan to buy some supply for her store and to buy a two-column refrigerator for the store her husband manages.

loans.use: support her two businesses: a grocery store and a store selling construction supplies. She wants to supply them.

loans.name: Saryono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Saryono. Saryono lives in Cirebon, located in West Java, about five hours' drive from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his only child. He owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to expand his business using technology. Saryono is a friendly and informative mobile provider. That’s why he has many customers. 

As the business grows, Saryono needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Saryono’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Saryono is the one who is standing in front of his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Kulsun

texts.ru: Кулсун 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругой воспитывают 4 детей.  У Кулсун высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулсун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 20 овец, а также земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулсун обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита Кулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kulsun is 36 years old, married, and has had four children with her spouse. Kulsun has a college education. She earns her family's primary income through animal husbandry and farming, an occupation she started in 15 years ago with a 5,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to Kulsun's tireless work today she owns four cows and 20 sheep, and has a 0.30 hectare land parcel where she grows potatoes. Her monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business Kulsun asked the Bai-Tushum Bank for a 150,000 som (KGS) loan to buy two calves and twenty sheep. She plans to invest earnings from use of the loan into further expanding her livestock herd.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves and 20 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives in her own house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Rose has a beauty salon which operates on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 10 years working seven days a week. Rose  generates additional income by outside catering. The main business challenges that she faces include transportation and electricity. Her goal is to own a bridal salon. 

Rose has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, treatments, braids and weaves.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, treatments, braids and weaves

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 53 years old and a father who lives in a rural community. Due to unavoidable circumstances, he was separated frrom his wife. Despite this, he has the determination to give his four children a better life. 

Renato has engaged in furniture making for almost ten years. He aims to continue and improve his business, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like ask for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy woods, varnish, nails, hammers, and other materials for making furniture. 

Being patient and industrious, he believes that someday he will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy woods, varnish, nails, hammers, and other materials for making furniture

location.town: Brgy. Villa Flores, Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn has started her small business and has become a boss with her sari-sari (variety) store. She has managed to have enough inventory and reinvests her capital to gain more profit. Marlyn makes good sales every day as her store is the only one in their barangay (village). She is thankful as she has improved their living conditions by renovating their house from her savings. 

Recently, Marlyn approached Paglaum (PMPC) for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to live happily and healthily with her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has been a wholesaler of bananas in her town for almost ten years. With this long experience of selling, she already has a high degree of knowledge in dealing in this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Erlinda still gets more customers than the rest, due to her good salesmanship and her characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family.

For now, Erlinda is planning to expand her resources due to her increasing orders. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to pay for 4 loads of bananas for wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to pay for 4 loads of bananas for wholesale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and married with five children. With all five of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Marilyn has run a general store in the Philippines for the past two years. 

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items such as bread, beverages, home care products, etc. to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as bread, beverages, home care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis es un campesino muy poli funcional, vive solo y se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y en los tiempos muertos de dicha actividad vende madera.
Se separó de su esposa por problemas maritales, pero desde entonces se ha preocupado por generar ingresos mantenerse y buscar cada día la mejora continua.
Como mencionábamos antes es un campesino, no cuenta con mucho apoyo, las personas que le pueden prestar lo hacen con la intención de cobrarle elevadas tasas de interés para quitarle sus tierras y como no le queda de otra se arriesga porque necesita capital.
Pero esto cambio ahora Luis cuenta con el apoyo de Interactuar que busca ayudar a esta persona con un préstamo que el lo necesita para comprar abonos, fungicidas, gallinaza y madera.
Lo quiere hacer con la ayuda de su aliado Kiva quien contempla miles de personas de todo el mundo con la predisposición de ayudar al prójimo y de crear un mundo más equitativo
texts.en:
Luis is a multi-tasking farmer. He lives alone and dedicates himself to agricultural work. In the down time for this activity, he sells wood.

He separated from his wife because of marital problems, but since then, he has been concerned about making an income to take care of himself, and everyday, he looks to continue improving.

As was mentioned above, he is a farmer. He doesn’t have a lot of help. The people that could lend to him do it with the intention of charging him high interest rates, so that they can take his land. As he doesn’t have another option, he risks it because he needs the capital.

But this has changed now that Luis can count of the support of Interactuar, which seeks to help this person with a loan that he needs to buy manure, fungicides, hen droppings, and wood.

The organization wants to do this with the help of its ally, Kiva, which considers thousands of people all over the word with the inclination to help its neighbors and to create a more equal world.

loans.use: to buy manure, fungicides, hen droppings, and wood.

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en:
Novembrita is a supportive mother of three school-age children. Her husband is a farmer and cultivates their small parcel of corn land and coconut land as their source of income. Novembrita knows that their income is not enough to cover their daily expenses. So she started buying charcoal which helps support them.

She is applying for a loan from Paglaum amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy coconut shells in bulk and process them into charcoal for delivery to the nearest town. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, because she loves to help her jobless neighbors.

loans.use: to buy additional coconut shells to make charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a businesswoman who earns an income by selling various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is now on her way to rebuilding her new house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Leonchita

texts.en:
Leonchita, the breadwinner in her family, is making a profit through her sari-sari (general) store business. She is 32 years old and single. She never gets tired of tending to her store. Her passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her family.  

Leonchita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. 

Leonchita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family and be able to support her siblings as well.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items for sale.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 49 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with no children.

Eduardo is engaged in the poultry business, specifically raising ducks, for 5 years already. He earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. This amount is very helpful to him to meet his needs. He has requested a loan to be used to purchase an additional 100 head of ducklings and booster feed for his existing business. Eduardo has been a member of PMPC for just this year.

In the future, Eduardo hopes to expand his duck raising business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 100 ducklings and booster feed.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined.

Linet operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Linet will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Yerevan city with his nice wife. They have a son and a daughter; both of them are married and they live separately from their parents with their families. 

Ashot says that he is the happiest grandfather in the world. His son has twins and they are boys. His daughter also has twins and they are girls. Ashot mentions that no matter how busy he and his wife are, daily walks in the parks and different games with the grandchildren are the start and the end of each day. Ashot says that he and his wife now live, dream, think and work only for their grandchildren, so as to be able to make every day colorful, joyful and happy for them. 

Ashot work as a policeman at the police station and his wife is a lawyer.

This loan of 300.000 AMD for which Ashot is asking is for him and his wife to organize a nice birthday party for the twins of their son. Very soon they will become three years old. With this loan, Ashot wants to organize a party with a lot of guests and presents, with colorful fairy tale heroes that the boys like and also with a big and delicious cake, decorated with cars and with their nice photos. 

He will be so thankful if Kiva lenders help him to realize his plans and organize a fantastic birthday party for his grandsons.

loans.use: to organize a nice birthday party for his son's twins.

loans.name: Ceferena

texts.en:
Ceferena is 62 years old and has eight children. Ceferena is a married woman.

Ceferena is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies needed to raise her livestock.

Ceferena has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed loans eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ceferena would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies needed to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is 43 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school.

Ricarda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ricarda has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ricarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is involved in livestock-keeping in Gyumri town. She currently keeps thirteen calves and nine cows. Her family members, her husband and two sons, help Narine with farming work. 

Narine is sure that she can enlarge their livestock business and earn greater profit from it. That's the reason she is asking for this loan of USD 1,300 to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and be able to sustain the farm.

Because the socio-economic situation in Shirak region is quite bad, farmers here face many difficulties. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region. 

Narine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock to sustain the farm and gather income for the family's living

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has a banana farm in Tangub. This is her primary source of income for her family. Maribel makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and good income. 

Recently, she needed a loan to pay for irrigation costs, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Maribel wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply bananas to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for irrigation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, aged 53, is married and a resident of Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines.  Her husband is a manual laborer. They are blessed with three children. As it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, Pacita decided to engage herself in selling products.  She started a sari-sari (mini-grocery) store with capital of 2,000 PHP. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Pacita has been able to manage her business well and successfully, and to finance her family's daily needs.

She has been helped in the successful operation of her business by Paglaum Cooperative, where she became a member in April 2010. Pacita has been able to avail herself of three loans and has religiously repaid them. Now, she has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to finance additional stocks of basic commodities to sell in her grocery store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari store into a mini-mart some day.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of basic commodities to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old, and she is married with 6 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, though she also earns additional income from food vending.

Myrna is borrowing 5,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Myrna works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Zharkynai

texts.ru: Жаркынай 36 лет, не замужем, есть сын. У Жаркынай неоконченное высшее образование, она работает в отделе кадров, также, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы. На 0,96 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь ее и ее 6 летнего сына, поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Zharkynai is 36 years old, not married and has a son. Zharkynai has an incomplete college education and works in a human resources department. Also, to provide additional income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 14 years ago with a 15,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to Zharkynai's hard work, today her business contains 3 cows and 0.96 hectares of own land, where she grows beans. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough for a decent life for her and her 6-year-old son. This is why, to continue developing her business, Zharkynai requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 cows and 10 sheep to increase her livestock headcount. Zharkynai plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and plans to save money to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and 10 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount and help bolster her income

loans.name: Danahan

texts.ru: Данахан 48 лет, в разводе, мать 2 детей. У Данахан среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей продуктами питания. На сегодняшний день в обороте есть товары на сумму 100,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара, что позволит привлечь новых клиентов. Доходы от кредита Данахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение магазина и образование ее сына.
texts.en: Danahan is 48 years old, divorced and a mother of 2 children. Danahan has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in selling food products. Currently, she has 100,000 som (KGS) working capital of products. Her monthly profit is up to 30,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to expand her product selection, which will allow her to attract new customers. Danahan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her store and educating her son.

loans.use: to expand her product selection

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin is a 41-year-old father who has three children attending school. Due to financial hardship, he operates his motorcycle transport to have an additional source of income. He aims to earn and save more income in order to cover his family's needs and finance the education of his children. 

To continuously operate his motorcycle, he needs to access a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts and accessories needed for his motorcycle. Through this financial assistance, Marvin believes that he will earn a higher income and offer safe transportation to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a businesswoman from Tangub. She is 50 years old, a widow, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.  

Manuela is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items.  Manuela continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items

loans.name: Marisa Juliet

texts.en:
Marisa Juliet, 48, is married and lives in San Vicente,Tangub City. She has three children. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in dried fish and "longanisa" (processed meat) vending, starting with a capital of 3,000 PHP. Her business has operated for 13 years already. 

Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 7,000 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2014. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish and "longanisa". Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory of dried fish and longanisa (processed meat) to sell

location.town: Tangub- San Vicente, Tangub City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells fuel. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

Celestine describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fuel. Her business goal is to expand and have a large business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a happy family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fuel

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucilla sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy meat products and other supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional  pork, chicken and other meat products which she sells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Lucilla wants to expand her business so that she will be able to help provide more for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pork, chicken and other meat products needed for her business.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a married mother of 2 children. She describes herself as industrious. 

Beth operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a competitive area, and her primary customers are of all types. 

Beth describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of beauty products to use in her salon. 

Beth hopes that in the future she will have a good life. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products to use in her salon.

loans.name: Santalatkhon

texts.ru: Санталатхон 44 года, не замужем, дочь - студентка. У Санталатхон средне-специальное образование, работает мед сестрой в Центре семейной медицины. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Санталатхон занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 24 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова и 9 овец, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 0,08 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса Санталатхон составляет 6,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Санталатхон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, часть средств потратит на закупку семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита Санталатхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Santalatkhon is 44 years old, single, and she has a daughter who is a student.  She has a specialized secondary education and she works as a nurse at a center for family medicine.  In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, having started in this field 24 years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has one cow and nine sheep on her farm.  She also has 0.08 hectare of land on which she cultivates potatoes annually.  Santalatkhon makes a monthly income of 6,000 som (KGS) from her business, which is vastly insufficient for a decent life and to provide for her family.

Eager to further grow her business, Santalatkhon has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy a few sheep.  With the rest of the money she will also buy seed potatoes.  Santalatkhon is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of domestic animals.  She also intends to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy a few sheep and some seed potatoes in order to invest in her business and boost her income.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is aged 24 years old. She is married with one child aged three years. 

Marie Rose is a farmer, and she has been growing maize for the past four years; her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, Marie Rose would like to pay the workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two infant children in Senaki district. 

Irakli is unemployed at the moment and his family lives in poverty. He wants to start up a trading business in order to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 850 USD. With the received credit he will purchase a stock of laurel leaves from the wholesalers in his district at a good price and will resell at higher price. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for Irakli as he will be able to generate income and make better living conditions for his infant children.

loans.use: to begin trade in laurel leaves

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married with 4 kids. She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Conchita is a farmer, and she grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years, and every month she is able to earn 5,000 PHP from this work. 

Conchita has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She joined Gata Daku Mulit-purpose Cooperative in 2013. 

In the future, Conchita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 50-year-old woman who finds herself unemployed. Her history is a bit difficult. She has been farming for the past 15 years. It is really surprising how this woman sacrifices herself to give her family a comfortable life. Anna is happily married, and, together with her husband, they have been blessed with a lovely family. Anna's primary source of income is milk, but she also raises poultry on her farm. She sells her vegetables, eggs, and milk to the nearby market. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very thankful that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family, and she has always yearned to have more dairy cows. Anna is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will produce between 10-20 liters of milk per day. This breed produces milk referred to as “the ideal drinking milk” because it has all the required quantities of fat and protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production on her farm which will translate into more sales and better income for her and her family. Because of the potential for high milk production, Anna will save more money to fully repay the loan. Anna also believes that through the careful selection and application of strict standards of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.
Help her out!

loans.use: to pay for a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Eva Sandrit

texts.es:
Ella es Eva es una ganadera de tan solo 20 años de edad, pero es casada y junto con su pareja trabaja arduamente para generar los ingresos para mantener a su hijo de 3 años de edad.
Desde jóvenes decidieron emprender su camino, buscar su propia felicidad, alejados de los comentarios con los que lo azotaban diariamente por irse a vivir juntos a tan corta de edad.
Eva inicio su negocio de ganadería por necesidad económica, y aprovecho los conocimientos que aprendió de su padre quien ha sido uno de los pocos apoyos, la motiva y la ayuda para que crezca como empresaria.
Su sueño es forjar junto con su pareja un lindo hogar, amoroso y cálido y de su parte ayudara para la causa con su actividad económica.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres terneros.
texts.en:
Eva is a rancher who is only 20 years old.  She is married, and together with her life partner she works arduously in order to generate income to support her three year old son.

When they were youths they decided to undertake their path.  They decided to seek their own happiness away from the comments that lashed out at them daily for going to live together at such a young age.

Eva started her livestock business out of financial need.  She took advantage of the knowledge she learned from her father.  He has been one of the few who supports, motivates, and helps her to grow as a businesswoman.

Her dream is to forge a good, loving, and warm household with her life partner.  In order to do so, she will help with her business activity.

She is requesting a loan to buy three calves.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Amparo es una mujer de 37 años de edad, ella es separada de su esposo, pero quedo con la custodia de sus 3 hijos, a ellos los mantiene con la ayuda de su actividad la cual es producción de leche, tiene dos vaquitas (ver foto).
Para ella ha sido muy difícil tener que cargar con las labores del hogar, solo tiene la ayuda de sus hijos, pero al ser tan amorosa y tierna con ellos prefieren que vayan a una escuela y en sus tardes estudien, para que se capaciten y no le toque una vida tan difícil como la del campesino.
Su afán es mantener su negocio, pero su mayor necesidad es aumentar la producción debido a que el costo de venta del litro de leche decayó mucho.

Pensando en esta necesidad Luz Amparo quiere solicitar un crédito   para la compra de una vaca lechera, el monto es justificado en que la vaca la comprara embarazada y su precio es muy alto.
texts.en:
Luz Amparo, age 37, is separated from her husband.  However, she has custody of their three children.  She supports them with the help of her business activity, which is milk production.  She has two cows (see photo).

It has been very difficult for her to have to manage the household chores.  She only has her children’s help.  However, because she is so loving and tender, she prefers that they go to school and study in the afternoons.  This is so that they are trained and do not live a life as difficult as that of a farmer.

Her desire is to maintain her business.  However, her biggest need is to increase production because the price of a liter of milk has fallen a lot.

Thinking of this need, Luz Amparo wants to request a loan to buy a dairy cow.  The amount is justified because she will buy a pregnant cow, and her price is very high.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Noel De Jesus

texts.es:
Noel es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Sonson.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Noel is a humble and hardworking farmer with the drive and tenacity that distinguishes the male and female farmers from the rest.  He is a man with an entrepreneurial mind and when he was very little, he learned all of the farming responsibilities such as cultivation and raising livestock, so much so that today he has his own coffee cultivation business.  He sells the goods at the market square in the Sonson municipality. 

This individual has the goal of increasing his crops and improving those that he currently has.  This is why he is turning to an assistive loan with the Interactuar Corporation to purchase farming supplies such as chemical and organic fertilizers and coffee seeds.

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as a businessman and as a person, as well as increase his income and continue to contribute to the livelihood of his home.  All that he wants is to be able to improve the quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as chemical and organic fertilizers and coffee seeds

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
La señora Maria es una agricultora muy habilidosa con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de café que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 4 de sus 7 hijos por los cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlos adelante.

Ella desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de café, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarle a sus hijos un buen futuro!
texts.en:
Maria is a very skilled farmer with experience in many areas of agriculture, an innate talent for teamwork and a great entrepreneurial mind.  She has coffee crops that she tends to every day from the very early hours of the morning.  Currently, she lives with her spouse and four of her seven children, for whom she has always tried to fight in order to move them forward in life.

She wants to give her crops a boost and to obtain a better income from them, which is why she is asking for financial assistance to invest in agricultural supplies such as pesticides, organic fertilizer and coffee seeds.  The loan will give her the opportunity to have a better quality product.  

Her greatest dream is to have her own house and to provide her children with a good future!

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, organic fertilizer and coffee seeds

loans.name: Hripsik

texts.en:
Hripsik is 58 years old and she lives with her husband in the village Gagarin of Gegharkunik region. She has cute farm and she does all the work on it with the help of her beloved husband. On her farm she has five cows and thanks to them, Hripsik sells milk, cheese, butter and macun (a national dairy product) to her neighbors and villagers. She also plants potatoes and greens on her plot of land, and with her husband, she organizes the sales. 

With this loan of 700,000 AMD, Hripsik wants to buy two more cows for her farm, which will greatly enlarge the quantity of dairy products that she sells.

loans.use: to buy two more cows for her farm, which will greatly enlarge the quantity of dairy products.

loans.name: Maria Libia

texts.es:
Maria es una veterana con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencilla, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.
Ella tiene un cultivo de frijol el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Sonson.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dieron sus padres desde niña, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar. 

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de frijol y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.
 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinas trabajadoras de Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a una humilde agricultora para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Maria is a seasoned farmer with a lot of experience in the fields. She's humble and easygoing and has the people skills and energy necessary to grow any crop.

She has a bean crop and works every day to sell her crop in the market plaza in the city of Sonson. Thanks to her years of experience and the lessons her parents taught her as a child, she has the complete capacity to work. 

She seeks a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, bean seeds and pesticides. In this way, she'll inject capital into her business and improve her crops significantly, facing the greatest difficulty she has: the variable climate that affects her crop. 

She has a lot of faith in her business and high hopes for the caring people who support the working farmers of Columbia like Corporación Interactuar. Help a humble farmer so she's able to help her land succeed with a loan!

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, bean seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.

 Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Carlos is an experienced carpenter who learned this trade many years ago, thanks to the experience he obtained working in many wood workshops.  Over time, he little by little became more independent until he started his own workshop with which, in spite of hardships, he has been able to move forward along with his family.  His greatest pride is having built a very good reputation and prestige, thanks to his good work.  He builds furniture with his own two hands and almost everything found inside his humble home is made by himself.

He is requesting a loan to purchase wood that will allow him to make more furniture and be able to make a good profit from his work.  His main dream is for his children, since he wants to give them a very good education and for them to be very successful people in the future.  He always thinks of Interactuar as his ally and partner in his production process.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make furniture

loans.name: Blanca Doris

texts.es:
Blanca es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años. 
Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de El Carmen De Viboral en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas para sus flores, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 
Blanca sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.
 
¡Impacte la vida de Blanca y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Blanca is the mother of 2 children and is in a common-law marriage. Apart from her family, she has worked in agriculture for 6 years.

She learned this business empirically, which is to say through practice and observation of other people. 

She and her family live in the rural zone of El Carmen de Viboral, where it is not easy to have access to financial services like the ones that Corporación Interactuar offers. 

She plans to use her loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as flower seeds, products to control pests and fertilizer to maintain and sustain her crops. 

Thanks to this loan, the economy and quality of life of her family will improve since she will be able to increase her income.  Blanca dreams of finishing the legal process for the documents for her land and in this way have full control of her land.

Impact the lives of Blanca and her family with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase flower seeds, and products for pest control and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Romelia

texts.es:
María Romelia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, empresaria casada que se dedica a ofertar los servicios de mantenimiento de Jardines, cuenta con 5 empleados y planea expandirse, contratando más empleados.
Inicio con su negocio en el año 1999 y desde entonces haga enfocado todos sus esfuerzos en ser una persona exitosa.
Este año 2015, es un gran reto y bendición pues hoy se encuentra solicitando un préstamo muy considerable la razón es que quiere comprar guadañadoras y podadoras, puesto que empleara  más personas.
Tu aporte ayudara a María Romelia a duplicar sus empleados pasara de tener 5 personas a tener 10.
texts.en:
María Romelia is a 47-year-old woman, a married businesswoman who works offering lawn care services. She has 5 employees and plans to expand, hiring more employees.

She began her business in 1999, and since then has focused all her efforts on being a successful person. 

This year, 2015, is a big challenge and blessing because today she finds herself asking for a large loan, the reason is that she wants to purchase weed-whackers and lawnmowers since she will employ more people.

Your support will help María Romelia double her employees from having 5 people to having 10.

loans.use: to purchase weed-whackers and lawnmowers to go from 5 employees to have 10.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 45 years old. She has a large family, her husband, two children, a daughter-in-law, grandchildren and a pensioner mother-in-law. Ekaterine is very hardworking woman.  The family runs a husbandry business. In particular, they have 2 pigs and 10 piglets. They sell piglets and generate income. In addition, the family cultivates a hectare of agricultural land to grow maize. 

Ekaterine decided to expand the husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,800 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a cow. Ekaterine will start producing dairy products to sell, as well as to use for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Erika Yasmín

texts.es:
Erika, de 24 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a sus hijos, ya que hace 6 meses murió su esposo, siempre se mantiene como una familia muy unida, ya que sus hermanas le están ayudando a salir adelante en el cultivo de hortalizas  (pepinos) y juntos realizan sus cultivos.  

Erika, ha trabajado desde pequeña en el cultivo de granos básicos junto a sus padres, que desde pequeña le inculcaron el trabajo, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.- Anteriormente, junto a su esposo realizaban los cultivos de hortalizas y ahora que su esposo ya no está, ella quiere seguir trabajando para sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla y fertilizantes para el cultivo, además planea vender pupusas por las tardes, para lo cual necesita capital para empezar el negocio. 

Para Erika, sus planes han cambiado drásticamente, ahora que su esposo ya no está con ella, pero lo que ahora le interesa más es trabajar para sacar a sus hijos adelante y que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Erika is 24 years old, widowed and lives with her children. Her husband died six months ago. She's always remained part of a very united family, and her brothers are helping her succeed in farming peppers and grow their crops together.

Since she was young, Erika has worked growing stable goods with her parents, who taught her to work from a very young age, as she didn't have the opportunity to go to school. 

Earlier, she grew vegetables with her husband. Now that he's gone, she wants to continue working to help her children succeed.

The loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crop. She also plans to sell pupusas (a corn tortilla with cheese filling) in the afternoon and needs capital to start the business. 

Erika's plans have changed drastically now that her husband is no longer with her, but she's most interested in working so her children can succeed and go to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crop; she also plans to sell pupusas in the afternoon and needs capital to start the business.

loans.name: Adzo Louise

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme divorcée et âgée de 35 ans. Adzo est mère de quatre enfants et habite à Adidogomé. Adzo vend des pagnes dans son quartier pour avoir le bénéfice et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Pour avoir son stock, Adzo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Ce prêt aidera à Adzo à acheter des pièces de pagnes pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et réaliser plus de bénéfice. Adzo souhaite mettre une éducation à disposition de ses enfants et favoriser leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Adzo is 35 years old and divorced. Adzo is a mother to four children and lives in Adidogomé. Adzo sells traditional cloth (pagne) in her neighborhood to make a profit and to meet the needs of her children. For her inventory, Adzo resupplies twice per month. 

This loan will help Adzo to buy cuts of traditional cloth to raise her revenue and to achieve a greater profit. Adzo wishes to make education available for her children and to support their development.

loans.use: To buy 9 cuts of traditional cloth (pagne).

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans Yawa est une femme mariée et vit à Adidogomé avec  un enfant à sa charge. Yawa vend de la bouillie préparée à base du maïs pour ainsi contribuer à la vie sociale de sa famille. Yawa s’approvisionne au marché une fois par mois. Pour avoir plus de gains, Yawa désire ce prêt pour acheter des bols de maïs pour vendre et ainsi couvrir les charges quotidiennes et favoriser la scolarité de son enfant grâce au bénéfice qu’elle trouvera
texts.en: Yawa is 33 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé with one child in her care. Yawa sells corn meal porridge (bouillie) to contribute to the social life of her family. Yawa resupplies at the market once per month. In order to make more profit, Yawa wants this loan to buy bowls of corn to sell. This way, she will cover daily expenses and encourage the schooling of her child by means of the profit she will make.

loans.use: to buy 200 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo en un joven de 30 años, casado con 2 hijos pequeños. Tiene un trabajo estable durante la época de cosecha de café (noviembre a abril) y además es productor de café orgánico y comercio justo. Tras la baja producción derivada de la afectación del hongo de la roya,sus ingresos no alcanzan para sustentar todas las necesidades de la familia todo el año. Quiere poder producir algo que le dé más ganancia que su trabajo por lo que ha decido hacer un invernadero y plantar tomates.
El está solicitando un préstamo para continuar con la construcción del invernadero de la fotografía. Con el dinero le será posible comprar materiales para terminar la construcción, plantas de tomate, bolsas de fibra de coco y el sistema de riego por goteo que necesita para echar a andar la producción de tomate 100% orgánico e hidropónico. La comercialización del tomate se realizará a través de la cooperativa COCAFCAL de la que es socio.
El préstamo ayudaría a Danilo a obtener ganancias para poder terminar con el proceso de siembra de su finca de café y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Danilo is a 30 years old married farmer with 2 children. He has a stable job during the coffee sowing season (November to April) and he is also an organic and fair trade producer. After the low production caused by the rust fungus disease, his income is not enough to cover his family´s needs for the year. That´s why he has decided to build the greenhouse you can see in the picture and plant organic tomatoes in it. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay for the materials he needs to end the construction and sow the tomatoes. These are coconut fibre bags, a drip irrigation system and tomato plants. With these inputs he will be able to start the production of hydroponic and 100% organic tomatoes. Commercialization will be through COCAFCAL, the cooperative he is member of. 
This loan will help Danilo earn the income he needs to end the coffee sowing process in his property and maintain his family.

loans.use: To buy the materials he needs to build an organic greenhouse like coconut fibre bags and a drip irrigation system.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 53 años de edad, viuda, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de Chef. 
Ella es inteligente, comprometida con sus estudios, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en la escuela hotelera situada en la zona Central de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por encontrarse rodeada de edificios que albergan a oficinas comerciales, públicas, restaurantes, plazas y todo tipo de comercios, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Veronica es de tez morena, cabello rojizo corto peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia, trabaja y vive en la ciudad, habla español para estudiar y para trabajar. Su vida la comparte con su hermana y su cuñado que trabajan en su negocio propio, viven en una casa propiedad de los 3, construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de chef y se encuentra en 2 año de 3 años que dura la carrera; disfruta cocinando y deleitar a las personas con sabores exquisitos, le gusta entender las combinaciones de esencias, su carácter es de ayuda. Paralelamente trabaja como técnico administrativo de salud, actividad que realiza desde que terminó sus estudios en la universidad hace 28 años, “trabajo como técnico de medicina desde que termine la universidad, quiero independizarme abrir un restaurante…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que le pagan mensualmente, la desventaja son los horarios y la dependencia de sus superiores. Su sueño es ser chef para abrir un restaurante y administrarlo, ella desea realizar el pago de 2 cuotas de su carrera y comprar utensilios de cocina como cubiertos, ollas y sartenes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 28 años que trabaja y 1 años que estudia. 
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para pagar 2 cuotas de su instituto para terminar su carrera profesional y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Verónica, 53, is a widow with no children.  She's intelligent, committed to her studies, persevering, responsible, and very hardworking.  She's studying to be a chef in the hotel program located in the central business district, an area known for commercial offices, public offices, restaurants, plazas, and all types of businesses.  The climate is cold and dry and the temperature varies from 4 to 16 degrees centigrade during the day.

Verónica is dark and wears her reddish hair in a stylish hairstyle.  Her native language is Aymara, which she no longer speaks because she's in school and works and lives in the city.  She speaks Spanish in school and for work.  She lives with her sister and her brother-in-law, who work in their own business.  They live in a house owned by the three of them.  The house is made of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof; they have potable water, electricity, and gas.

She's studying to be a chef and is in her second of three years in the program.  She enjoys cooking and pleasing people with exquisite flavors.  She likes to understand the combination of flavors.  She has a helping personality.

She also works as a medical assistant, a job she has had since she finished college 28 years ago.  "I have worked as a medical assistant since I finished college.  I want to go out on my own and open a restaurant," she said.  The advantage of her job is that she's paid monthly.  The disadvantage is the schedule and her dependence on her superiors.

Verónica's dream is to be a chef and open and operate a restaurant.  She wants to make two payments toward her program and buy kitchen utensils like cutlery and pots and pans.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 28 years she has worked and her one year of study.  For those reasons  Verónica's requesting a loan to make her payments, finish school, and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to pay two bills at her institution so she can finish her professional program and open a restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes, in the future, to have a successful business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Zhanarkul

texts.ru: Жанаркул 28 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает 2 детей. По хозяйству помогает супруг. У Жанаркул - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав около 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Жанаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров и 57 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанаркул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Жанаркул является лидером группы "Онугуу", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Zhanarkul is 28 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising two children.  Her husband helps her around the farm.  Zhanarkul has a specialized secondary education.  As the main source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started in this field almost 10 years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now has five cows and 57 sheep on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of up to 20,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan to buy sheep for fattening and future resale at the market, at a higher price.

Zhanarkul is the leader of the "Onuguu" group which comprises two more people, so a total of three members.  She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan to further increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa y es madre soltera de 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de antojitos o meriendas (enchiladas, pasteles, yuca frita, etc.) ella no estudio.  

María, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de antojitos, este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, quien le enseño de pequeña los oficios del hogar y cuando se quedó sola con sus hijos, tuvo que buscar un negocio para suplir las necesidades de sus hijos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar mercadería para la elaboración de sus productos y además mejorar la cocina donde los elabora. 

María, sueña con ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y que se conviertan en personas de bien, otro de sus sueños es colocar una panadería.
texts.en:
María, 53 years old, is a housewife and a single mother of 3 children. She works selling small dishes or snacks (enchiladas, cakes, fried yucca, etc.). She never went to school. 

María has worked for a number of years making and selling snacks. She learned this business from her mother, who taught the household chores to her when she was young, and when she was left alone with her children, she had to look for a business to supply her children's needs. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to make her products and also to improve the kitchen where she makes them.

María dreams of helping her children study so they become good people. Another of her dreams is to establish a bakery.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to make her products and also to improve the kitchen where she makes them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Kin's Group

texts.en:
Aged 48 years, Kin is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Chhoeng Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She has six children. She earns a living through farming rice, which she has been doing for 28 years, while her husband is a paid construction worker to help support the family. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 47,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR 22,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Kin with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland and to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply to his clients to increase his income to educate his children.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 30 years old and supports six family members. She has been in a hotel business for the last eight years and the business earns her KES 12,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk supply and satisfy her customers in her hotel with quality tea. 

Immaculate plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and add more food stock in her hotel. Her future hope is to have a stable family and expand her hotel.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk supply and to satisfy her customers in her hotel with quality tea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to increase milk production.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking mother of four children and is married to carpenter.  Editha was engaged in gardening as a hobby, but later on, she realized that her garden helped to provide for her family's basic needs since her husband is a contractual carpenter.  

Editha wanted to expand her gardening business. Due to limited land that she has, she started planting produce, such as bell peppers, onions, radishes and other vegetables, in used plastic containers or plastic bags. Editha applied for a loan from PMPC, which will be used to buy fertilizer for her garden.  

Editha hopes that her garden will increase her family's income and allow for saving for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 38-year-old lady from the Nyamira area of Kenya. She practices dairy and poultry farming for a living. Rose joined Marani Widows Women Group that was formed to empower its members to become entrepreneurs and provide for their families. Through the group, she gained access to the financial services offered to rural smallholder farmers by Juhudi Kilimo.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Rose is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She owns 10 heads of poultry. With your money, she is going to double the number of hens she keeps. This will lead to a dramatic increase in the number of eggs produced and hatched. Income generated from this investment will be used by Rose to provide for her family and uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin, her husband and two sons, daughter and mother-in-law live in Marmarashen village in the Shirak region. Angin is engaged in animal keeping and land cultivation work. Her elder son serves in the army, and two children help their mother with farming works, because their father works as a migrant worker in a neighbouring country. On the family's own land, Anghin and her children cultivate potatoes, carrots, beets and grass as well as keeping cows, calves and hens. 
Shirak is considered a poor region, where unemployment is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs make a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. Angin's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation to sustain the farm and earn income for her family.

loans.name: Maria Estella

texts.es:
María es una trabajadora muy perseverante, luchadora, que tiene un negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un empleado, es felizmente casada de su matrimonio tuvo 5 hijos y ella sigue en pie trabajando desde el año 1994 cuando decidió buscar un medio de auto sostenimiento.
Ahora que tiene un negocio consolidado su preocupación es mantenerlo, tener sus proveedores satisfechos y contentos y con los frutos de su trabajo poder arreglar su hogar ya que lucho durante mucho tiempo por el futuro de sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de larvicidas, insecticidas, fungicidas, gallinaza.
Este préstamo será de mucha ayuda para darle sostenimiento a su negocio, esperar un sano y voluminosos cultivo y así venderlo y ponerse al día con sus deudas.
texts.en:
Maria has a farming business and is hard working, persevering and determined. She has one employee. She is happily married and had five children from this marriage. She has been supporting them since 1994 when she decided to seek a means of self sustainment.

Now that she has an established business her concern is maintaining it, keeping its customers satisfied and content and with the fruit of her labors, fixing up her home since she struggled a long time for her children’s future.

She requests a loan to buy larvicide, insecticide, fungicide and chicken manure. This loan will be very helpful in providing support to her business. She hopes for a healthy and voluminous harvest and by selling it, to catch up with her debts.

loans.use: to buy larvicide, insecticide, fungicide and chicken manure.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be experienced. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Srin

texts.en:
Srin lives in a rural village of the Kratie district of Kratie province, Cambodia. She is 57 years old and married with eight children. To support her big family, she has been working as a farmer who has been growing cassava for 39 years. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day to make a living.

This is Srin’s third loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make their living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kelin Xiomara

texts.es:
Kelin, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, vive junto con su hermano, quien se dedica a la pesca artesana, en la misma vivienda también se encuentra la esposa de su hermano y dos sobrinos de 4 y 2 años de edad, ella también se dedica al comercio de mariscos, producto que obtiene su hermano de la pesca.

Kelin, conoce mucho acerca del comercio de pescado y lo ejerce desde hace 5 años, aprendió a comercializarlo gracias a su hermano, en el tiempo de descanso se dedicaba a vender pescado, luego observo que es un negocio muy bueno y le gusto y ahora lo desempeña.

Kelin, utilizará el dinero del crédito, para comprar un motor 15, para el uso de la pesca y comprar redes para la pesca. 

Ella, sueña con mejorar su vivienda para mayor seguridad de su familia, también desea ampliar su negocio, para ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Kelin, 23, studied through high school.  She earns a living in housekeeping.  She lives with her brother, a fisherman, and his wife and their children, ages 4 and 2.

Kelin also earns a living selling shellfish, which she gets from her brother.  She knows a lot about selling fish, which she has done for five years.  She learned the work from her brother.  She used to sell fish when she wasn't working, and she saw it was a very good business.  She liked it and now she's in the business.

Kelin will use the money from the loan to buy a 15 horsepower motor to use for fishing as well as fishing nets.
