She dreams of improving her home for her family's greater security.  She also wants to expand her business so she can provide quality customer service.

loans.use: to buy a 15 horsepower motor for fishing as well as fishing nets

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant à sa charge. Agée de 47 ans, Essi vend des habits et chaussures pour bébé dans son quartier et en se promenant dans les environs pour avoir son revenu. Essi s’approvisionne une fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour acheter des habits. Essi désire faire plus de bénéfice pour permette une bonne éducation à son enfant pour son épanouissement.
texts.en: Essi is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with one child in her care. 47 years old, Essi sells cloths and shoes for infants in her neighborhood and while walking around nearby to make a profit. Essi resupplies once per month and is requesting this loan to buy cloths. Essi wants to make more of a profit to provide a good education for the flourishing of her child.

loans.use: to buy 12 packs of cloths.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of four grown children from Merida, Leyte. Aida has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Aida is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Cosmans

texts.en:
Cosmans is 24 years old. He is married with one child aged four years old whom he supports.

He operates a motorbike which has lasted for six years now. He is taking his first loan to repair and maintain his motorbike and hopes the income generated will help him to purchase another one.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is 42 years old and she lives in the village of Gagarin, in Gegharkunik region. Natalya lives with her son. Her daughter is already married and lives abroad with her family. 

Natalya has vocational education with the specialty of accountant, but no work experience in this field. She is engaged in farming and agriculture, and at her farm, she has sheep, lambs and a calf. With the help of her son, she sells mutton from her farm, and also potatoes that she cultivates on her plot of land.

Natalya needs this loan greatly as she has health problems and needs this loan for personal medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different spices for his store to expand his business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 28-year-old woman who puts her heart and soul into her mixed farm and her family. She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. To earn a living, she works as a dairy farmer. She has been a dairy farmer for five years now. Her primary source of income is milk, eggs, maize and veggies.

Juliana is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to pay for poultry. This new venture will enable her to diversify her product portfolio and to help her manage the risks resulting from her single (dairy) product line. With poultry, she will be able to sell eggs and other poultry products in the market to boost her income. The income will help her pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to small farmers like her and for making financial loans to farmers affordable. She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing poultry

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as intelligent. He operates a poultry farm where he sells chickens. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His primary customers are locals and hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the outbreak of poultry diseases. He will use the Kes 105,000 loan to buy more stock of poultry. He hopes that in the future, he will have a comfortable life. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy more stock of poultry

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of two children, from Merida, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog raising business. She is asking to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will be used to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Bella hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. She also wants to save money for her children’s future schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a sari-sari or variety store owner from Merida, Leyte. She is married and has two children. Carmelita has been in the business for more than 15 years now. She is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods. A loan will enable her to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Carmelita hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides, herbicides, and gloves and gumboots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, charcoal, flour, and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, charcoal, and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will live well. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, charcoal, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jhun Rey

texts.en:
Jhun Rey is a 19 years old and single. He wants to help his parents make a living. He engaged in a transport business to earn income. He decided to take a loan to pay for the registration of the motorcycle so that his transport motorcycle can continue to cater passengers.

Jhun Rey wants to save money from his business income and improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to pay for motor registration.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine, her mother-in-law and two sons and husband live in Krashen village of Shirak region. 

The whole family is involved in the farming business. They own a farm which includes cows, calves, sheep, hens, and bees; theyalso cultivate wheat and potatoes for family use and for sale as well. 

Narine's elder son used to work abroad as a migrant laborer and help his family financially. This year he has decided to stay in his motherland, develop and sustain his farm, and be together with his family. 

To enlarge their farm, this family needs some financial support. So Narine has applied for this loan to purchase three cows, wheat seeds, fertilizer and five colonies of bees. 

Shirak is a poor region: the unemployment rate there is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs make a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region. Narine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them to access market and earn living.

loans.use: to pay for three cows, wheat seeds, fertilizer and five colonies of bees to enlarge the farm and make farming business profitable for the family.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 47 years old and lives in Southern Ghour; she lives in a very simple house with her family that consists of her husband and her nine children.
Aida works hard to give her children all they need to complete their education and find good work. Because of the needs of her kids that increase day after day, her husband became unable to cover all household and educational expenses. All this leads Aida to expand her work and buy summer clothes to sell, therefore she has applied for a loan to buy clothes and more products to sell and increase her income to help her husband and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more summer clothes to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: El Higueron Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario el Higueron lo integran tres socios laboriosos que cada día luchan para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias a través de sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Rosa una señora que tiene la edad de 40 años, su negocio es la compra-venta de cerdos en pies, este negocio lo impulsó hace seis años de la liquidación obtenida del trabajo anterior, es el tercer ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona cumplida en sus obligaciones, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cuarto cerdos en pie (pequeños) y alimentos para estos, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mantener el negocio y espera continuar así. El resto de los integrantes son, el señor Juan que tiene la edad de 48 años y comercializa carne de res en su domicilio desde hace tres años, y la señora María de 29 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The solidary group El Higueron is composed of three hard-working partners who struggle daily to improve the life conditions of their families through their businesses.  Rosa, 40, is the one who coordinates.  Her business is the purchase and sales of live pigs.  She started this business six years ago with the liquidation of her previous work.  It is the third cycle in which ADIM offers her financing for her business and she has demonstrated herself to be a person who complies with her obligations.
She is requesting this loan to buy four live pigs (small) and feed for them.  With the previous loans, she has managed to maintain the business and she hopes to continue to do so.
The rest of the partners are Juan, 48, who has beef selling beef in his house for three years and Maria, 29, who has owned a small store for two years.

loans.use: to buy four live pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: La Concepción Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran tres socios emprendedores que se han fijado como objetivo principal el invertir en materia prima para sus negocios y así crecer en sus negocios. Quien lo coordina es Alma una señora que a sus 51 años de edad comercializa calzado en departamentos de la zona norte del país, este negocio lo inicio hace veintidós años con ayuda de su cuñado, ya que él le brindo crédito con productos de calzado. Es el vigésimo tercer ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus cuotas de pago, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de sandalias de plataformas, sandalias bajas, sandalias tacón fino y sandalias para niñas, se ha propuesto abrir nuevos mercados para incrementar los productos ofrecidos. Otro de los integrantes es el señor Darío, quien tiene la edad de 58 años y es propietario de un taller de zapatería desde hace veintiún años, y Gladis que a sus 29 años ofrece el servicio de venta de fritanga, además hecha y vende tortillas y tiene una experiencia de siete años.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 3 enterprising members who have a goal of investing in raw materials for their businesses.  This way, their businesses can grow.  Alma is the coordinator of the group.  She is 51 years old, and has a business selling shoes in the departments in the northern part of the country.  She started this business 22 years ago with the help of her brother-in-law.  He provided her with a loan to buy shoes.  This is the 23rd loan cycle that she has participated in with ADIM, and she has shown herself to be responsible with her payments.  She is requesting this loan to buy platform sandals, flat sandals, high-heeled sandals, and children's sandals.  She is proposing to open new markets to increase the number of products that she sells.  

Other members of this group include Dario, who is 58 and has had a shoemaking workshop for 21 years, and Gladis, 29, who sells fried food and also makes and sells tortillas.  Gladis has 7 years of experience with her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos ya se casaron, actualmente vive con su esposo el cual es electricista y repara aparatos eléctricos.

María, vende panes y refrescos desde hace 2 años, ella toda su vida se ha dedicado a ser comerciante, fue de esa manera que logro que sus hijos crecieran y no les faltara nada; tiene su negocio en la terminal de buses de su municipio, trabaja todos los días de 8 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde.

María, necesita el crédito para iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, ya que solo hay un puesto en las cercanías de su lugar de trabajo.

María, sueña con tener su puesto de frutas y verduras y luego comprar un vehículo y mandar a vender frutas y verduras a las comunidades.
texts.en:
Maria did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are married.  At this time, she is living with her husband, who is an electrician who also repairs electric appliances.

Maria has been selling bread and drinks for 2 years.  All of her life she has been a trader; this is how she raised her children so that they would have everything the needed.  Her business is located in a bus depot in her municipality.  She works every day from 8am until 4pm. 

Maria needs a loan to start a new business selling fruits and vegetables, because there is only one such business in the area near her place of work.  

Maria dreams of having a fruit and vegetable stand, and later buying a car so she could distribute fruit and vegetables in the communities.

loans.use: to start a new business selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yesly Irania

texts.es:
Irania, de 21 años de edad, está soltera y está encuentra estudiando bachillerato general a distancia, en una escuela vecina a la comunidad, ella vive actualmente con sus padres. 

Irania, estudia solo los fines de semana y durante los demás días, trabaja junto con su madre en el negocio de venta de ropa casa por casa, tienen aproximadamente 5 años de realizar esta labor, ellas también se dedican a la venta de tortillas, la venta de ropa solo la realizan por las tardes.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar más ropa, especialmente ropa para mujer, ya que es la más se vende en la zona.

Irania, sueña con tener un negocio grande y rentable, porque eso le permitiría seguir con sus estudios y lograr la meta que tanto anhela, que es ser maestra y ayudar económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Irania, 21, is single and is studying in a distance learning program for a high school degree at a school near her community.  She currently lives with her parents.

Irania only studies on the weekends; during the other days she works with her mother in a business selling clothing door to door.  They have been doing this work for about 5 years.  They also sell tortillas; they sell clothing only in the afternoons.

Irania will use this loan to buy more clothing, particularly clothing for women, because this is what sells the most in her area.

Irania dreams of having a big and profitable business, because this would allow her to continue with her education and achieve the goal she desires the most: to become a teacher and help her parents financially.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old mother of two, living in Kigumo, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, she owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support her family. Her primary source of income has been milk, poultry, crops and some small personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income.

Mary passionately loves dairy farming, but one challenge she has been facing is lack of water for home consumption and irrigating her farm. Most of the rainwater goes to waste and therefore Mary is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a water tank. With the water tank she will be able to harvest and store rainwater in the tank. This loan will be of much help because Mary will not be walking for long distances in search of this precious commodity. The tank will assist her in irrigating her farm, hence increasing productivity and income levels. All that Mary waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina San Antonio está integrado por 17 mujeres muy emprendedoras de la ciudad de Santaní, actualmente están en el décimo ciclo. El grupo es muy unido y solidario. 
La señora Dionicia se dedica a la cría de animales y ventas de huevos de su propia producción, comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones y charlas pudo salir adelante ayudando a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere salir adelante. Todas las otras integrantes están muy contentas de pertenecer a este grupo de emprendedoras
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para poder usarlo en la cría de animales. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando cada día.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Antonio” includes 17 enterprising women from the city of Santaní. They are currently participating in their 10th loan cycle. The group is extremely close-knit and unified.

Sra. Dionicia raises animals and sells eggs that her chickens produce. She says that thanks to the training seminars and discussions, she has been able to press forward and help her husband with the household expenses. Dionicia is a hardworking and self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead. The other members are pleased to belong to this entrepreneurial group.

Dionicia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of balanced feed that she will use for raising her animals. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can continue growing and moving forward each day.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Del Comejen Group

texts.es: Cuatro microempresarias se unen para solicitar por primera vez el financiamiento en ADIM para sus negocios y así capitalizar sus negocios. Quien lo coordina es Seneyda una mujer que tiene la edad de 26 años, casada y madre de tres hijos, quienes han sido su mayor motivación para seguir superándose; ofrece el servicio de venta de comida y fresco en una tramo de la carretera a Tisma, este negocio lo impulsó hace más de un año con ayuda de su hermana, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es maseca, aceite, repollo, carne de res, carne de cerdo, arroz, naranja agrías, etc., se ha propuesto mejorar las condiciones de su local. El equipo que trabaja con ella son, Juana que tiene la edad de 26 años y se dedica a la venta de tortilla, frijol y enchilada en su domicilio y en las calles de su comunidad, Ericka de 26 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos AVON y Arabela en los alrededores de su domicilio, y Danelia que tiene la edad de 23 años y comercializa calzado y productos AVON en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Four micro-entrepreneurs got together in order to request financing from ADIM for the first time for their businesses and thus capitalize their businesses.  Seneyda, 26, is the one who coordinates.  She is married and a mother of three children who have been her greatest motivation to continue pushing forward.  She offers the service of food and refreshment sales on a stretch of the highway to Tisma.  She started this business a year ago with the help of her sister.
The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of bulk grains such as corn meal, oil, cabbage, beef, pork, rice, bitter oranges, etc.  She has proposed to improve the conditions of her stall.  
The team that works with her are: Juana, 26, who makes a living selling tortillas, beans, and enchiladas in the streets of her community; Erika, 26, who makes a living selling Avon and Arabella cosmetics near her house;  and Danelia, 23, who sells footwear and Avon products in her community.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains.

loans.name: Charose

texts.en: Charose is a sari-sari store owner from Merida, Leyte. She has two children. Charose has operated her sari-sari store business for several years now. Charose is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and bread and biscuits, among others. A loan will help her improve her inventories, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Charose hopes to make her store a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and bread and biscuits, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to supply milk, in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 44 years old. He is married to Loise and they are blessed with three children who are 14, 9 and 3 years old.

He has had a farming business for 24 years, and is currently earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. He has borrowed KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya after successfully paying back his previous loan. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, pesticides, gum boots, and a sprinkler, as well as to hire laborers. 

With the anticipated profits, Nelson will be be able to cater for his family's needs as well as repay his loan.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable farming business, secure more market for his farm products, provide a better education to his kids and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings,  pesticides, gum boots, and a sprinkler, as well as to hire laborers

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuation of prices. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the number of litres of milk produced per day and meet the demands of his increased number of clients.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she grows tea. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought which affects farming. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Azatan village in the Shirak region with her husband and daughter. While her husband works abroad as a seasonal migrant worker, Aida and her daughter run their family farm. They cultivate barley and potatoes and due to their hard work, they gather a good harvest and sell it. 

To enlarge their cultivation work and boost the productivity of the farm, Aida asks lenders to support her with this loan, so she can purchase potato seeds (1 ton) for the coming new cultivation season.
 
Because the region where their village is located is considered as poor and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses.  Aida's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds (1 ton) to increase her potato cultivation in the coming new season,  gather a good harvest and earn income for the family's basic needs

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 26 años de edad, habita en la capital e Colombia, Bogotá, con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 3 años. En el año 2013 conoció inició su propio negocio asociada con su cuñada, quien tenía el negocio de comercializar con carne por kilo y junto a su cónyuge se asociaron para lograr un mayor capital  de trabajo. En su negocio compran la res y la despresan para venderla por libras o kilos entre la comunidad vecina quienes son sus principales clientes, entre restaurantes y familias en general.  Poco a poco le han ido agregando pollo, carne porcina, pescado y huevos, con el fin de tener una diversificada oferta, tal como les gusta a su clientela, para quienes atienden desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. El transportador del matadero es quien les provisiona diariamente la carne y ofrecen   domicilio, pero es un gran desafío, porque no cuentan con un vehículo propio que le ayude a mejorar los tiempos de respuesta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una motocicleta, con la cual resolverá su desafío relacionado con la entrega del servicio a domicilio, para mejorar su proceso de distribución. Judith y su cónyuge tienen  un gran sueño de prosperidad y es el de más adelante es lograr adquirir su propia casa y trabajar consistentemente para incrementar sus ingresos familiares y apoyar una educación de calidad para su hijo, lo cual es el éxito de su credikiva..
texts.en:
Judy is 26 years old. She lives in Bogota, the capital of Colombia, with her husband and their three-year-old child. 

In 2013, she started her own business in partnership with her sister-in-law, who had already a business selling meat by the kilo. They formed a partnership to generate a larger working capital.

They buy the animal and cut it up into different pieces to sell them by the pound or by the kilo to the people from the neighbouring community, who, between restaurants and families in general, are their major customers. 

Little by little, they have been adding other products such as chicken, pork, fish, and eggs in order to diversify their offer, just as their customers like it. Their business hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

The driver from the abattoir is who supplies the meat to them daily. 

They offer home delivery services, but it proves to be a great challenge because they don't have a vehicle to help them improve their delivery times. 

For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan. This is the first loan that she is asking from the Fundación Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy a motorcycle, with which she will solve the challenge of making home deliveries and improve their distribution process.

Judith and her husband dream of becoming prosperous. Through their constant work, they want to increase their family income, be able to acquire their own home in the future, and provide their child with a quality education—and therein will lie the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to make home deliveries.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, ya que en su infancia la pobreza era demasiada para él y su familia, así que desde pequeño tuvo que empezar a trabajar, está soltero y vive solo con su padre, porque sus padres se separaron.

José, tiene una pequeña lancha con su equipo de pesca, que con mucho esfuerzo ha conseguido comprar, se dedica a la pesca desde muy pequeño, ya que acompañaba a su padre cuando el hacia esa labor; sale al mar de lunes a viernes desde la madrugada, hasta que regresa en la tarde.

José, solicita el crédito para reparar el motor de su lancha, porque se ha dañado y sin el no puede salir a pescar; con la reparación de su motor, podrá volver a su labor y sus ingresos se estabilizaran, ya que la pesca es el unico ingreso que el tiene.

José, sueña en un futuro no muy lejano, comprar una lancha más y otro equipo de pesca para que su padre vaya a pescar en la otra lancha, de esa manera incrementaran los ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old, only completed third grade due to his family's poverty. He had to work from a young age. He is single and lives with only with his father, as his parents are separated.

José has a small boat and fishing equipment that he bought with much effort on his part. He has worked fishing since he was a boy, accompanying his father when he used to fish. He fishes Monday through Friday, from the early morning until his return in the afternoon.

José seeks a loan to repair his boat's motor as it is damaged and without it he cannot go out and fish. With his motor's repair he will be able to return to his work and his income will stabilize, as fishing is the only income that he has.

José dreams of buying another fishing boat and set of fishing equipment so that his father can fish with the other boat and in this way increase their income.

loans.use: to repair his boat's motor as it is damaged.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, 53 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, vende comida, frutas y verduras, está acompañada y vive con su esposo, su hija y sus dos nietos de 9 y 5 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la producción de granos básicos.

Candelaria, conoce muy bien acerca del comercio de comida rápida, frutas y verduras y lo ejerce desde hace 5 años, ella viaja al mercado central a traer el producto y lo transporta en auto-bus, viaja 25 kilómetros, también se levanta temprano a preparar los alimentos, también su hija le apoya en la elaboración de los alimentos. 

Candelaria, utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, carne, entre otros,  para la elaboración de los alimentos. 

Candelaria, sueña con mejorar su vivienda, para mayor seguridad de su familia, ampliar su negocio para ofrecer un servicio de calidad para sus cliente y apoyar a su nieto para que se prepare académicamente.
texts.en:
Candelaria, age 53, went to school up through first grade.  She sells food, fruits, and vegetables.  She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband, her daughter, and her two grandchildren, ages 9 and 5.  Her husband works in the production of staple grains.

Candelaria is very familiar with the business of fast food, fruits, and vegetables, and she’s been practicing it for 5 years.  She travels to the central market, bringing her product, and she transports it by bus.  She travels 25 kilometers.  She also gets up early to prepare the food.  Her daughter also helps her with the food production.

Candelaria will use the money from the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and meat, among other things, to prepare food.

Candelaria dreams of improving her house, for better security for her family, and of expanding her business to offer quality service to her customers and to support her grandson so he can get an education.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, and meat, among other things, for food production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell to her customers in order to have a successful business.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario “Nuevo Horizonte” está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedora que solicitan por vigésima ocasión el financiamiento de ADIM para sus negocios, es coordinado por Adriana una señora que tiene la edad de 41 años, propietaria de un taller de costura, este lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio, la principal clientela son propietarios de tramos en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela gabardina, entre tela, dacron, gruesa de zipper, bolsas de botones, conos de hilos, cinta de mantequilla, etc., con los financiamientos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la producción de su negocio por lo que sus ingresos han mejorado, aportando más a los gastos familiares. Las otras socias son las señoras, María una señora que a sus 64 años se dedica a la venta de leña y nacatamales en su domicilio y cuenta con una experiencia de doce años, y Cándida de 47 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace doce años.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Horizonte” group consists of three members who seek their twentieth financing from ADIM for their respective businesses. The group is coordinated by Adriana, a 41 year old woman who has a seamstress shop located in her home. Her main customers are stall owners from the local market. She seeks a loan to buy gabardine, fabric, Dacron, a bundle of zippers, bags of buttons, spools of thread, fabric interface, etc. With the previous loans she has been able to increase production in her business as her income has increased, supporting more of the family's expenses.

The other members are 64 year old Maria who has been selling firewood and traditional food from her home for 12 years; and 47 year old Candida who has been selling fruit in the market for 12 years.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as gabardine, fabric, Dacron, bundle of zippers, bags of buttons, spools of thread, interface, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to supply milk to get more income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 36-year-old lady from Western Kenya. She is married and blessed with one child but also supports another child who is 11 years old.

She sells foodstuff like chips and snacks, a business she has been doing for the last six years and generates a monthly income of Kes 7,000. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock of foodstuffs.

With the anticipated profits, Everline will be able to restock her supplies as well as repay her loan.

Her dream is have a better living standard.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik greatly enjoyed her first deal with Kiva which really developed her business. She already decided to have her second deal with hope that again Kiva support will be helpful and profitable for her business and her family as well. Hasmik lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Her clothes trading business at the city’s wholesale market is aging the only income for her family, and she perfectly organizes it thanks to her beloved husband.
She will be happy if she receives this loan which will again develop her business. With this loan she wants to buy a new assortment of clothes for spring and summer seasons.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes for spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Helen earns a living through a hog-raising business. Helen has been in the business for more than 10 years now.  Helen is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and for animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and for animal feed

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kratie province’s Kratie district, Sreypov is a 32-year-old mother of three children. She has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 20 years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 43,000 KHR and is able to save about 20,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

This is the second loan for Sreypov with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group and seeking a loan. As the leader, Sreypov will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Las Mujeres De Jucanya Group

texts.es:
Juana (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa roja y corte negro) es una mujer de cincuenta y dos años es casada, tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre dieciocho años y veintinueve, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juana para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida desde hace quince años, ella eligió esta actividad, pues su especialidad y pasión por la comida la orillo a dedicarse a este negocio.
Juana es una gran cocinera, es por ello que su pequeño negocio tiene mucha demanda, por lo que ella ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar leña, maíz, frijol, arroz en quintal para contar con más materiales y seguir preparando comida para  satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela, ella con el afán de conseguir el crédito a organizado a un grupo de mujeres para juntos alcanzar su objetivo.
El gran sueño de esta gran mujer es contar con este crédito para que pueda mejorar sus ingresos y poder comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana (the first from the right in the photograph with the red blouse and black skirt), 51, is married and has a beautiful family of five children between the ages of 18 and 29.  This family lives in the community of Sololá.
In order to generate income, Juana has been making a living preparing and selling meals for 15 years.  She chose this work because her specialty and passion for food pushed her to dedicate herself to this business.
Juana is a great cook.  For this reason, her little business has great demand.  Because of this, she sees the need to request a loan which she will use to purchase firewood, corn, beans, and rice by the sack in order to have more materials and to continue preparing meals in order to satisfy the needs of her customers.  With the desire to obtain the loan, she organized a group of women in order to reach her objective.  
The great dream of this great woman is to count on this loan so she can increase her income and be able to buy a plot of land in order to construct her house.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, beans, and rice in order to prepare meals.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Traing district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Saren, 47, is married with four children. She and her husband grow rice and raise cows. Having been in the business for 15 years, they can earn about US $6 per day. 

Saren has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fee. She hopes to keep her son in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fee

loans.name: Las Pollitas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Pollitas integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras solicitan por segunda ocasión un financiamiento en ADIM con el objetivo de capitalizar sus negocios. Es coordinado por  Maribel una joven que a sus 20 años de edad, y madre de un hijo, comercializa ropa nueva en el mercado de Granada y cuenta con una experiencia de dos años en este negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de ropa interior, talladores, camiseta cuello V, camisolines, camisola, etc. El resto de los integrantes son las señoras, Elba de 57 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería, y Dilma de 29 años de edad, ella comercializa frutas y verduras en una plaza del Centro Comercial de la Capital.
texts.en:
The “Las Pollitas” solidarity group is made up of three enterprising women, who, for the second time, are requesting funding from ADIM, with the goal of growing their businesses.  It is coordinated by Maribel, a young woman who, at age 20 and as the mother of a son, sells new clothing in the market in Granada and has two years of experience in this business.  She is requesting the loan to buy undergarments, boxer shorts, V-neck t-shirts, chemises, camisoles, etc.  

The rest of the members are Elba, age 57, owner of a convenience store, and Dilma, age 29, who sells fruits and vegetables in the central market plaza in the capital city.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, boxer shorts, V-neck t-shirts, chemises, camisoles, etc.

loans.name: Jisson

texts.en: Jisson is a 32-year-old married man and a father of two children from Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through a hog-raising business. Jisson has been in the business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income. Jisson is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. Jisson believes that a loan will help him improve his business as well as his income. In the future, Jisson hopes to make his business a success and have it be profitable. He also wants to save money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is a businesswoman from Merida, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than three years now.  Bernadette would like a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. Bernadette believes that through this she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his taxi. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in fuel prices. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to service and fuel the taxi. His business goal is to buy another car within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved life. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and fuel the taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him increase milk production to supply to customers and get income to educate his children.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
This is Lorie, 40 years old and resident of Batasan Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a painter, and together they have one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating their own business. At this time, Lorie is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorie operates a "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins in the machine. There is more need now than ever before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes such as writing a resume or for office documentation. She also provides computer usage to customers who just love to surf the net and engage in social networks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Lorie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing her loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her Piso Net units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lorie dreams of setting up new business opportunities so she could increase her profits. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her Piso Net units.

loans.name: Ada Veronica

texts.es:
Ada, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene una hija, en su casa vive también su mamá y una hermana.

Ada, tiene un comedor desde hace 2 años, el cual era de su madre, pero por motivos de salud su mamá, ella decidió  administrarlo, desde ese momento es propietaria.- El comedor lo tiene ubicado en su casa y su hermana es quien le ayuda en la elaboración de la comida, el horario de atención es de 7 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 2 mesas con sillas para el negocio y también una refrigeradora nueva, ya que la que posee está bien deteriorada.

A futuro Ada, sueña con que su comedor sea el preferido de los habitantes del lugar, tener otro comedor que sea administrado por su hermana y además, desea ver a su bebe convertida en una profesional.
texts.en:
Ada, age 35, went to school up through ninth grade.  She is in a common-law marriage, and her partner works in agriculture.  She has a daughter.  Her mother and a sister also live in her house.

Ada has had a small restaurant for two years.  It was her mother’s, but for reasons related to her mother’s health, Ada started running it, and from that moment she became the owner.  The restaurant is located in her house, and her sister helps her prepare the food.  Hours of operation are from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy two tables with chairs for the business, and also a new refrigerator, since the one she has is quite dilapidated.

In the future, Ada dreams that her restaurant will be the preferred one for the local population, and that she will have another restaurant run by her sister.  Also, she wants to see her baby become a working professional.

loans.use: to buy two tables with chairs, as well as a new refrigerator for the business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Martha started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Sengera, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. 

A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Martha believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Martha waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoern is a 43-year-old mother of three children. She earns a living through farming rice and sesame, while her husband works as a paid worker. She has been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her about 59,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

Sokhoern is in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: La Retama Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA RETAMA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa ella es casada y tiene 35 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite,la socia es una mujert emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de estos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.

Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “La Retama”. This bank is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Carmen Rosa. She is 35 years old, married, and has one child. Carmen Rosa works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is able to help her children get ahead as a result of her business. Carmen Rosa works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She has been in business for five years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other members engage in businesses that involve selling handicrafts, clothes, groceries, and food.

This loan is part of a line of credit products from Asociación Arariwa known as “Credi Yapa”, which is offered to borrowers who have a good credit history. This group meets the qualifications.

Carmen Rosa is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Carmen Alexandra

texts.es:
Cojimíes es un destino turístico debido a que tiene muchos atractivos naturales, está ubicado en el Cantón Pedernales, su oferta gastronómica como camarones, langostas, langostinos diversos tipos de pescados, almejas, jaibas, cangrejos, conchas y muchos más frutos del mar es deliciosa, sus habitantes se dedican a la pesca, aquí se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Zaineb.
En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 39  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 16 y 7 años los mismos que estudian uno en la Universidad,  uno en la escuela y dos en el Colegio. El cónyuge es pescador, viven en casa propia.
Doña Alexandra para salir adelante junto a su familia tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  ahí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su cónyuge le ayuda en su trabajo cuando él puede y está desocupado, pero por lo general es ella  la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar porque además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene 19años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en  implementar una panadería y para esto necesita un horno, latas e ingredientes para elaborar el pan. Este es su primer ciclo  y la invito a formar parte la cuñada, le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Su meta es poner un negocio de ropa, una boutique.
texts.en:
Cojimies is a tourist destination because it has many natural attractions. It is located in the Pedernales Canton. Its gastronomic offering such as shrimp, lobsters, prawns, diverse types of fish, clams, crabs, oysters, and much more seafood is delicious. Its inhabitants earn a living by fishing, and here the members of the Zaineb Credit Group meet.

This is where Alexandra lives. She is 39 years old, and is in a common-law marriage from which she has four children ages 21, 18, 16, and 7. All of them study; one in the university, one in high school and two in middle school. Her partner is a fisherman, and they live in their own home.

In order to get ahead with her family, Alexandra has a grocery store in her house. She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, soaps, legumes, vegetables, and fruits. She works every day from 7:00 until 10:00 and sometimes even later. Her partner helps her in her work when he is free and he can, but in general she is the one who is in the business since it is where she likes to be because beyond earning a living she is entertained and informed of the news that is happening around her. She has been in this business for 19 years, and it is going well for her. 

She will use this loan to implement a bakery, and to do this she needs an oven, trays, and ingredients to make bread. This is her first cycle, and her sister-in-law invited her to be a part of the group. She likes it because she has made more friends in the group. Her goal is to start a clothing business; a boutique.

loans.use: to buy an oven, trays, and ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Maria Catrina

texts.en: Maria Catrina is a married woman and a mother of a one-year-old child from Merida, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now. Maria Catrina needs an additional income for the expansion of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed. Maria Cristina hopes that though this loan, she will be able to improve her business and generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham was born in 1967. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her husband, who appears in the photo instead of her, because she is a conservative woman. He is retired from the army. Siham and her husband are blessed with five kids. 

Siham has been trying her best to support her husband financially by taking a loan for him to expand his work, which is fattening cattle in order to sell it again.  Lately her husband needs to buy more tools and food for the cattle to increase his products, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason Siham asked for a loan to help her husband buy the feed and agriculture materials he needs to improve his work and raise his income.

loans.use: To help her husband buy the feed and agriculture materials he needs

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel is a young farmer who is 29 years old. He lives in the village named Varser in the Gegharkunik region. He lives here with his wife, his two-year-old son and his parents. Gnel never worked anywhere and he has been in farming and agriculture for five years. His father helps him a lot both with the work around the farm and with his advice connected with its care. 

On his farm Gnel has cows, a heifer, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. Gnel says that he feels great responsibility since now farming is the only source of income in his family. He tries to arrange and overcome all the work about it in a way so that with the profit of it he is able to solely support his family’s financial needs. His farm products are milk, meat and macun (national dairy-product). 

His plot of land is also a rich one. Here he has apple, peach, fig and mulberry trees, and he sells harvest from these, sometimes right from his house, and sometimes he takes it out looking for buyers. Gnel asks for this loan as he wants to enrich his farm with one more calf and he also wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to enrich his farm with one more calf, as well as to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of the products. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier of vegetables in the whole country within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vya Renda está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y por medio de este programa quieren ir mejorando la situación de vida de cada una.
La Sra. Vilda mostro en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, una situación de pobreza extrema, pero ella sigue esperanzada en poder seguir creciendo, es por ello que está dedicándose y esforzándose. Ella vende comestibles que hace desde muy tempranas horas y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio y otras zonas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carnes, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group “Vya Renda” has taken the poverty elimination survey. By participating in this program, each member will be able to improve her living situation.

The most recent poverty elimination survey indicated that Sra. Vilda is in an extreme poverty situation. However, she continues to be hopeful that she can keep growing. For this reason, she remains dedicated and strives to do her best. Vilda begins selling food in the early morning hours and then goes out into her neighborhood and other areas in order to sell as a street vendor.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing food. These items include meat, condiments, vegetables, greens, and other ingredients. As a result, she can continue her work just as before. Vilda appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, greens, and other supplies for preparing the food that she sells.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra trabajando como secretario administrativo, está cursando la carrera de Odontología, por medio de esto trata de ser un buen profesional para abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Él es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose works as an administrative secretary, but he is also studying for a degree in Dentistry. Through his studies, he hopes to become a successful professional and be able to open doors in the workplace.

Jose is a person who is striving to make something out of his life. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his degree fees so that he can continue as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.ru: Этибар, 50 лет, замужем, 8 детей, самому старшему- 30 лет, младшему сыну - 8 лет. Семья большая, все очень дружные, вместе ведут свое дело, поддерживая и помогая в трудной ситуации. Трое старших сыновей на заработках, они регулярно, каждый месяц высылают родителям денежные средства. У Этибар среднее образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве имеется: 5 коров, 21 овца, 0,50 Га арендованной земельной доли и 1,0 Га собственной, на которой она выращивает хлопок, клевер и кукурузу. В общей сложности деятельность Этибар приносит до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Конечно же этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи, Этибар посоветовалась с мужем и детьми и в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Этибар планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, что позволит увеличить доходы семьи и накопить средства на постройку дома для сыновей.
texts.en: Etibar is 50 years old, married, and the mother of eight children.  Her oldest child is 30, the youngest is 8 years old. Everyone in Etibar's family is very friendly; they work together, supporting and helping one another in difficult situations. Etibar's three oldest sons are making a living as migrant workers.  Every month they send money to their parents.  Etibar has a secondary education.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now has five cows and 21 sheep on her farm.  She also grows cotton, clover and corn on 0.5 hectare of leased land and on one hectare of her own land.  In total, Etibar's activity brings her a monthly income of up to 20,000 som (KGS), which is obviously not sufficient to provide a decent life to her family.  After discussing the matter with her husband and children, and in order to further grow her farming business, Etibar decided to turn to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and to request a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  Etibar is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business, which will help her to increase her family's income and also to save some money to build a house for her sons.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to boost her family's income.

loans.name: Señor Pasion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth ella es soltera y tiene 46 años; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Señor Pasión”. The bank is located in the District of Yucay in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Elizabeth. She is 46 years old and single. Elizabeth works as a primary school teacher and her work hours are from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. She has been in this profession for eight years and is doing very well. Her dream is to open a clothing business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house.

The member who appears in the attached photo arrived after the meeting because he had requested permission to be late because of work reasons. The other group members engage in businesses such as providing Internet services, selling clothes, selling groceries, and operating a restaurant.

Elizabeth is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que pago sus cuotas y pudo seguir estudiando, es una persona muy soñadora que lucha por sus metas y objetivos, es por ello que se esta esforzando cada día.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación ya que esta terminando su carrera. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Susana is studying for a degree in Accounting. She says that her previous loan was a great help since she was able to pay her fees and continue her studies. Susana is a dreamer who strives to achieve her goals and objectives. For this reason, she strives to do her best each day.

Susana is requesting a new loan so that she can pay her degree fees and finish her studies. She appreciates this opportunity she has received so that she can grow.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.es: Silvestra es una señora trabajadora que a sus 52 años de edad demuestra que para trabajar solo se necesitan tener los deseos de superación, ella se dedica a vender frutas en el mercado de Masaya, este negocio lo impulsó hace veintiún años con ayuda financiera de su esposo, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar y diversificar los productos que ofrece, ya que inicio con poco. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de frutas como es mandarinas, tamarindo, mango, aguacate, naranja agrias, etc., una de sus metas es continuar creciendo en las ventas esto a través de la diversificación de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Silvestra is a hard-working woman, who at her 52 years of age, shows that to work you only need to have the desire to succeed. She makes a living by selling fruit at the Masaya market. She started this business 21 years ago with the financial support of her husband.

With the previous loans, she has succeeded in expanding and diversifying the products she offers, after starting with little. She is requesting this loan to buy fruit, such as mandarin oranges, tamarinds, mangoes, avocados, bitter oranges, etc.

One of her goals is to continue increasing sales by diversifying the products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy fruit, in order to diversify her products offered

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, es la única persona que trabaja para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, sus actividades económicas son el cultivo de granos básicos y realizar trabajos de albañilería, es una persona reconocida en su comunidad por su honestidad y por realizar trabajos de calidad.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas con les que dará un mejor desarrollo a sus cultivos, espera obtener una cosecha abundante para incrementar sus ventas e ingresos para subsistir con su núcleo familiar y pagar sus deudas.
La aspiración que Juan tiene es que sus hijos estudien a nivel universitario para que tengan oportunidad de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and children. He is the only person who is working in order to cover their household needs. His business activities include cultivating basic staple crops and obtaining jobs as a bricklayer. He is known in his community as a person who is honest and performs quality work.

Juan will invest in farming supplies so that his crops can develop well. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest so that he can increase his sales, have income to sustain his family, and be able to repay his debts.

Juan aspires for his children to study at the university level so that they will have the opportunity to claim a better future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies so that he can provide better care for his crops.

loans.name: Kachkyn

texts.ru: Качкын, 54 года, замужем, есть сын, ему 12 лет. Качкын работает учителем математики в школе вот уже 37 лет, супруг работает в войсковой части. Ежемесячная заработная плата Качкын составляет 15,308 сом (KGS). Качкын начала строительство дома для своей семьи, однако ей не хватает средств на накрытие крыши. Поэтому Качкын обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Доходы от заработной платы Качкын и дальше планирует вкладывать в строительство дома и хочет накопить на обучение сына в одном из лучших университетов страны.
texts.en: Kachkyn is 54 years old and she is married with a 12-year-old son.  She has worked as a math teacher at a school for 37 years and her husband works in a military job.  The work Kachkyn does brings her an income of 15,308 som (KGS).  She started work on a home for her family, but she doesn't have enough money to finish the roof.  This is why Kachkyn has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy building materials.  Kachkyn plans to use her future income to buy building materials and she wants to save up for her son to attend one of the best universities in the country.

loans.use: to purchase building materials in order to cover the roof of her house

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат, 39 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Гульзат уже 9 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. В аренде 1,30 Га земли, в собственности- 1,20 Га, где Гульзат выращивает фасоль для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, ее деятельность приносит до 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком, удобрений для обработки почвы для выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита позволят Гульзат развить ее бизнес и накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education. She has been involved in agriculture for nine years already, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income. She has two cows and 10 sheep on her farm, and she also grows beans for resale on 1.3 hectare of leased land and 1.2 hectare of her own land. Thanks to her very hard work, she makes a monthly income of up to 15,000 som (KGS) from her activity.

In order to further grow her business, Gulzat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow with her calf, as well as fertilizers to prepare her land and cultivate organic beans. The earnings from her loan will allow Gulzat to grow her business and to save some money toward her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for land cultivation and one dairy cow with her calf in order to sell organic milk.

loans.name: Nidia Monserrate

texts.es:
Cojimíes es un destino turístico debido a que tiene muchos atractivos naturales, está ubicado en el Cantón Pedernales, su oferta gastronómica como camarones, langostas, langostinos diversos tipos de pescados, almejas, jaibas, cangrejos, conchas y muchos más frutos del mar es deliciosa, sus habitantes se dedican a la pesca, aquí se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Zaineb.
En este lugar vive la señora Nidia, tiene 20 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2 años. El cónyuge se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos y a comercializarlos, viven en casa propia.
Doña Nidia se dedica a la venta y elaboración de ladrillos con su cónyuge, también vende ropa,  zapatos y cosméticos de Avon, Esika y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). En su casa tiene un lugar donde vende sus productos y realiza trabajos de belleza como colocar tientes, pintado de uñas, entre otros.
Ella destinara el crédito para comprar productos que le han hecho pedidos de los catálogos, como perfumes, ropa y zapatos. Tiene en el grupo comunal un año y le gusta el apoyo y unión que tienen todas las socias. Su sueño es tener un gabinete de belleza bien equipado y en un lugar más concurrido.
texts.en:
Cojimíes is a tourist destination because it has many natural attractions. It is located in the Pedernales Canton. It offers cuisine such as shrimp, lobster, prawns, various types of fish, clams, crabs, shells and many other types of seafood that are delicious. The town habitants are engaged in fishing. Here the members of the community group "Grupo De Crédito Zaineb" meet.

In this place lives 20 year old Nidia. She maintains a relationship of common-law marriage with her partner and they have a 2 year old son. Her partner makes a living in the manufacture and marketing of bricks. They live in their own home.

Nidia makes a living manufacturing and selling bricks with her partner, and also sells clothing, shoes, and cosmetics from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal (beauty products, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). In her house she has a place where she sells her products and offers various beauty services such as nail painting.

She intends to use the loan to buy products through catalogs, like perfumes, clothing, and shoes. She has been in the community group for one year and she likes the support and unity with all the members. Her dream is to have a well equipped beauty cabinet in a busy location.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 37 years old and married to George. They are blessed with six children. She has been operating a clothes selling business as her primary activity, and it has been profitable. She is also a dairy farmer, and she supplies milk to her customers.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk to her customers. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand her business.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her clothing and dairy farming businesses and be successful.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk to her customers.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 46 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 18 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Гулмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 0,90 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации оптовым покупателям. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 4 овец. Супруг получает пенсию, как ветеран войны. Ежемесячный доход Гулмиры составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец. Она является участником группы "Ай-Сезим", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и приобретение дополнительных орошаемых земель.
texts.en: Gulmira is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education.  For the past 18 years, she has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which constitute an additional source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work and her dedication, Gulmira now cultivates 0.9 hectare of land on which she grows beans for resale to wholesale buyers.  She also has two cows and four sheep on her farm.  Gulmira's husband, a war veteran, receives a pension.  Gulmira herself makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy six sheep.  Gulmira is a member of the "Ay-Sezim" group which comprises another two people, so three members in total.  Gulmira is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and also to buy additional irrigated land.

loans.use: to buy six sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and pensioner mother in a small village of Tskaltubo district. Patima is unemployed at the moment, and the family lives in poverty. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,100 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products to sell locally as well as to use for the family's food. Patima already has a shed for the cow in the yard.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a husbandry business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is a married woman from Merida, Leyte. She  is engaged in a sari-sari, or retail store, business. As of now, she needs a loan to buy more stock to sell. A loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among others. A loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more customers and buyers in her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, among others

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is married with 3 children. He describes himself to be trustworthy and honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil, soap, drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds to buy more stock. 

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items to resell. His business goal is to be a great wholesaler within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will give his family a great life and an improved living standard. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. All previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items to resell.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
