Gracias a sus ganancias, Rosa decidió invertir en una nueva actividad, ahora también vende cremas corporales de origen natural y está contenta con los buenos resultados que ha tenido hasta ahora. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de doña Irma, doña Rosa tiene algunas bolsas de dulces en sus manos.
texts.en:
The community where the communal bank group "La Gloria" is located is known for its typical Mexican sweets such as "cocadas, jamoncillo, ajonjolí" and "glorias" which are made with caramel.  The members of the group work in sales of:

Rosa,  Elvira, Eva - Sweets 
Sandra - Food 
Amalia - Fruit and vegetables
Flor, Zuleima - Clothing
Rolando - Soft drinks 
Ana,  Carmen - Cosmetics
Irma - Snacks 
María - Sweets and soft drinks 

Rosa is a very hard-working woman with 32 years' experience making and selling typical sweets.  "I learned how to make them when I was 18 and I learned that each one has a secret.  My mother and grandmother used to do this to help cover expenses."  And like they did, Rosa now sells sweets in nearby communities all week long.  At first it was a challenge for her to overcome her shyness and approach people more easily.

In the morning Rosa does her housework and leaves the house at 10:00 a.m., latest.  She carries with her little bags of the sweets she has prepared and does not return home until 4:00 p.m., having sold everything.  There are exceptional days when she cannot go out but she does not like to interrupt her routine because it allows her to visit other places, entertain herself and have her own income.

Rosa is very grateful for the loan opportunities received through VisionFund, since this new loan will allow her to buy more ingredients for her sweets. She will buy cane sugar, sesame, squash seed, coconut, pineapple, brown paper and plastic bags to increase production.

Thanks to her earnings, Rosa has decided to start a new business.  Now she also sells natural body lotions and is happy with the results she has achieved so far.

* The photo was taken at Irma's house.  Rosa is the one holding a few bags of sweets.

loans.use: To buy cane sugar, sesame, squash seeds, coconut, pineapple, brown paper and plastic bags.

loans.name: Karla Yessenia

texts.es:
Karla, de 24 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora, vive en la casa de sus padres, con su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad y su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura.

Karla, tiene 3 años de vender ropa, en su canasta y bolsas, ella vende casa por casa en toda la comunidad, buscando nuevos clientes.- Su mercado está en el casco urbano y en otros cantones, los tipos de ropa que vende son pantalones, camisas, blusas, shorts, brasier y ropa interior para hombre y mujer. 

Karla, actualmente se ha quedado sin capital para invertir en el negocio de la ropa, ya que ha tenido muchos gastos médicos porque su hijo ha estado mal de salud y las medicinas son demasiado caras.- Con el dinero del préstamo comprará ropa de todo tipo, para continuar con su pequeño negocio.

El sueño de Karla es poner un pequeño negocio en el mercado central, para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karla, 24, is a very hard-working, responsible, enterprising young woman who lives with her parents.  She has a four-year-old son and her husband works in agriculture.

Karla has been selling clothing for three years.  With a basket and some bags she goes around house-to-house in her community looking for new customers.  She sells in the urban area and in other cantons.  The type of clothing she sells includes pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, bras and men's and women's underwear.

Karla has no capital right now to invest in her business as she had to cover medical expenses when her son was ill, and the medicine is expensive.  She will use the loan to buy all kinds of clothing to continue with her small business.

Her dream is to set up a small shop at the central market to improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy all kinds of clothing to continue with her small business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 54 años de edad, es muy responsable y muy trabajadora, está soltera, vive con su hijo, una sobrina y una de sus hermanas, que le ayuda con los quehaceres de la casa.

Santos, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de pupusas, es un trabajo en el cual se necesita mucha dedicación; con los ingresos que percibe de la pupuseria, ha logrado comprar todo lo que hasta ahora tiene.

Santos, necesita el crédito para comprar chicharrón, quesillo, harina, aceite, especies, entre otros insumos que necesita para hacer las pupusas.

Su sueño es, tener una gran pupuseria, en un local propio cerca del mercado de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Santos, 54, is very responsible and hardworking. She is single and lives with her son, her niece, and one of her sisters, who help her with the housework.

Santos has 8 years experience selling pupusas (stuffed griddled tortillas). It is a job that requires a lot of dedication. With the earnings she receives from the pupusería, she has managed to buy what she has up to now.

Santos needs a loan in order to buy pork rind, cheese, flour, oil, among other supplies that she needs to make pupusas.

Her dream is to have a big pupusería in a premises near the town market.

loans.use: to buy pork rind, cheese, flour oil etc. to make pupusas.

loans.name: Fidelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fidelina, se dedica a vender tortillas, vive con sus padres los cuales ya están ancianos y están bajo su cuidado, tiene dos hijos que son independientes y tienen su propio hogar, pero que debes en cuando le ayudan económicamente, tiene más de 10 años de vivir en esa localidad y la casa le pertenece, su negocio lo atiende de 9:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. y luego hace otra jornada de 5:00 p.m. a  7:00 p.m., en la zona es la única persona que tiene un negocio de ese tipo, además en ocasiones elabora tamales para vender y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Invertirá en maíz, leña, cal y bolsas para elaborar las tortillas que comercializa, espera que al realizar dicha compra al mayoreo pueda aprovechar el precio bajo de la materia prima y así tener nuevos ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son tener una situación económica más estable para reparar su vivienda y darles mejores cuidados a sus padres.
texts.en:
Fidelina works selling tortillas. She lives with her parents who are old and under her care. She has two children who are independent, and they have their own homes, but from time to time they help her financially. She has lived in this area for more than 10 years and she owns her home. She works at her business from 9am to 2pm and then again from 5pm - 7pm. She is the only person in the area to this kind of business, and she occasionally makes tamales to sell and so increase her income.

She will invest in corn, firewood, lime and bags to make the tortillas she sells. She hopes that by carrying out these purchases in bulk she will be able to take advantage of low prices of the materials and so have new income.

Her dreams are to have a more stable economic situation in order to repair her home and give her parents better care.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime and bags to make tortillas.

loans.name: M. Imran

texts.en:
M. Imran is the age of 32 and a father of three sons living in Lahore, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. He is a pharmacist running a small pharmacy in a nearby town to help the poor people. He wants to help poor people, which is the reason he decided to open the medicine shop in a poor society. Such poor people do not have the power to afford allopathic medicines. He can also treat minor diseases at very low service charges and treat them according to his experience. In this way, he is generating some income to run his house as well.

He is very famous in his area due to his kindness; this is the reason the demand for allopathic medicines has been increasing and he needs to buy more medicine to cope with the demand.  He wants to buy allopathic medicines, injections, medical equipment, syrup etc. in bulk but does not have enough capital to invest because he has to spend a large part of his savings for household expenses.

Therefore, M. Imran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; he hopes that the lenders will support him in his noble work.

loans.use: to buy allopathic medicines, injections, medical equipment, syrup etc.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y que se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café de variedad Catimore. Tiene experiencia en este negocio y buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su terreno cultivable. Con esto Alcides obtendrá mayores ganancias lo cuál le permitirá mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alcides, 22, is married and lives with his wife and children in the district of Querocotillo.  It is a quiet community where the main activities are agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  It is located in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Alcides works in agriculture and grows coffee of the Catimore variety.  He has experience in the sector and good personal and work references in the area.  The current loan is to buy manure and fertilizers for maintenance of his cropland.  This will earn Alcides greater profit so he can improve his economic situation and invest in better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for cropland maintenance.

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.pt:
A senhora  Guilhermina  tem 43 anos de idade, é viúva e e mãe de 3 filhos, todos  maiores de idade,vivendo  com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar pintos,  rações e medicamentos para os pintos.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são crescer no negócio, e ver um dia seus filhos formados profissionalmente.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de  fundos e para ultrapassar esta situação faz um xitique mensal como forma de poupar e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Guilhermina is a 43 year old widowed mother to 3 grown-up children, who all live with her in the family home. She says that she plans to use this loan to buy chicks, feed and medications for the chicks. Her hopes and dreams for the future centre around growing her business and one day seeing her children professionally trained. The greatest challenge that she faces is her lack of money and she is part of a communal credit and savings initiative, known as a xitique, which she pays into each month as a means to her overcoming her financial difficulties and saving for the future. She also intends to apply for further loans so that she can achieve what she plans to do.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medications for the chicks.

loans.name: Celio

texts.pt:
O senhor Célio tem 33 anos de idade, é casado, pai de 3 filhos, 2 dos quais frequentando o ensino primário e outro o ensino secundário,  vive na sua casa própria. 
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar feijão, açucar, sabão e bolachas para revender na sua mercearia.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são reabilitar a sua casa e aumentar bens de consumo.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz poupanças e  irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Célio is a 33 year old married father to 3 children, 2 of whom attend primary school and another is at secondary school, and they all live together in their own home. He plans to use this loan to buy beans, sugar, soap and biscuits to sell in his grocery store.
His hopes and dreams for the future centre around renovating his home and increasing his stock of consumer goods. He says that the greatest challenge that he faces is his lack of money and so he saves his money whenever he can in order to overcome his financial situation. He hopes to apply for further loans so that he can achieve his plans.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, soap and biscuits to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: Juliao

texts.pt:
O senhor Julião tem 35 anos de idade, é casado, pai de 1 filho e vive na casa própria .
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar tinta e cimento para a reabilitação da sua casa.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são melhorar as condições da sua casa e comprar uma viatura.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de fundos e para ultrapassar esta situação faz poupança e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano
texts.en: Julião is a 35 year old married father to one son and he lives in his own home. He says that he plans to use this loan to buy paint and cement so that he can renovate his house. His hopes and dreams for the future centre around improving his living conditions and buying a vehicle. The greatest challenge he faces is his lack of money and so he saves his money whenever he can so that he can overcome his financial situation. He also hopes to apply for further loans so that he can achieve what he plans to do.

loans.use: to buy paint and cement for renovating his house

loans.name: Aishan

texts.en: Aishan is 22 years old. She lives in Gardabani district with her brother, mother and pensioner grandmother. Aishan is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she grows greens to sell locally. Aishan wants to increase her income and requested a loan for starting up a husbandry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 USD. With the received credit, Aishan will purchase a cow and will build a shed for it. Once the cow is purchased, she will start producing dairy products to sell. Aishan is very hardworking and she will do her best to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Frederico

texts.pt: O Senhor Frederico é casado vive com a esposa e duas cunhadas.  Ele é militar na reserva. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção, cimento, pedra e areia. Tem  como maior sonho ter a vida autónoma, poder controlar e continuar com seus negócios sem depender de empréstimos. Tem como meta criar condições de segurança no seu parque de estacionamento que é o seu negócio
texts.en: Frederico is married and he lives with his wife and his 2 sisters-in-law. He is a soldier in the army reserves. He plans to use this loan to buy building materials, such as cement, stone and sand. He dreams of living an independent life and being able to manage and continue with his businesses without having to rely on loans. His aim for the future is to establish safer conditions in his gas station, which is one of the businesses he runs.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, stone and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in his store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old, married and together with her spouse, has have been blessed with two children. She has a retail shop where she sells retail goods such as rice, flour and milk among other items. She has been doing this business for the last four years and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of rice, flour and cooking oil to sell to get more income to pay school fees for her children.

Her future hopes are to expand her retail shop business and start a maize mill business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice, flour and cooking oil to sell to get more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She has been selling secondhand clothes in a shop at retail for three years, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. 

Her challenges include seasonality of used clothes. Her dream is to start selling other kind of clothes. She stays with her husband in her own house with access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Alice. Alice is an enthusiastic, 46-year-old lady from Lemotit villlage in Kenya who practices dairy farming. This year, she wants to grow her farm business through introducing poultry farming. The major problem she faces is lack of capital to support the expansion. 

Alice is seeking a Kiva loan of 15,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy poultry. A poultry farming business is easy to start and run. It works even if an entrepreneur has no experience and resources to speak of. 

The poultry business will grow with every egg produced and hatched. Income will grow from the sale of eggs, chicks and meat. Alice's family will also benefit from the improved diet as a result of you investing on this borrower's business.

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a rural woman who has had to endure many hardships in life, but she has always found the strength to press forward and continue making progress with her family. For the past five years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, tomatoes, and also she keeps dairy cows. Esther has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge of the timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. 

Esther mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Esther is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge, hence suffering so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetable and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Esther is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Esther feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help out women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Esther will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market. Also she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, hence increased income level. 

Esther is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, Esther will improve her living conditions and assure her children a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 50 years old. She lives in the small village of Ozurgeti district with her husband, son and his family. The family lives in poverty. They do not have any significant income. Lela decided to open a food market and generate some income. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 6,000 Georgia Lari (GEL). With the received credit, she will purchase food products and also all the inventory which is needed in the market, shelves and fridges. 

Lela is very motivated to generate her own income and to improve the living conditions of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market in order to generate income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feed for her chicks.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and married. She has been blessed with six children. She has a green grocery business which has been operating for the last five years. 

She will use the loan to purchase tomatoes, onions and vegetables to sell to her customers and to increase her income. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy more vegetables to sell.

Her hopes are to run a wholesale business and to build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes, onions and vegetables for sale and to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila y su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros. Cuenta con más de 9 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Elizabeth espera hacer crecer su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Cayaltí district, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful and the population works in agriculture, trade, and raising animals, primarily. 

She works selling basic pantry items such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and more. She has more than 9 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the zone. The current loan will be to purchase a greater quantity of rice, sugar, oil, etc. to increase the stock in her business. With this, Elizabeth hopes to grow her business and offer a greater variety of products to her customers which will generate more income and permit her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice, sugar, oil, etc. to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
Ventura es un hombre de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, es casado tiene la linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre tres y veintiséis años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ventura para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace veinte años, esta labor para él es lo más importante pues es su única fuente de ingresos. 
Ventura desde hace algún tiempo había empezado a construir su casa, pero lamentablemente ya no está dentro de sus posibilidades terminar la casa, es por eso que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, block, arena y hierro para terminar la construcción de su casa.
Él tiene el sueño de poder terminar su casa antes de este año para que su familia tenga donde acogerse, y seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Ventura is a forty-eight year old man, married, and has a lovely family of seven children between the ages of three and twenty-six. They live in a community in Sololá. 

Ventura, to generate income and support his family, has worked as a bricklayer for the past twenty years. This work for him is the most important because it is his only source of income.

Some time ago, Ventura had begun to build his house, but unfortunately it is not in his abilities to finish it, for this reason he asks for a loan which will be used to purchase cement, concrete blocks, sand and metal to finish construction on his house. 

He has a dream to be able to finish his house before the end of the year so that his family has a place to stay, and continue improving his house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, concrete blocks, sand and metal to finish construction on his house.

loans.name: Isidro Rafael

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive don Isidro, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos,  de 20 y 13  años de edad, el menor  estudia en colegio. Su esposa le ayuda en su negocio.
El señor Isidro es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganarse la vida honradamente y así darles lo mejor  a su familia, el arrienda un local en el centro de la ciudad en el cual todos los días vende empanadas de verde, pastelillos, corviches, pan de almidón y muchos otros alimentos así como también sodas, jugos naturales entre otros, su mujer es la encargada de preparar estos bocadillos en su casa los mismos que el luego los lleva a su local paraqué sus clientes puedan saborear estos deliciosos alimentos. Son más 15 años que lleva con esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, queso, aceite, frutas, pollos y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que gasta mucho en arriendos.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the communal bank group Dinámicas meets every two weeks. This place is known to be very dynamic and the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and it is a place with a lot of vegetation.

Isidro lives in this place. He is 48 years old, married, and in this relationship has two children, ages 20 and 13. The younger one is a secondary school student. His wife helps him in his business. 

Isidro is a very hard-working man who likes to earn his living honestly, and in this way give his family the best. He rents a space in the city center where every day he sells green empanadas, small pastries, corviches [fish cakes], rolls, and many other foods and also sodas, juices and more. His wife is in charge of preparing these snacks in the house which he later brings to his sales space so that his customers can taste these delicious foods. He has had this work for more than 15 years, which allows them to earn a living. 

This loan is to purchase plantains, cheese, oil, fruit, chicken and other groceries to prepare the food. He has been in the communal bank group for 4 years and he likes it for the help that the loans provide. His dram is to have his own retail space since he spends a lot on rent.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, cheese, oil, fruit, chicken and other groceries.

loans.name: Aura Elisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Aura, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia en el lugar.
Doña Aura e una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ella tienen un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversos trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 21h00 y si algún cliente requiere  de sus servicios hasta más tarde no le incomoda ya que su salón lo tiene en su casa, trabaja sola ya que ella se da abasto para todos sus clientes, lleva más de 14 años con su labor la cual le encanta y con la que se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para arreglar unos muebles que ya están  deteriorados y así brindar un mejor servicio. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus metas son tener un SPA.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the communal bank group Dinámicas meets every two weeks. This place is known to be very dynamic and the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and it is a place with a lot of vegetation.

Aura lives in this place. She is 36 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two children, ages 14 and 6. The older one is in secondary school, and the younger one is in primary school. Some years ago, she studied beauty at a local academy. 

Aura is a woman who likes to work to get ahead. She has a beauty salon where she does a variety of beauty and personal care services. She works every day from 9:00 to 21:00 and if a customer requires her services, even later, and it isn't a problem since her salon is in her house. She works alone because she keeps up with everything for her customers. She has been in this trade for more than 14 years, which she loves, and with which she earns a living.

This loan will be used to fix up some furniture which are deteriorated and in this way offer better service. She has been in the communal bank group since the beginning and she likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her goal is to have a spa.

loans.use: to fix up some furniture.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Très dynamique et active, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Agée de 31 ans, Akossiwa habite à Adidogomé pour vendre  du charbon de bois. Akossiwa réalise de mieux en mieux une bonne rentabilité dans son commerce et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Akossiwa désire accroitre son commerce et sollicite ce prêt pour commander  des sacs de charbons de bois afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a dynamic, active young woman who is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Adidogomé, where she sells charcoal.

Akossiwa's business is becoming more and more profitable and she buys her supplies twice a month. She would like to expand her business and is requesting this loan so she can order bags of charcoal, which will allow her to make a good income. In this way, she will be able to help her children.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.fr: Agé de 43 ans, Koudjo vit à Apédokoè avec sa famille. Marié et père de trois enfants, Koudjo est un commerçant de matériaux de constructions. Son commerce lui permet d’avoir une bonne épargne et couvrir favorablement les charges de la famille. Koudjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Grâce au  crédit passé, Koudjo arrive à satisfaire  ses clients et avoir le bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins quotidiens. Koudjo demande ce crédit pour acheter des tas de rouleaux de fil, des tuyaux et des cartons d’interrupteur. Koudjo désire mieux vendre et améliorer son épargne.
texts.en:
Koudjo is 43 years old and lives in Apédokoè with his family. He is married and the father of three children.

Koudjo supplies construction materials, and his business has helped him build up savings and provide for his family. He buys his supplies twice a month at the market.

Thanks to past loans, Koudjo has been able to satisfy his customers and make enough money to meet daily living expenses. He is requesting this loan to buy sets of wire bundles, hoses and boxes of switches.

Koudjo would like to sell more and increase his savings.

loans.use: to buy two sets of wire bundles, ten rolls of hose and 11 boxes of switches.

loans.name: Jenny Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijas de 19 y 12 años de edad, ambas estudian en universidad y colegio. Su marido es empelado público.
Doña Jenny es una  mujer que siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente y ganar lo propio para bien de sui familia, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo y  productos Yanbal y Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, su hija le ayuda con sus ventas ya que ella vende en la universidad en la cual estudia, ella trabaja todos los días unas tres o cuatro horas por día, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 10 años dedicada al comercio con la cual se gana algo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijas lo cual para ella es lo más importante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, bisuterías entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva en el Grupo De Crédito por 7 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijas sean buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the communal bank group Dinámicas meets every two weeks. This place is known to be very dynamic and the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, and it is a place with a lot of vegetation.

Jenny lives in this place. She is 47 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has two daughters, ages 19 and 12, both are students, in university and secondary school. Her husband is a government employee.

Jenny is a woman who always has liked to feel independent and earn her own money for the good of her family. For this, she works in trade, selling clothing from catalogs and Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories). She makes her sales door-to-door, and her daughter helps her with her sales since she sells at the university where she studies. She works every day for some three to four hours, leaving the items on credit and collecting every week. She has been selling for more than 10 years, with which she earns something to invest in her daughters' education, which for her is the most important thing. 

This loan will be used to purchase clothing, perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and other things that she sells. She has been in the communal bank group for 7 years and she likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her dreams are to that her daughters become good professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Dieudonné

texts.fr: Dieudonné est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans. Habitant à Adidogomé, Dieudonné  est une commerçante de pagnes et de bijoux en parcourant tout le quartier en livrant ses tissus à ses clients. Son activité lui procure un résultat qu’elle ménage pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Dieudonné s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Dieudonné demande ce crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de pagnes et faire encore plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Dieudonné is 36 years old and married. She lives in Adidogomé and works as a travelling trader, selling traditional cloth pagnes and jewellery in her neighbourhood and delivering fabrics to her customers. The income from her business allows her to cover her family expenses.

Dieudonné buys her supplies at the market once a month, and she is requesting this loan so she can place a new order for pagnes and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 11 lengths of traditional cloth pagne.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est mariée et âgée de 38 ans vivant à Adidogomé. Ayawa est une femme qui a quatre enfants à sa charge s’évertue activement pour leur épanouissement. Ayawa est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale dans son quartier et gagne son revenu par ce commerce. Ayawa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois pour équiper son étalage. Ayawa nécessite ce nouveau prêt pour l’achat des détergents, des piments et des bidons d’huile afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour une meilleure rentabilité.
texts.en:
Ayawa is 38 years old and married. She lives in Adidogomé and works hard to make sure the four children in her care can flourish.

Ayawa makes an income by selling general food products in her local neighbourhood. She stocks her shelves by buying supplies twice a month.

Ayawa requires this new loan to buy detergents, chilli peppers and cartons of oil. This will allow her to increase her revenue and thereby her profit.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of detergent, seven bags of chilli peppers and two cartons of oil.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilma está casada, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos mayores de edad y 1 menor que aún está cursando el colegio, a los cuales ella y su marido han sacado adelante con sacrificio.
La Sra. Vilma tiene una despensita bien surtida que montó gracias a la ayuda de su marido, está ubicada en un barrio muy concurrido. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, verduras, lácteos, panificados y otros, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes todo lo que piden, y también le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is married and has four children, three of whom are grown. Her youngest child is in high school, so she and her husband are making sacrifices in order to get ahead.

Sra. Vilma has a small food pantry that is well stocked. Thanks to the the help of her husband, she was able to set up her business in a very busy neighborhood. She is a hardworking woman who strives to help her family.

Vilma is applying for this loan in order to buy fruits, vegetables, dairy products, baked goods, and other items so that she can restock her business and provide everything that her customers request. This will also help to improve the earnings from her work.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Lidia Cristina

texts.es: Cristina cruza por sus 33 años de edad esta casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar de obrero en  una planta florícola, Cristina tiene un hijo de 15 años y dos hijas de las edades de 10 y 13 años de edad y todos ellos asisten a la escuela, Cristina se dedica  a la crianza de ganado, comenta que vive en el campo y su actividad  principal es la agricultura y el ordeño de sus vacas, Cristina va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de una vaca lechera, Cristina tiene la aspiración de tener mas vacas que son las que les dan sus ingresos para cubrir la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 33 and is married. Her husband is a worker in a flower farm. Cristina has a 15-year-old son and 2 daughters who are 10 and 13. They all go to school. Cristina raises cattle. She lives in the countryside and her main activity is the farming and milking of her cows. 

Cristina is going to invest the loan money in buying a dairy cow. Cristina aspires to have more cows, which allow her to make her income to cover the costs of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: César

texts.es:
El Sr. César es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 32 años, está casado con la Sra. Norma, con quien tiene 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de lucha de esta pareja, que se están esforzando para poder darles una vida digna.
 César tiene un negocio de venta de Motorrepuestos y también un taller de motos en su casa,  con clientela formada, que siempre va hasta su taller para poder ser atendidos por él.
César pide este préstamo para la compra de repuestos para motos, con lo cual podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes y poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sr. César is from the city of Santaní. He is 32 years old and married to Sra. Norma. They have two children, who provide the motivation that this couple needs to do their best so that they can provide them a decent life.

César has a business in which he sells motorcycle parts, but he also has a motorcycle repair shop at his house. He has an established clientele who are always coming to his shop to seek his services. César is requesting this loan in order to buy motorcycle parts so that he can continue to provide good service to his customers and grow in his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Laura Elisa

texts.es: A sus 62 años de edad Laura esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad   e independientes, Laura se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la ganadería, el esposo de  Laura  se dedica  a la agricultura y a la ganadería, Laura va a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de una vaca y que comenta que su actividad es la que  le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y espera  poder seguir trabajando y seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Laura is 62 years old and is married. She has 2 children who are already adults and are independent. Laura raises young animals and works with livestock. Laura's husband works in agriculture and livestock. 

Laura is going to invest the loan money in buying a cow. She says that this activity is what has allowed her to provide for her children. She hopes to be able to continue working and keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Sra. Gabriela es de la ciudad de San Pedro, está ubicada en una zona estratégica de la ciudad donde tiene su negocio el cual es una despensa y también una carnicería que monto en su casa. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que ha ido creciendo con su esfuerzo y con su constante trabajo, ella quiere ir creciendo poco a poco e ir mejorando su negocio.
Pide este préstamo para comprar productos para surtir su despensa, con verduras, carne, frutas, hortalizas, enlatados, bebidas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabriela is from the city of San Pedro. Her business is located in a strategic section of the city. She manages a food pantry and butcher shop that are set up in her home. Gabriela is a hardworking woman who has grown as a result of her efforts and constant work. She wants to keep growing little by little so that she can improve her business.

Gabriela is requesting this loan in order to buy products to restock her food pantry such as vegetables, meat, fruits, greens, canned goods, beverages, and other items. She appreciates the opportunity she has received to keep growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, greens, canned goods, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA VICTORIA.
La socia Vilma tiene 01 hijo y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta d egolosinas, la socia vende lo que son dulces, galletas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chocolates, chupetines entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the communal bank 'Nueva Victoria'. 

Vilma has a son, is separated, and alternates her daily activities with running her business. She has a shop that sells snacks, including sweets and biscuits, among other things that her customers ask for. She has a good amount of experience running her business, which is doing well thanks to the strength and determination that she puts in every day. Vilma would like to continue running her business so that she can continue supporting her family.

Vilma is asking for a loan in order to buy chocolates and lollipops, among other things. She is very grateful for the loan and she promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chocolates and lollipops, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives with his parents, his wife and two small children in the village of Varser of Gegharkunik region. 

Gevorg has vocational education and a specialty of electrician, but since his very young age he decided to become a farmer and year by year he becomes more skilled in this field. 

Now in his farm he has great assortment of cattle in the care of which his father helps him greatly. He has cows, calves, heifers, a bull, chickens and beehives. His farm products include milk, meat, cheese and eggs. Gevorg sells during the week locally. His farm’s honey also brings great income to his family, since it is pure, healing and very tasty.  

Having no other occupation, Gevorg works a lot to cover his big family’s numerous needs. This loan will be greatly useful for his farm cattle as he lacks fodder. Thanks to this Kiva loan, he plans to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Adijha

texts.en:
Adijha, 59, is a widow who looks after her three grandchildren. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She deals in cocoa farming and selling and gets additional income from selling cosmetics and laces. She started the business to raise income for her family. Her clients are mainly cocoa companies and dealers. 

She has a challenge of limited capital to invest in the cocoa business during the peak season as well as seasonal changes. She hopes to expand her business and construct rental houses in future for income generation. She has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Evairet

texts.en:
Evairet, 35 years old, is a married mother of five children, four of them attending school. They live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

She deals in buying and selling fish and gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business to get income with great hopes of expanding the business and raising school fees for her children, but she lacks enough capital and sometimes faces high competition in the fish market, which in the end reduces her returns. 

Evairet needs a loan to buy fish and cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish and cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.name: M. Rafaq

texts.en:
Rafaq, 35, is an energetic man living with his spouse, four children and parents in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. His forefathers and relatives have been selling meat for many years. Butchery is a traditional work. He learnt these arts regarding slaughter and dividing the carcass from his father and earns a reasonable income for his entire family.
 
In the beginning he was purchasing a small quantity of beef from the market and then selling it in his locality from his butcher shop. The customers were complaining about stale beef and he does not want to compromise over his quality and reputation. This is the reason he wants to produce fresh beef and wants to buy a bull calf for producing more beef to sell, but he does not have enough cash in hand.

For this is the reason he contacted the Kiva field partner, and after understanding all the procedures, he has requested a Kiva loan, so he can buy a bull calf. 

He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf for producing beef for reselling.

loans.name: José Benardino

texts.es:
José, de 71 años de edad, está casado, tiene 4 hijos, pero solo 3 viven en casa, porque uno emigro al extranjero.

José, es agricultor de profesión, se ha dedicado toda su vida a estas actividades, pero además de eso también cría gallinas y tiene una vaca que está a punto de dar a luz y producirá leche.

José, necesita el crédito para reparar su casa, porque se acerca el invierno y no quiere que su familia se vea afectada, por los azotes del clima.

José, desea mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar trabajando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 71 years old and married. He has four children, but only three of them live in the house as one of them has emigrated to another country. 

José is a farmer by profession, and he has spent his entire life working in this area. He also raises chickens, and he has a cow that is just about to give birth and start producing milk. 

He needs this loan to repair his house, because winter is drawing closer, and he doesn't want his family to be affected by the harsh weather. José wants to improve his quality of life and continue working for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She sells second-hand clothes. She moves from door to door selling her clothes on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major challenge includes transportation. Her goal is to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: La Amistad De Huayllabamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE HUAYLLABAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es viuda y tiene 60 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos,mandarinas,papayas y naranjas,  la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y tambien la socia lleva la fruta a diferentes lugares , la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar platanos,mandarinas,papayas y naranjas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
El socio que su cara esta tapado con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal La Amistad de Huayllabamba. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de trasporte, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank "La Amistad de Huayllabamba". The bank is located in the District of Huayllabamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Rosa. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has seven children. Rosa works at her business of selling fruits such as bananas, tangerines, papayas, and oranges. She has a stand at the market where sells fruit, but she also delivers the fruit to different places. Rosa works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell fruits. She is requesting a loan in order to buy bananas, tangerines, papayas, and oranges.

The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive after the meeting because of work reasons. The person whose face is covered with a circle is not a member of this Communal Bank. The other group members engage in businesses that involve providing transportation, selling fruits, managing a grocery store, and selling food.

Rosa is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tangerines, papayas, and oranges.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA VICTORIA.
La socia Felicitas tiene 45 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende lo que son dulces, galletas, arroz, azúcar  entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, arroz  entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the communal bank 'Nueva Victoria'. 

Felicitas is 45 years old and married. She alternates her daily activities with running her grocery store, which sells sweets, biscuits, rice, sugar and other things that her customers ask for. She has a good amount of experience running her business, and it is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. Felicitas wants to continue running her business so that she can continue supporting her family.

Felicitas is asking for a loan in order to buy milk and rice, among other things. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk and rice, among other things.

loans.name: Testigos De Jeova Group

texts.es:
LUCY, vive en una humilde comunidad de Esmeraldas, donde sus habitantes se dedican a la recolección de conchas del manglar . Ella vive con sus 4 hijos (16, 15, 11 y 3 años), es separada del padre de sus hijos y los recursos de este préstamo, lo utilizara en fortalecer la compra venta de sabanas y toallas. 
ella desea en 3 años poder tener su propia casa y un negocio mas fluido, por el momento ella recorre comunidades cercanas para ofrecer sus productos.
Con las ganancias pretende ahorrar para la compra de su casa por que la casa en que vive es prestada y ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación.
LUCY se describe como una mujer muy emprendedora y dinámica, con muchos deseos de superación.
Ella ve en VisionFund una forma de trabajar en su propio negocio, ofreciendo mas novedades a sus clientes gracias a los créditos con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lucy lives in a humble community in Esmeraldas, where the local population work gathering shells from the mangroves. She lives with her 4 children who are 16, 15, 11 and 3 years old. She is separated from the father of her children and she will use this loan to strengthen her business buying and selling sheets and towels.
 
She hopes to be able to have her own home within 3 years, as well as a more successful business. At the moment she travels around neighbouring communities to offer her products.

With the earnings she intends to save up to buy her house because the house in which she lives is borrowed. She also wants to offer her children a better education. 

Lucy describes herself as a very enterprising and dynamic woman with a strong desire to succeed. With VisionFund she sees a way to work in her own business, offering more innovations to her customers thanks to loans from Kiva.

loans.use: to strengthen her business buying and selling sheets, towels and awnings

loans.name: Ana Víctoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 50 años de edad, está acompañada y vive con su pareja, que se dedica a la albañilería y tiene un hijo que emigro al extranjero.

Victoria, es promotora de salud en la ciudad donde ella vive, tiene más de 20 años de laborar en la misma unidad de salud, se siente muy satisfecha y orgullosa de su trabajo.

Victoria, desea reparar algunas partes de su casa, ya que se acerca la temporada lluviosa y necesita solventar algunas necesidades.

Victoria, desea arreglar su casa y tenerla bonita para cuando su hijo decida regresar, ya que su más grande anhelo, es ver a su hijo y que regrese para vivir con ella nuevamente.
texts.en:
Victoria, 50, is married and lives with her partner, who is a mason. She has a son who migrated abroad. Victoria works as a health promoter in the city where she lives. She has worked for more than twenty years in a local healthcare unit. She enjoys doing what she does and feels proud of it.

Victoria wants to make some home repairs. She needs to fix some problems now that the rainy season is coming. Victoria wants to repair her house and make it look beautiful for when her son decides to return. Her biggest wish is to see her son and that he stays to live with her again.

loans.use: to make some home repairs.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
From Batasan Quezon City, Leoncia has been an active member of CCT for years now and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. She is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs and she wants to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Leoncia owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to making her dreams come to happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg,  toothpaste or even an ice tube. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she sells it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Leoncia meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as loyal. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for over 20 years. Her business is located in an area good for agriculture and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a calf. Her business goal is to start doing poultry farming within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: M. Shehbaz

texts.en:
M. Shehbaz, 37, is an energetic and gentle person. He lives with his parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He loves his parents and sibling a lot and wants to provide them better facilities. He wants to generate maximum income to ensure and secure the better future of his family members.
 
He owns a scrap shop in which he deals in used, damaged and useless scrap material such as plastic, iron and aluminum accessories. He purchases scrap from the hawkers and sells it to a recycling factory. He is has a deal with a factory, and at the end of the month, the factory members collect all the scrap for an agreed amount from him. He has been doing the same business for many years and earning a reasonable profit for his family.
 
Recently, he made a deal with a constructor who is selling the scrap iron of a tear-down building, but due to the large quantity, he does not have enough money to buy all that scrap iron. Therefore, M. Shehbaz requested a loan so that he can buy scrap iron from the constructor and can make a rapid increase in his income.

M. Shehbaz hopes that this loan will enhance his earning capacity so that he can make more savings than earlier.

M. Shehbaz seems very glad after taking this loan and thanks Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps M. Shehbaz to purchase scrap iron for reselling.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is a 24-year-old student currently pursuing a post graduate diploma in banking and finance at the Kiit School of Rural Management, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He graduated in 2014. 

He belongs to a middle class family. His father is farmer and his mother is a housewife. Her father's income is very low and he is not able to pay Jamshed's total course fees for his diploma course. This is why Jamshed has requested a loan of 100,000 INR to pay for his banking and finance diploma course fees. 

Jamshed wants to make his career in banking and for that he got admission to the banking course. He hopes to get a good job in a bank after completion of his course. He is grateful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to pay for his banking and finance diploma course fees.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado SAN ROQUE está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una tiene las esperanzas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través del programa.
Lorena vende prendas variadas, y por medio de los ingresos que tiene, lucha para poder dar a su familia una vida digna para que no les falte nada y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y poder crecer.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, pantalones y otros tipos de prendas, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, y luchar por mejorar sus ingresos. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
The group named "San Roque" is in its first loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. Through this program, each member is hopeful of improving her living conditions.

Lorena sells various types of clothes. With the income she earns, she strives to provide a decent life for her family so that they can live without feeling deprived. She is a hardworking woman who wants to move forward and grow.

Lorena is requesting a loan in order to buy T-shirts, jeans, trousers, and other types of garments so that she can continue her sales and improve her earnings. She is grateful to everyone for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, trousers, and other types of garments.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es una mujer de 41 años de edad. Casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 15 y 12 años, y su negocio es la confección de polleras.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, activa, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona 'Tilata' un área urbanizada residencial situada en el altiplano a una altura de 4100 metros sobre el nivel del mar, caracterizada por abastecer con 32 pozos de agua subterránea a la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0 – 12 grados centígrados.
Aurora es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, complexión física robusta, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su esposo que trabaja como empleado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, alcantarillado, gas domiciliario y electricidad. Su negocio es la confección de polleras; las polleras son prendas de vestir de la mujer tradicional, las últimas tendencias son de color rojo, amarillo, morado, rosado, celeste y verde, los diseños se los puede encontrar con flores estampadas, animal print, círculos de diferentes colores o bordados por las habilidosas manos de su taller artesanal. Al ingresar en su Pollerería  lo primero que se observa es la última variedad de prendas confeccionadas a mano, con la ayuda de su máquina de coser. Cada vez que una tela nueva pasa por sus manos se convierte en un diseño novedoso. "antiguamente las polleras se las confeccionaba con flores grandes y actualmente la moda cambió a flores pequeñas con fondo blanco…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las prendas son populares y se venden fácilmente, la desventaja es que no cuenta con clientes frecuentes. Su sueño es construir un taller grande de confección, ella desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de tela para la confección de polleras por mayor para realizar ventas por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Aurora solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar polleras y venderlas por docena.
texts.en: Aurora is  41 year old woman. She is married, with two sons ages 15 and 12 years old, and her business is to make polleras (traditional skirts.) She is a good mother, independent, active, entrepreneurial, responsible and hard working. She works in the "Tilata" zone, a residentially developed area located in the altiplano at 13,452 feet above sea level, characterized for supplying 32 underground water wells to the city. It has a cold and dry climate which fluctuates during the day between 0-12 degrees Celsius. Aurora is dark complected, brown eyes, long, black, braided hair, robust build, short stature, traditionally dressed (hat, shall, pollera.)  Her native tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home with her family, and she speaks Spanish as general knowledge and for business. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a clerk, and her children who are in school. They live in their own home, built of brick and cement with corrugated metal roofing.  They have drinking water, sewage, electricity and household gas. Her business is to make polleras. Polleras are clothing skirts used by the traditional woman. The latest trends are in red, yellow, purple, pink, light blue and green. Designs can be with floral prints, animal prints, circles of diverse colors, and embroidered by the skillful hands of her handicraft shop.  When you come into her "Pollereria" the first thing you see is the latest designs of hand made clothing, sewn with the help of her sewing machine. Every time a new fabric touches her hand, it converts into an innovative design. "in the past, polleras were made with big flowers, but currently fashion changed and they are made with small flowers with a white background.." she states. The advantage of her business is that these clothing items are popular and they are easily sold. The disadvantage is that she does not have a stable clientele. Her dream is to build a big tailoring shop. She wants to invest the loan to buy fabric to make polleras wholesale and sell them wholesale. This is the first loan with the institution in 17 years of working in this activity. This is why Aurora is asking for a loan to buy fabric wholesale to make polleras and sell them by the dozen.

loans.use: To buy fabric wholesale to make polleras (traditional skirts) and sell them by the dozen.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who lives in Masindi, Uganda, used the previous loan to buy more soft drinks such as Splash and sodas to resell. She sells soft drinks and food in her restaurant, supplying to the general public as her clients.

She has a dream of completing her residential house despite the challenges of inadequate capital and high license fees. Jane intends to use the loan to buy soft drinks like sodas to sell in her restaurant ahead of the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks like sodas to sell in her restaurant ahead of the Easter season

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with two children, and she takes care of additional family members.

Ruth operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for the last for 3 years.  She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis.

She has requested a loan to buy rollers, braids, weaves and hair relaxers.  Her major business challenges include power shortages and seasonality. Ruth aspires to increase her sales through selling cold drinks in her salon.

Ruth decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their timely loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy rollers, braids, weaves and hair relaxers

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara, de 18 años de edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos aún,  vive con su familia y tiene 3 hermanos.

Xiomara, actualmente trabaja en la ciudad, porque necesita obtener ingresos para ayudar a sus padres y a sus hermanos, también es agricultora y le ayuda a su padre y sus hermanos a cultivar los granos básicos.

Xiomara, tiene deseos de seguir estudiando la universidad y para eso necesita el crédito, para pagar la primera mensualidad y comprar los útiles que para comenzar a estudiar en la universidad.

Xiomara, desea ayudar a su familia, pero también sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria y obtener un título universitario.
texts.en: Xiomara is 18 years old. She is single and doesn't have children yet. She lives with her family and has 3 brothers. Xiomara currently works in the city, because she needs income to help her parents and brothers. She is also a farmer and helps her father and brothers grow basic grains. Xiomara wants to continue studying in the university, and that is why she needs the loan, to make the first installment payment and buy supplies to begin studying in the university. Xiomara wants to help her family, but she also dreams with finishing her college career and to obtain a college degree.

loans.use: To pay her first installment payment and buy supplies to begin studying at the university.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low inventory. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of clothes. Her business goal is to own a chain of boutiques within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman. She describes herself as being capable.

Margaret operates a retail business where she offers M-Pesa services (a mobile-phone based money transfer service), sells juices, drinking water, electronics and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. Margaret describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of electronics and juices. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics, juices and other items

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna from Sevan is thankful for her first support from Kiva and hopes for the second loan which will again develop her clothes-trading business, which she has had for 19 years. At the city’s wholesale market Susanna sells a great and colorful assortment of women's and girls' clothes both for everyday and formal wear. In her business her son helps her especially when it is time to bring new merchandise for her stall from Yerevan city. She is happy that she can provide her small family and son with good living conditions, after years in poverty, which caused great hardship for this woman. Now everything is changed thanks to this Kiva loan and her careful and stylish work. 

This time again Susanna asks for this loan to refresh her spring/summer season clothes assortment; especially with stylish and pretty dresses.

loans.use: to refresh her spring/summer season clothes.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She is 47 years old and she resides with her family in Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than two years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. They work hard because they are determined to have a better income.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-PHPs worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Salvacion would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 30,000 PHP (Philippine pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Salvacion hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Araksya

texts.en:
Araksya happily lives in the village Tsovagyugh of the Gegharkunik region. With her vocational education, she worked many years at the local factory as a traditional carpet weaver. She liked her work very much since it was interesting and allowed her to make colorful and creative pictures on the carpets with natural woolen threads.

Like many people in the region, Araksya lost her job after the collapse of Soviet Union and began farming with her husband. She takes care of cows, a calf, a bull, sheep, pigs, lambs and chickens. The sale of the farm's products (milk, meat, cheese and eggs) provides the main portion of her family's income. Her husband now works as a mechanic, but his small salary covers very little of their family's needs. Their son, 23 years old, is looking for employment, as well.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will help Araksya purchase one more cow and animal fodder for her other cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, tiene una venta de antojitos y pupusas, práctica está actividad desde hace más de 15 años, cuenta con muchos clientes que prefieren sus productos por la calidad y buen servicio que Adelina brinda debido a la experiencia en el negocio, lo prendió por motivación propia y por la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Comprará harina, condimentos, papas, yuca, tomates, quesillo, entre otros materiales importantes para elaborar la venta de antojitos y pupusas, abastecerá su inventario para seguir trabando y tener nuevos ingresos.
Sueña con tener menos necesidades junto a su familia y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Adelina lives in her own home with her husband and her children. She has a stall selling street food and stuffed tortillas. She has been doing this for more than 15 years and has many customers who favour her products for their quality and the good service that Adelina provides thanks to her experience in the business. She set up this business out of her own motivation and the necessity of covering the household costs. 

She will buy flour, seasonings, potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, cream cheese and other important ingredients for making street food and stuffed tortillas to sell. This will stock up her inventorary so she can continue working and make new income.

She dreams of a time when she and her family want for less, and of paying back her debt.

loans.use: to buy flour, seasonings, potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, cream cheese and other important ingredients for making street food and stuffed tortillas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a variety of clothes for adults and children and to pay her providers for some orders.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 37 years old. He lives with his sister in Gurjaani district. Giorgi looks after the family-owned vineyard and produces wine seasonally. In addition, he is a physical worker to generate income.

Giorgi decided to start a taxi business in order to increase his income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 USD. With the received credit, he will purchase a car and will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will give him a chance to generate a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is 40 years old, a divorced woman who lives with her son in a very small village in Nayagarh district, Odisha. Minati is engaged in weaving as an activity for her livelihood. She gets orders and raw material from dealers and makes saree and then she returns the saree to the dealer. From this activity she gets 150 INR for making one saree. She earns 4,000 to 4500 INR per month. She wants to purchase raw materials so she can make saree out of her own material and design so she can make more money. 

Minati has requested this loan to buy thread in bulk for weaving. She hopes to do well in her business and she would like to thank Kiva and Peoples Forum for this support.

loans.use: to buy thread in bulk for weaving

loans.name: Prakash Chandra

texts.en:
Prakash Chandra is 31 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his parents, wife, and a three-year-old child in a small village in Ganjam district, Odisha. He is a very responsible and hardworking man. He is currently engaged in paddy cultivation. His father is engaged in vegetable cultivation. His father helps him in his paddy cultivation as he got the idea of doing paddy cultivation from his father.
