Prakash Chandra has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farming. He hopes to get good yield from his farmland this year. He is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for his farmland to produce paddy (rice)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to supply more milk to his customers and increase his income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more food to serve more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, fruits and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in  a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and charcoal. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and charcoal

loans.name: Yuanita

texts.en:
Yuanita is a married woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, fruits and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables and charcoal. Her business goal is to open a cereals shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables, charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah  is 35 years old. She is married to Peter who is a saw mill workshop operator and they are blessed  with five children named, Joseph 18 years, Beatrice 15 years,  12 years, Vivian seven years and Precious Wanjiru who is one year old. 

She has had a retail shop business for five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 35,000. She is borrowing KES. 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She will be using the loan to purchase flour, cooking fat, soft drinks, pancakes, biscuits, sweets, salt, sugar, salt, tea leaves, margarine, cereals, toothbrushes ,toothpaste, tissue papers, detergents and bar soaps as her retail stock for sale. 

She hopes the anticipated profit will allow her to buy food for her family, ,pay school fees for her children, provide health care, expand her current business and repay her loan too.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable retail business, provide a better education for her kids  and also enjoy a  better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking fat, soft drinks, snacks, food flavours, cereals, toothbrushes, toothpaste, issue papers, detergents, and bar soaps as her retail stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products to enable him to open a beauty salon

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 65 years old, married to Pacificah and is blessed with five children. He has been a dairy farmer for the last 18 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

Lawrence has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk supply and satisfy his customers' demands. He plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of study.

Her future hope is to have a stable family and start a hotel.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk supply and satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, Faculty of Technology, and for 13 years already, she has been working at the Stepanavan School as a teacher of technology and design. Ani also gives private courses in this subject at her house and teaches her pupils, especially the girls, to do design; it can be table design or food design. 

Ani is married and she has two sons. Ani’s husband works at their city’s electric networks. 

Ani is asking for this loan as she wants to repair and furnish the room where she gives her courses with the pupils to separate it and make it more comfortable for her pedagogical activities.

loans.use: to repair and furnish the room where she gives her courses

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
José, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado,está acompañado y su pareja trabaja de enfermera en un hospital nacional y tienen una hija de siete años de edad.

José, trabaja de ayudante de albañil, pero actualmente se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, lo inicio debido a que no 
hay mucho trabajo de albañilería, su esposa le apoya los fines de semana y el vende tres días a la semana.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar más ropa para su negocio, ya que se acerca la temporada de semana santa, específicamente comprará blusas, toallas y shorts. de esa manera incrementará sus ingresos para poder ayudarle a su esposa, para los gastos de la casa.

El sueño de José, es que su hija viva en mejores condiciones de vida y algún día poder comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
José, age 24, went to school through the seventh grade.  He is in a relationship, and his life partner works as a nurse at a national hospital.  They have a seven year old daughter.

José works as an assistant bricklayer.  He currently has a business selling clothes.  He started it because there is not much bricklaying work.  His wife helps him on the week-ends, and he sells three days a week.

José needs the loan to buy more clothes for his business because the Holy Week season is approaching.  He will buy blouses, towels, and shorts.  This way he will increase his earnings in order to be able to help his wife with the household expenses.

José’s dream is for his daughter to have better living conditions and to one day be able to buy a piece of land to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna, her husband, their three children, and her mother-in-law live in the Azatan village of the Shirak region. 

They all are involved in farming. While her elder children help Susanna to manage a livestock of cows, calves and hens, Susanna herself cultivates wheat and potatoes. Susanna's husband works at the village school but tries to help his wife around their farm, also. 

Susanna asks for this loan to be able to increase her farming and be ready for the new season. She hopes for a good harvest and plans to sell her produce for a high price so her family will have more income for living. 

Because socio-economic conditions in the village and in the overall region are quite bad, Susanna and her co-villagers have to work hard to make ends meet. 

Shirak is considered as poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs make a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region. Susanna's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access markets, and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds needed for the farm to have a good harvest and earn higher income for her family's living.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a mother of four sons from Ashotsq village of the Shirak region. Two sons serve in the army, her third son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country, and her fourth son lives with Karine to help with work on the farm. They tend livestock of cows, sheep and calves. Both Karine and her son work hard to sustain their farm and make it profitable, so their family can have appropriate living conditions.

To enlarge the farm, Karine has requested this loan. She plans to purchase two cows, forage for the livestock, and fertilizer. Remaining funds will cover her expenses to rent land. This loan will be a big support for a hard-working woman, because there are many difficulties in the villages within this region. 

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people to develop their businesses. Karine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provide loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, helping them to access markets for their products and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, forage for the livestock, fertilizer, and land rental costs.

loans.name: Shidaa Aha Yehowa Group

texts.en:
Shidaa Aha Yehowa is a group consisting of two members, both of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking, and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. They sell provisions and provide hairdressing services. 

One of the members is Jessie, who was selected as the featured borrower of this group. Jessie is a 40-year-old single lady living with her two children, who are attending school. She runs a hairdressing service to take care of her children. She washes and waves her customers' hair in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the city. 

Jessie has a plan to make her business bigger and keep satisfying her customers. She also wants to purchase shampoo, lotion, wigs, and creams in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase such items so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: To purchase items like shampoo, lotion, wigs, and creams so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.name: Adarku

texts.en:
Adarku is 58 years old and married with no dependent children. Adarku works hard to provide for her family. She sells smoked fish in Accra, Ghana, and requested a 3,500 GHS (Ghanian Cedis) loan through ID Ghana to buy more fish and firewood to smoke fish and sell it to customers. 

Adarku has borrowed and repaid eight loans from ID Ghana before this loan. She has been doing this job for eight years. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Adarku aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and firewood to smoke fish and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Ifat

texts.en: Ifat is a 35-year-old married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). She looks after the cattle and is responsible for their food while her husband sells them out in the market. They make enough through their business to meet the day-to-day expenditures of their family.  Now they need to expand their business in order to boost their earnings. For this reason, Ifat has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals like baby goats and calves, etc. They are hopeful that it will definitely help them to expand their business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals like baby goats and calves, etc.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom go to school, and takes care of one additional family member. Together, they live in a rented house with no access to electricity or running water. Her largest monthly expenses include school fees and food. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land.

To earn a living, Annet sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for four years and works six days a week. A loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO will allow Annet to buy a bale of used clothes and increase her profits, which will help her overcome her major business challenges, including seasonality and transportation.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is 55-year-old widow. The man shown in the photo is her son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his van. He has been driving a van for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Basheeran has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. He will utilize this loan amount for repair & maintenance of his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. Basheeran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: for repair & maintenance of her son's vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be capable. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy additional stock of fruits. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business selling animals. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase more animals. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as focused.

For five years, Serah has operated a retail business selling cereals. Her business, which is located in a good area, serves individual customers, but her biggest challenge is maintaining adequate inventory.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that she will be successful in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 25 years old. He is not yet married, and has no children yet. He has had a farming business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES.15,000. 

Allan is requesting his first loan of KES. 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase animal feed, animal licks, remedies for parasites, fertilizer, and pesticides. 

With the anticipated profits, Allan will be able to provide health care for his family, expand the current business, and repay his loan. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable farming business.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed, animal licks, remedies for parasites, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to meet his customers' demand for milk.

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, utilizo el crédito anterior para ir mejorando y facilitando los trabajos agrícolas, sus cosechas son abundantes, cuenta con una nueva situación económica y su familia está viviendo en óptimas condiciones.
Él está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas que le servirán para preparar su próxima siembra de granos básicos, espera tener un resultado positivo y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Denis used the previous loan to keep improving and facilitating the farm work. His harvests are abundant, he has a new economic situation, and his family is living in optimal conditions.

He is asking for a new loan in order to buy farming supplies that will help him to prepare his next planting of staple grains. He hopes to have a positive result and continue working.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies that will help him to prepare his next planting of staple grains; he hopes to have a positive result and continue working

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal and water. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are individuals. 

Catherine describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: Javahir

texts.en:
Javahir and her husband live in Beniamin village of Shirak region. Their only son works and lives abroad as a migrant worker, to support his parents. They have a small and well-run farm. 
 
 On their family's own land, Javahir cultivates wheat and potatoes and keeps livestock: cows, calves and chickens. The farming produce is mainly for family use, so Javahir would like to expand it. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing  forage, fertilizer and seeds needed for her farm. 

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region.

 Javahir's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access a market and earn living.

This is Javahir's first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for forage, fertilizer and seeds needed for farm to earn higher income and cover basic needs of the family

loans.name: Rozakan

texts.ru: Розакан, 28 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2010 году, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Розакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: коровы и лошади, всего 4 голов и 105 овец. Ежемесячный доход Розакан составляет 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Розакан хочет приумножить скот, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на постройку большого сарая.
texts.en: Rozakan is 28, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education and earns additional income for her family by raising livestock. She started in the business in 2010 when she purchased livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Rozakan's hard work she currently has four head of cows and horses and 105 sheep. She earns 35,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to purchase livestock to increase her headcount. Rozakan wants to aquire livestock in order to be able to save money to build a large barn.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 58 лет, замужем. У них с мужем 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1995 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Шарапат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 9 коров, 40 овец, также 2,65 Га обрабатываемой земли, где Шарапат выращивает люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет до 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарапат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота и в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sharapat is 58, married, and has four children. She started planting crops and raising livestock in 1995 as a source of income for her family. Thanks to Sharapat's hard work, she currently has nine cows, 40 sheep, and a 2.65 hectare plot of arable land where she grows alfalfa to sell. Her monthly income from farming is around 18,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her business, Sharapat applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy sheep to fatten and sell. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to purchase more livestock and develop her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy six sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, de 34 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja en un proyecto de agua potable en la comunidad donde viven, no tienen hijos, son una pareja emprendedora y luchadora. 
 
Marina, compra cerdos para engordar y luego venderlos, tiene cuatro años aproximadamente de dedicarse a eso, además tiene pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras, el negocio lo tiene en su casa.- Anteriormente, vendía helados y hacia pan artesanal en su casa, pero ya no lo hace, ya que su esposo se enfermó unos días y ya no continúo.

El crédito actual lo utilizara para comprar cerdos de engorde, porque en estos días, los están comprando a buen precio y tienen buena demanda.

Marina, sueña en un futuro tener vacas para producción de leche, ya que tienen un terreno en donde tener las vacas y hay buenos pastizales.- Además, sueña con hacer crecer su granja de pollos y lo está logrando gracias a la ayuda de kiva.
texts.en:
Marina, 34 years old, studied only through second grade. She is married and her husband works on a potable water project in the community where they live. They do not have children. They are an enterprising, determined couple.

Marina buys pigs to fatten and then sell. She has been doing this for approximately four years. In addition, she has broiler chickens and laying hens. The business is in her house. Previously, she sold ice cream and made artisanal bread in her house, but she doesn't do it anymore, since her husband got sick for some days and she did not continue.

She will use the current loan to buy pigs to fatten, because these days they are buying them at a good price and there is good demand.

Marina dreams of having cows in the future to produce milk, since they have a piece of land where they can put the cows and there is good pasture. She also dreams of making her chicken farm grow and she is achieving it thanks to the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Al-Ilham 4 Group

texts.en:
Al-Ilham 4 Group, consisting of three members, requested a concurrent loan for 150,000 YER. Jamala is the leader of the group who used the first loan to buy more accessories and cosmetics to sell. That loan helped her to improve the living condition of her family. 

Jamala requested a concurrent loan for 50,000 YER (her share), which she will use to purchase women's clothes to sell plus perfume and incense to expand her business. Her profits will increase  and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, perfume, and incense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him increase his milk supply to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to puchase energy saver cooking jikos (stoves) for resale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are individuals. 

Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of water. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water tank and pipes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to  buy a  water tank and pipes

loans.name: Adinan

texts.en: Adinan lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with one child and does farming, alongside earning a monthly salary. to boost his income. He started the business to support his family. Adinan faces a challenge of poor weather that affects his yield. He needs a loan to prepare his gardens for planting.

loans.use: to prepare his gardens for planting.

loans.name: Gerald Cosmas

texts.en: Gerald is a married man with two children who lives in Masindi-Uganda. He is a farmer and has a motorcycle for his transport business. He started the business to support his family, despite facing a challenge of competition. He needs a loan to buy general merchandise, such as sugar, salt and soap, to sell. Gerald has a vision of becoming a wholesale trader in the future.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise to sell, such as sugar, salt and soap.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 45 years old. He is married and has five children between 6 and 18 years old. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past seven years. His wife is also a farmer. He will use the loan from Kiva to pay workers to harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is adversely affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 49-year-old married woman. She makes hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her area, and client demand is strong. She is the mother of seven children, and she is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothing and education. In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery, she needs to engage some more women. She has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she can buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will help to generate more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will permit her to hire more workers.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila  is 40 years old and a married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Shakila’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Shakila  has requested 40,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Suyunbubu

texts.ru: Суюнбубу, 46 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году, благодаря упорному труду Суюнбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 нетели, а на земельной доле мерою 2,38 Га она выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суюнбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Суюнбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества скота.
texts.en: Suyunbubu is 46, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education. In search of an additional source of income for her family, she began raising livestock and planting crops in 1995. Thanks to Suyunbubu's hard work she currently has two cows, two calves and a 2.38 hectare plot of land where she plants beans to sell and to use at home. In order to expand her business, Suyunbubu applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy a calf to increase her herd. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in purchasing additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: El Mogote Group

texts.es: Nelis, tiene 32 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de San Rafael, Lempira junto a su hijo. Desde hace 15 años Nelis se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando café. Esta producción de café la vende a intermediarios de la zona. El ha obtenido varios ciclos de prestamos con la institución para mantener su cultivo en buen estado. Actualmente solicita otro por 17,000 Lempiras en forma grupal y lo va invertir en la compra de abonos para fertilizar y sembrar mas café, con el fin de mejorar la producción y los ingresos. El grupo se llama El Mogote, integrado por 3 personas que se dedican a la agricultura y cultivo de café. Solicitan un préstamo por 36,000 Lempiras para abonar y fertilizar el cultivo existente y sembrar mas café. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Nelis, Doris y Alex Sandra a la derecha.
texts.en: Nelis is 32 years old. He is single. He has one son and lives in the municipality of San Rafael, Lempira with his son. Nelis has worked in farming for 15 years growing coffee. He sells this coffee harvest to intermediaries in the area. He has gone through several loan cycles with the institution in order to keep his crop in good condition. Currently he is asking for another for 17,000 lempiras through the group and he is going to use it to buy manure to fertilize and plant more coffee with the goal of improving production and income. The group is called El Mogote, and it is made up of 3 people who work in farming and grow coffee. They are asking for a loan of 36,000 lempiras for manure and to fertilize the existing crop and grow more coffee. In the photo they are identified as follows: on the left is Nelis, Doris, and Alex Sandra on the right.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize and plant more coffee

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 35-year-old lady and has been involved in the work of making parandas from many years. Paranda is considered a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan. Women use it for a traditional look on special occasions like Eid (a holiday) and weddings. 

Fareeda makes beautiful parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never manage. 

Fareeda needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw material including colorful thread, beads, little mirrors, and pearls for embellishment. This will help in attracting more customers and ultimately helps her in earning more income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including colorful thread, beads, little mirrors, and pearls for embellishment

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: Blanca de 65 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos. El grupo “El Rosario” está conformado por 06 socias optimistas y visionarias. Ella se dedica a la fabricación de tejidos. Hace más de 17 años que Blanca realiza sus actividades y ha mejorado su negocio por la mayor acogida que tiene por sus clientes. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de lanas, hilos y telas. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. El deseo de Blanca es de tener su propio local. El grupo “El Rosario” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva  por hacer posible este crédito. Blanca se encuentra de pie  es la  segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
Blanca, 65, is married and has 3 children. The “El Rosario” group is made up of 6 optimistic and visionary members. 

Blanca makes textiles. She has been doing this for over 17 years and has improved her business thanks to her great popularity with her customers. 

She asked for the loan to buy wool, thread and fabric. Thanks to her hard work she is able to give her children a better education. Blanca's dream is to have her own shop. 

The “El Rosario” group is grateful to the Kiva investors for making this loan possible. In the photo, Blanca is the one standing second from the left dressed in a white top.

loans.use: to buy wool, thread and fabric

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income. She is very grateful for her life and being able to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to provide tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 27 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a retail shop business for two years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase vegetables for sale. She hopes this will help her to expand her grocery business and educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future include educating her children to university level.

Her monthly income is KES 7,000. She has borrowed a loan of KES 10,000 to be repaid in six months. This is her first loan in VisionFund.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 45 years old and married to Omayio. They are blessed with six children. She has been operating as a small scale farmer for the last 20 years and earns KES 9,000 per month.

Prisca has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business.

Her future hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 35 years old and married to Nathan, and they have been blessed with four children. She has been operating a clothing repair business for the last 15 years and earns 7,000 KES per month.

Sylivia has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income by selling milk. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand her business.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income by selling milk.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is a 37-year-old man from Kisumu; he is married and was blessed with four children. 

He operates a dress shop where he has been selling clothes in bales for the last 10 years. He generates a monthly income of Kes 20,000. 

He has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use in purchasing more second-hand clothes to sell to his customers; this will make him earn more income to support his family.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono is a 36-year-old gentleman from the village of Cheptuiyet in the South Rift region of Kenya. He is a small-scale onion grower. Kiprono faces a couple of challenges in his business, including craggy terrain. As a result, his income is too meager to enable him meet his family's basic needs. 

Kiprono is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 to venture into poultry farming. Unlike onion farming, poultry is less dependent on the physical state of the land and weather. Having several heads of poultry will ensure eggs are produced in significant quantities to sustain Kiprono's family. 

With your loan, Kiprono's family will embark on a profitable venture that is more reliable in terms of returns.

loans.use: to pay for poultry

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 31 years old and a married woman. She has been in business running a beauty parlor from many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, facials and more. Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Safia wants to expand her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be positive. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals and hotels. 

Richard describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a freezer. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine and her family live in Byurakn village of Shirak region. She is a mother of three children. Narine is a farmer running her family's own farm. Her husband tries to help her around their farm, also.

They keep two cows, calves, and sheep and cultivate wheat and sell it. Narine is one of the many women in Shirak region who have to take care of and bring up their children in very difficult socio-economic conditions. 

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region. So, Narine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to under-served population of Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living.

This is Narine's first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation to enlarge farming business and earn income for the family

loans.name: Marie Goreth

texts.en:
Marie Goreth is 35 years old. She is married with four children aged between 4 and 13 years old. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 15 years, while her husband is a businessman. With this loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón un hombre de 32 años de edad, este hombre está muy agradecido  por el crédito anterior que con ello logro mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por lo que él y su familia viven ahora en mejores condiciones, pero el ahora necesita de un nuevo préstamo porque él ahora ha pensado en  elaborar ropa típica de su región, pero una de las dificultades que tiene este hombre es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para comprar un telar donde pueda el elaborar cortes y Güipiles típicos de su región.
Ramón guarda las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para poder realizar su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos para poder construir una casa de block.
texts.en: Ramon is a 32-year-old man. He is very grateful for the previous loan as he was able to improve his living conditions, he and his family now live better.  He now needs a new loan to start making typical clothing from his region.  One of the difficulties is that he doesn’t have enough capital to buy a loom so he can make cuts and typical tops from his region.  Ramon is hopeful to get a loan again to accomplish this business and improve his income to build a house made of concrete.

loans.use: to buy a loom and start making typical clothing from the region.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 53 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Naseem needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, 30 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. Her brother-in-law (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a small general store. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Abida's brother-in-law needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand and make better earnings.

loans.name: Cfjdt 31 Group

texts.fr: CFJDT 31 est un sous groupe de la Convergence des Femmes et Jeunes pour le Développement de Tassette. Comme les autres sous groupes, c'est un groupement composé de 6 femmes qui sont toutes résidentes du village de Tassette. Elles se réunissent tous les fins de moi pour organiser des tontines et discuter de la situation du village et comment faire pour le sortir de la pauvreté. Elles ont nommé Madame NOGAYE comme présidente, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est Veuve et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des poissons et fruits de mer. Elle demande ce montant pour aller dans la petite cote et acheter des fruits de mer comme les crustacés et les poissons frais, séchés ou fumés pour revenir au village et les revend à ses clients potentiels. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans et commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 16h. Elle prend en charge toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle voudrait avec l'aide de l'institution, avoir un grand magasin de stockage au niveau du marché central pour pouvoir augmenter ses marchandises et diversifier ses produits
texts.en:
CFJDT 31 is a subgroup of the Gathering of Women and Young People for the Development of Tassette. Like the other subgroups, it is a group composed of six women who are residents of the village of Tassette. They meet at the end of each month to organize  revolving savings accounts and talk about the situation in the village and how to rise out of poverty. They named Madame Nogaye as president; she is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

Madame Nogaye is a widow and mother of a family who has been developing her business selling fish and shellfish. She is requesting this amount to go to the Petite Cote and buy seafood such as shellfish and fresh, dried, or smoked fish, then come back to the village and resell it to her potential customers. She has  more than five years' experience. She begins her day at 6 am to finish at 4 pm. She is responsible for all the daily expenses of her family and the school fees of her children. With the help of the Microfinance Institution, she would like to have a big warehouse in the central market so that she could expand her merchandise and diversify her products.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, smoked fish, and shellfish destined to be resold

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 62 years old, married to Joyce, and blessed with six children. He has been rearing poultry for the last 25 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the business.

James has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, which will enable him to supply milk for more income. He plans to use the generated profits to educate his children. His future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, which will enable him to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a tailoring shop business for five years. She will be using the loan to purchase fabric and sewing threads and hopes this will help her to purchase more fabric material and supply to other tailoring shops. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are expand her business and be able to provide for her family and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing threads to supply to other tailoring shops.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be positive. 

She operates a retail business where she sells coconuts. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of coconuts. 

Her business goal is to have  a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconuts

loans.name: Buzada

texts.ru: Бузада, 38 лет, мать 3 сыновей школьного возраста. У нее среднее образование. Бизнесом занимается с 2000 года, начала она свою деятельность с 2,000 сом (KGS). В данный момент Бузада продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, у нее есть 4 коровы, 2 лошади. На 0,23 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). По характеру Бузада очень ответственная и доброжелательная. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения овец. В будущем Бузада собирается увеличить поголовье скота и накопить на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en: Buzada is 38 years old and a mother of 3 school-age sons. She has a secondary education. She has been involved in this business since 2000 and started it with 2,000 som (KGS). At the present time, Buzada continues to run her farming and animal husbandry businesses. She has 4 cows, 2 horses, and 0.23 hectares of own and 1.0 hectare of leased land, where she grows barley. Her monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). Buzada is very responsible and kind by nature. She requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep. In the future, Buzada plans to increase her livestock headcount and save to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Nahapetavan village of Shirak region with her husband and two sons. She runs a small and well-run farm, where she keeps cows, calves, hens and cultivates potatoes and carrots. Gohar is one of the many women in Shirak region, who have to take care of her family by working hard and overcoming the many problems that can arise in an agricultural business. 

To be able to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock Gohar asks for this loan. She hopes to enlarge her farm and gather more income for her family. 
 
Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs causes a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in Shirak region. Gohar's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to under-served population of Shirak region, to help them to access the market and to earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Gyulzat

texts.ru: Гюльзат, 34 года, замужем, 1 ребенок. У Гюльзат высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, около 5 лет. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Гюльзат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Гюльзат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Гюльзат намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению доходов семьи и позволит приобрести мебель для дома.
texts.en: Gyulzat is 34 years old, married and has one child. Gyulzat has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry for about 5 years. Thanks to Gyulzat's persistence, drive and hard work, today she has 2 cows and 20 sheep. Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). Gyulzat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock in order to increase its headcount. Gyulzat intends to expand her business, which will certainly lead to increased income for the family and allow to purchase furniture for home.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, soap, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are locals. 

Beatrice will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a reknowned business woman. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia  is a hard working married lady. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of stitching bags at her home, as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Ruqia  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as thread of different colors, zippers, and cloth to meet orders on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as thread of different colors, zippers, and cloth

loans.name: Nurgyz

texts.ru: Нургыз 42 года, замужем, многодетная мать, имеет 3 детей. Дети взрослые, они и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Нургыз с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее упорству она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: корова, лошадь и 30 овец. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает фасоль. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Нургыз обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом(KGS) на покупку 2 коров с телятами для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нургыз планирует в будущем направить на свадьбы детей.
texts.en: Nurgyz is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. All of her children are grown, and her husband helps with the business. Nurgyz has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000, when she started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence, she achieved good results and today has a cow, horse and 30 sheep. She grows beans on 2.0 hectares of land. In order to increase her livestock headcount, Nurgyz requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 cows with calves. Nurgyz plans to use the earnings from the loan for her children's weddings in the future.

loans.use: to buy two cows with calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 33 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen ’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nasreen has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, along with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Nasreen  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some auto spare parts

loans.name: Olexandr

texts.ru:
Александр  работает в сельскохозяйственном бизнесе около 8-ми лет в Новониколаевской области .Он  арендует 190 га земли. Основные культуры являются подсолнечник и пшеница, он использует собственную и арендованную сельскохозяйственную технику во время полевых работ, но  хотел бы возобновить и расширить существующий парк оборудования, поэтому он обратился к ACM для преобретения  распылителя.
В планах у Александра купить распылитель с помощью АСМ, что позволит избежать потери времени и экономии средств в ходе полевых работ.

Нуждается в вашей помощи для преобритения распылителя
texts.en:
Olexandr has been working in an agricultural business for about eight years in the Novonikolaevski region. He rents 190 hectares of land. The main crops are sunflowers and wheat. He uses his own and rented agricultural machinery during the field work, but would like to renew and expand his existing collection of equipment, therefore he applied to ACM for to acquisition of a sprayer.

In Olexandr's plans to purchase a sprayer with the help of АСМ, he will avoid losing time and money during the field work.

He needs help in order to acquire the sprayer.

loans.use: To purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель 20 лет, замужем, детей нет. У Асель - высшее образование, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Асель, у нее в хозяйстве есть лошадь, 30 овец и 2,50 Га собственной земли, где она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Асель составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Семья занимается любимым делом, которое хочет развивать и дальше. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец. Доходы от ведения бизнеса, Асель будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Asel is 20 years old, married and does not have children. Asel has a higher education and is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to Asel's hard work, her farm contains a horse, 30 sheep and 2.50 hectares of her own land, where she grows beans for sale. Asel's monthly income amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS). The family is involved in their favorite business that they want to develop further. This is why, in order to expand her business, Asel requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 calves and 20 sheep. Asel will use the earnings from the business for its continued development.

loans.use: to buy two calves and 20 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динара, 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Динары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Динары на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 7 овец. Также она на 1,0 ГА земли выращивает помидоры для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 24,500 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dinara is 31 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 4 children. Dinara has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Thanks to her hard work, today Dinara's farm contains 2 cows, 7 sheep and 1.0 hectare of land, where she grows tomatoes for sale. Her monthly income amounts to 24,500 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Dinara requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock for fattening up and resale. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 41 years old and married with two children. He works hard to provide for his family. He sells rechargeable phone cards in Ghana. He has been running his business for eight years. Daniel has requested a 3,000 GHS loan through Kiva's partner, ID Ghana, to buy a variety of phone cards. Daniel has borrowed and repaid seven loans from ID Ghana before this loan. He aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Essé

texts.fr: Essé est une femme mariée de 31 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à Adidogomé. Essé est une commerçante de plats cassables qui parcoure son quartier pour vendre ses articles. Essé trouve régulièrement son profit dans ce commerce et arrive à venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille. Essé s’approvisionne une fois par mois marché. Essé demande ce microcrédit pour acheter quelques plats qu’elle pourra vendre pour réaliser plus de bénéfices et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Essé is a married woman of 31 who lives with her two children in Adidogomé. Essé sells breakable dishes and she walks through her district to sell her merchandise. She regularly finds her profit in this business and manages to help out with the needs of her family. She buys her goods once a month at the market. 

Essé is requesting this small loan to buy some dishes that she will be able to sell to make more profit and help out with the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy some breakable dishes for resale

loans.name: Santos Ramon

texts.es: Don Santos nació en el año de 1950, en el departamento de Jinotega. De pequeño aprendió a escribir y a  leer, luego  a los catorce años empezó a trabajar en las fincas cercanas de donde el vivía. Poco a poco ahorró para comprarse una finca y poder trabajarla, actualmente esta casado y tiene 7 hijos, el trabaja en agricultura con sus hijos . En el sector donde don Santos vive no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación este panel será de gran beneficio ya que se podrán alumbrar por las madrugadas a hacer comida en los tiempos de corte de café y por las noches también será de gran beneficio, estaría muy agradecido si le dan oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en: Santos was born in the year 1950, in the department of Jinotega. As a child he learned to read and write, and then at the age of fourteen he started working on nearby plantations. Little by little he saved up to buy himself a plantation that he would be able to build up. Currently he's married and has 7 children, and he works in agriculture with his children. In the area where Santos lives there isn't any electricity for lights so that's why he's applying for a loan to purchase a solar system that will be installed on his residence. This solar panel will be a huge help since it will allow them to have light to cook in the early mornings of coffee harvesting season and it will also be a huge help at night. He would be very grateful if given the opportunity to purchase a solar system with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt: A Senhora Lina  é solteira vive com o filho, a nora e 2 netos.  Ela é comerciante. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir mercadorias, nomeadamentas, mantas, fardos de roupa usada para revender. Tem  como maior sonho terminar de construir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura para o uso pessoal. Tem com meta ver os seus filhos com uma casa em melhores condições habitacionais, pois tem se esforçado para terminar a casa e deixar para o filho com quem vive actualmente.
texts.en: Lina is single and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. She is a saleswoman. With this loan she wants to buy merchandise, namely blankets and bundles of used clothing to sell. Her biggest dream is to finish building her house and to buy a car for her personal use. Her goal is to see her children in a more comfortable house, so that's why she is determined to finish her own house so she can move out from her son's where she lives now.

loans.use: to buy blankets and bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 8 years to 25 years. He describes himself to be truthful. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rain season, which affects business. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, to enable him to supply milk to his customers and increase his income to educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, together with his family, lives in Lolminingai village, which is found near Eldoret town, Kenya. He practices dairy farming and milk is his main source of income. George enjoys dairy farming with all of its challenges. His biggest challenge at the moment is lack of an adequate mode of transporting milk to the market. To solve this problem, he needs external financing. 

George is seeking a KES 65,000 loan to buy a reasonably priced Indian motorcycle. Most farmers go for this type of motorcycle due to its economic and versatile nature. With your loan investment, George will use his motorcycle to transport milk to the market and drop his daughter off to school. He will also have the option of generating additional income through offering transportation services to the public. This investment to George is a step closer to achieving his dream of providing a high living standard for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm transportation.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 29 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей, самому младшему - 2 года У Аиды среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Аиды на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы и арендованный земельный надел, размером 1,0 ГА, на которой она ежегодно со своей семьей сажает арбузы для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистого скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет построить дополнительный сарай.
texts.en:
Aida is 29 years old, married, and is raising with her husband four children, the youngest of which is two years old. Aida has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and crops, having begun four years ago with a livestock purchase of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aida currently has on her homestead three cows and rented land measuring 1.0 hectare, on which annually she and her family plant watermelons for sale. Monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Aida applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase purebred livestock for expanding her herd.

Aida plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating her count of domestic animals and wants to build an additional barn.

loans.use: to buy purebred livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Urmat

texts.ru: Урмат, 27 лет, холост, детей нет, живет с родителями. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, более 7 лет назад начал заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Урмат имеет в хозяйстве 4 коровы, 10 овец. По выходным перепродает скот на скотном рынке, на ежедневной основе - домашнее молоко. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Урмат обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Урмат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства и хочет накопить на свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Urmat is 27 years old and single, does not have children, and lives with his parents. As a main source of income for his family, he began raising livestock and crops more than seven years ago. Thanks to his hard work, Urmat currently has on his homestead four cows, and ten sheep. On weekends, he sells livestock at the livestock market, and daily he sells milk. All the activities bring in a monthly profit of about 20,000 som (KGS). Having concluded that the business is profitable, Urmat applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow for expanding his herd.

Urmat plans to invest income from the loan in further developing his farm and wants to save money for his wedding.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase his herd.

loans.name: Saliman

texts.ru: Салиман 63 года, вдова, есть 2 сыновей. У Салиман высшее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Салиман, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 11 овец. Для содержания скота есть сарай. На 2,0 Га она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита Салиман планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Saliman is 63 years old, a widow, and has two sons. Saliman has a higher education. She optimistically goes through life, knows concretely what she wants and how to make the most of her strengths. As a main source of income for her family, she is engaged in raising livestock and crops, having begun 20 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, Saliman currently has on her homestead a cow and 11 sheep. She has a barn to protect the livestock. On 2.0 hectares, she grows beans to sell. With the aim of further developing her homestead, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening.

Saliman plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating her count of livestock.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To rebuild the shed for raising chicks, in addition to purchasing poultry and feed for the chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase goods to make Sambusa (traditional food)

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo trabaja en una comercial, no tienen hijos y viven en casa familiar.
 
María, es empleada desde hace muchos años; ahora tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa y su suegra la administra.

María, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar arroz, maíz, frijoles y otros productos que sus clientes buscan, de esa manera logrará obtener mejores ingresos económicos. 

El sueño de María, es continuar trabajando y que su negocio sea rentable y sostenible, para asegurar sus ingresos a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Maria, 30, has a high school education.   She is married, and her husband works in business.  They live in the family home, and don’t have any children.
Maria has been working for many years; now she has a small store in her home where she sells staple goods, and her mother-in-law manages it. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, corn, beans, and other products that her customers look for.  In this way, she will manage to earn better income. Maria’s dream is to keep working, and that her business is profitable and sustainable to ensure her income in the long term.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, beans, and other products that her customers look for.

loans.name: Sharma

texts.en: Sharma is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She has had a business with her husband selling animals for many years. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living.  Now, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale in the market.

loans.name: Shugfta

texts.en: Shugfta has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has obtained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family's income. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of zippers and needles in order to meet customers' demands on time. She is positive about her future earnings.

loans.use: to purchase thread, zippers, and needles

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 37 years old, and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings, and will spend part of her income buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Binish

texts.en:
Binish is a 38 years old married woman. She has been manufacturing belts from many years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Binish was not earning, her family was going through severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. 

Binish's husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Due to limited resources, none of their six children were sent to school. Binish felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started her business at home. She is a brave woman and hard work has helped her establish a good clientele. Now she is facing difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Therefore she has requested for 45,000 PKR to buy stock of good quality leather, threads and cutters for manufacturing more belts. Her dream is to expand her business in future.

loans.use: to buy stock of good quality leather, threads and cutters for manufacturing more belts.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en: Sidra is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family, so she started her tailoring business to contribute to the family income. She works hard to meet the family's needs including food, clothing, healthcare, and education. She initiated her business with the support of Kiva's partner, Kashf Foundation. She used her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she has many clients and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Sidra requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy thread in a variety of colors, buttons, needles, zippers, lace, etc. With these supplies she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without any delay. She hopes to grow her business in future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.pt:
Senhora Angelina tem 38 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos frequentando o ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é negociante a mais de 5 anos, vive em casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar, arroz, açúcar, refrescos, ovos e outros derivados, para abastecer a sua mercearia, e posterior revenda.
No futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio, passando a vender alguns produtos a grosso, e deseja também comprar uma viatura para o uso no transporte de mercadorias e pessoal.
O seu grande desafio é de garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos ate fazerem o nível superior e terminar o empréstimo sem cair em mora.
texts.en: Angelina is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all of whom are in elementary or high school. She has been a businesswoman for over five years, and lives in her own house with her family. Aside from them, she has no other dependents. With the loan amount, she will buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, eggs and the like to stock her market. In the future she plans to grow her business, offering some bulk goods, and she also would like to buy a car to use both for transporting her merchandise and for personal use. Her biggest priorities are to pay for her children's education until they graduate and to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, eggs and the like to stock her market.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Senhora Luisa é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos, todos na sua responsabilidade, dos quais um estuda frenquentando o ensino primário e os outros desistiram , vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar areia, cimento, pedras para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
Para o futuro pretende comprar uma viatura para o transporte pessoal e de mercadorias visto que faz negócios.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio para garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en: Luisa is a single mother of four children, all under her care, of whom two are in elementary school and two have dropped out. She lives in her own house and has no other dependents aside from her children. With this loan, she will buy gravel, cement, and stones to continue building her house. In the future she plans to buy a car for both personal and business use transporting her merchandise. Her top priority will be to repay the loan on time so she can have access to future financing.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, and stones to continue building her house.

loans.name: Simoes

texts.pt: O Senhor Simões é casado e vive com a esposa, 3 filho e um irmão. Dois dos filhos encontram-se a estudar.  Ele é policia. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir materiais de contrução tais como, cimento, arreia, blocos, e material electrico. Tem  como maior sonho desenvolver mais uma area profissional, tornando-se oficial uma vez que já está a bastante tempo como Guarda e nunca foi promovido. Com a progressão profissional acredita que podia ter um salário melhor que lhe possa permitir beneficiar de empréstimos maiores para poder melhorar as condições da sua vida.
texts.en: Simões is married and lives with his wife, three children (two of whom are in school), and a brother. He is a police officer. With this loan he wants to buy construction materials, such as cement, gravel, cinder blocks, and electrical fixtures.
