His biggest dream is to advance in his career and become and officer, seeing as he has served in the police force for some time now and has not yet gotten a promotion. With his professional advancement, he figures that he will earn a higher salary, which will allow him to benefit from larger loans in order to be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, gravel, cinder blocks, and electrical fixtures.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 39-year-old mother from the Siaya region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married, the mother of three children, and has helped support her family for the last three years by running a kiosk where she sells cereals. She earns a monthly income of KES. 7,500 and is requesting her third loan from Vision Fund Kenya. She will use it to buy more cereals to sell, and plans to use her profits to expand her business. Her dream for the future is to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 50-year-old married man with eighteen children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a general merchandise shop, and he farms and raises cattle. These are businesses he started with the purpose of earning income. The purpose of the requested loan is to complete his house by roofing it. Joseph’s future prospects are constructing a commercial house and transforming his business into wholesale.

loans.use: to complete his house.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 5 to 18 years.

Bakari operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 39 years old, single and blessed with two children, aged 22 years and 17 years. She has had a farming business for the last 10 years, and earns a monthly income of KES. 40,000. She is requesting her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, for KES. 100,000, to buy a dairy cow, and various types of farm supplies and improvements. Josephine hopes that the profit she expects to earn will help her buy food for her family, animal feed, seedlings, and expand her current agro-business activities. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business, extend her agricultural activity to large-scale farming and enjoy a  better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy farm animals and supplies.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 51-year-old vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of four children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery with pasting of stones on fabric for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Zubaida ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  

She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time, to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира, 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей (дочь и 3 сына). Мунира имеет средне-специальное образование, окончила книжно-торговое училище. Воспитала в себе аккуратность, пунктуальность, она целеустремленна и трудолюбива. Мунира работает в магазине, получая заработную плату в размере 5,000 сом (KGS). В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, с 1997 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой, с 1997 года. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Благодаря упорному труду Муниры в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 6 коров и 20 овец. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает фасоль. Хозяйство Муниры приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Мунира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена накопить на свадьбу детей.
texts.en:
Munira is 40 years old, married, and is raising four children (a daughter and three sons). Munira has a specialized secondary education, having graduated from the book-trade school. Having cultivated her accuracy and punctuality, she is ambitious and hardworking. Munira works in a store, receiving a salary of 5,000 som (KGS). As an additional source of income for her family since 1997, she has been raising livestock and crops. Her experience breeding and caring for livestock is very extensive, since 1997. She sells milk on a daily basis. Thanks to her hard work, Munira has on her homestead: six cows and 20 sheep. On 3.0 hectares of land, she grows beans. Munira's homestead brings in about 10,000 som (KGS) per month, that serves the basis for the cost of food and household needs of the family.

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Munira applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to purchase two dairy cows to increase her livestock count and sales of organic milk.

Munira plans to invest profits from the loan in further expanding her homestead, and also in the future intends to save money for her children's weddings.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows in order to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja tiene un negocio de venta de cielos falsos y ventanas, tienen tres hijos, los cuales estudian.

Sandra, se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo en el negocio que tiene desde hace varios años, el negocio está el centro de la ciudad y el horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m a 3:00 p.m.

Sandra, solicita el préstamo para comprar vidrio para ventanas y otros materiales que necesita para su negocio y así poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, de esa manera lograra cubrir las necesidades que tiene. 

El sueño de Sandra, es tener un negocio más grande y bien establecido, para darle lo mejor a sus hijos y tengan todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old, has a seventh grade education, is in a relationship and her partner has a windows and dropped ceilings business. They have three children who are in school.

Sandra works alongside her husband in the business he's had for several years. The business is in the downtown area and the business hours are from 7:00 am to 3:00 p.m.

Sandra is applying for a loan to purchase glass for windows and other materials that she needs for the business, so that she can take care of her customers' orders and that way cover some expenses she has.

Sandra's dream is to have a bigger, well-established business so that she can provide the best for her children and so that they'll have everything they need.

loans.use: para comprar vidrio para ventanas y otros materiales que necesita para su negocio.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik, with her big family, lives in Paniik village of Shirak region. Her husband is a migrant worker and regularly sends money to the family. All that money is spent on covering the family's daily needs, so there is nothing left for the development of their farming business. That's the reason Shoghik asks for this loan. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and to hire workers for land cultivation. 

The Shirak region, where this family lives, is considered as poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs, make a number of difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region. Shoghik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living. This is Shoghik's first deal with Kiva lenders, and she expects good results.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and to hire workers for land cultivation to invest in the farm and make more income for the family's living.

loans.name: Rapael

texts.en:
Rapael is 52 years old. He lives in Dmanisi district with his pensioner parents. Rapael has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times in order to start a family business. However, he has not had success. His loan requests were all rejected, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The family has an agricultural plot of land for potatoes. However, this is rarely enough to cover their living expenses. 

Rapael has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers,” because of their low income. 

With the received loan, Rapael plans to open a cement workshop where he can make cement blocks. He will purchase all the needed materials such as cement and start making blocks, which will be sold among the resellers. He will use the profits for reinvesting, in order to improve the business and increase its profitability. The new business will give him a chance to grow the family's income, and to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other materials so he can start making cement blocks for his new start-up business.

loans.name: Manuel De J.

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre humilde y perseverante de 31 años de edad, esta solo unido con su señora con la que tiene cuatro hijos de las edades entre uno y catorce años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de banano en su misma comunidad, pero Manuel para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la venta de café integrado, que le genera otro poco de ingresos.
Desde hace mucho tiempo él había pensado en incrementar su negocio de banano, porque en estos últimos días ha tenido mucha demanda, por lo que ya no cuenta con suficiente producto para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela, él solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 que lo invertirá comprando bananos de distintas clases como, seda, chocolate, morada y oro para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
Manuel confía en que esta inversión le genere buenas ganancias para poder comprar un terreno donde  pueda cultivar.
texts.en:
Manuel es un hombre humilde y perseverante de 31 años de edad, esta solo unido con su señora con la que tiene cuatro hijos de las edades entre uno y catorce años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de banano en su misma comunidad, pero Manuel para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la venta de café integrado, que le genera otro poco de ingresos.
Desde hace mucho tiempo él había pensado en incrementar su negocio de banano, porque en estos últimos días ha tenido mucha demanda, por lo que ya no cuenta con suficiente producto para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela, él solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 que lo invertirá comprando bananos de distintas clases como, seda, chocolate, morada y oro para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
Manuel confía en que esta inversión le genere buenas ganancias para poder comprar un terreno donde  pueda cultivar.

Manuel is a determined man of modest means who lives with his wife, with whom he has four children whose ages run from one to fourteen. They live in the community of Solola.
To earn income and support his family, Manuel works in the purchase and sale of of banana trees in his own community. However Manuel also works in the sale of whole bean coffee to increase his income, which adds a bit to what he earns.
For a long time he's been thinking of increasing his banana tree business, because recently he's had lots of demand and as a result he hasn't had enough product to meet customer demand. He's applying for a loan of Q 6,000.00 that he'll invest in the purchase of different types of banana trees such as silk, chocolate, purple, and gold so that he can sell them at a good price. Manuel is confident that this investment will generate good profits that will enable him to purchase some land that he can farm.

loans.use: To purchase and sell banana trees.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan est une femme divorcée qui est âgée de 63 ans. Habitant à Adidogomé, Massan n’a pas d’enfant et travaille activement pour gagner sa vie. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Massan prépare et vend du fromage de soja dans son quartier afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients. Massan achète sa marchandise une fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander quelques sacs de soja. Massan souhaite améliorer son activité pour augmenter son épargne
texts.en: Massan is a divorced woman who is 63 years old. Living in Adidogomé, Massan has no children and works actively to earn a living. To achieve this, she makes and sells tofu in her district, so as to satisfy her customers. She purchases her goods once a month at the market and is asking for this loan to put in an order for a few sacks of soybeans. Massan would like to improve her business to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase 94 tubs of soybeans

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Yawa est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Yawa habite à Adidogomé et vend des pates dentifrices et des détergents liquides en se promenant dans les quartiers. Yawa s’approvisionne deux fois dans le mois au marché. Yawa souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Yawa  demande ce crédit pour commander des pates dentifrices et des détergents liquides afin d’avoir une marge de bénéfice pour couvrir les charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Yawa, aged 30, is a married mother of two. She lives in Adidogomé and sells toothpastes and liquid detergents by going door to door through the districts. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Yawa would like to respond favorably to the expectations of her customers, who find satisfaction from her business. She is asking for this loan to order some toothpastes and liquid detergents, so as to have a profit margin for covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 119 of toothpastes and 4 bags of liquid detergents

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en: Griselda is 31 years old and sells clothes for young people  Griselda is married and her husband is a mason  The couple has three children  Griselda needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business  Griselda visits offices to offer her products  She would like to have her own store in the future. She hopes you can help her because her husband's income pays for the house and supports the children but doesn't contribute to her business. In the picture Griselda appears at her house which, you can see, needs a lot of work

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Telma

texts.pt:
Senhora Telma tem 37 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de um filho frequentando ensino primário, trabalha como analista de consumo numa empresa de aguas, vive em casa própria com o seu filho, e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cabelos para posterior revender no mercado local, como forma de incrementar a sua renda mensal visto que o salário não e suficiente para custear as suas despesas.
Para o futuro pretende construir dependências para o arrendamento, e com o dinheiro vai poupar em conta prazo para custear despesas futuras de escolaridade do seu filho.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é um dos seus maiores desafios para garantir confiança nos pedidos subsequentes, e consequente flexibilidade na realização dos seus projectos.
texts.en: Telma, age 37, is a widow and mother of one son who is in elementary school. She works as an consumption analyst at a water company and lives in her own house with her son. Aside from him, she has no other dependents. She will use this loan to buy hair extensions to sell at the local market, as a means of increasing her monthly income, seeing as her salary isn't enough to cover her expenses. In the future she plans to build out some rooms to rent and use the income to open a savings account she will use for her son's future education expenses.  Repaying the loan on time will be among her top priorities, so that she can remain in good standing for future loans and maintain the flexibility they afford her in realizing her plans.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 34 years old and lives with his godfather. Daniel is a tailor and he makes vests for children. He sells his products at Desaguadero and he also goes to Potosi and Oruro. Daniel uses his skills to repair car seats and bus seats. Daniel needs a loan to buy cloth and other material he uses in his work. His godfather is a good person but he can't help him with the business because he is poor.  In fact Daniel supports him.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other material he uses in his work

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is 75 years old and lives with his daughter in the same place where he has his workshop. Claudio is a locksmith and he helps support his daughter financially. Claudio also makes windows and doors. Claudio needs to handle very heavy materials which is difficult for him. Claudio needs a loan to buy supplies for his business. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es un hombre de 59 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 17 años, y su negocio es la zapatería.
Él es buen padre, constante, paciente, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la población de ‘Batallas’ situado en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca, zona agrícola dónde se cría ganado vacuno, ovino, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales, cereales y tubérculos del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, a una altura aproximada de 4100 metros sobre el nivel del mar, donde los rayos solares golpean fuertemente la superficie.
Adolfo es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la ganadería y con sus hijos que son independientes, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y que cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la zapatería, se encarga de arreglar zapatos, realizar el cambio de suela de tacos y otros. Su segunda actividad es la lechería, él cría ganado lechero para vender leche a los productores queseros del lugar, ambas actividades ocupan toda su jornada diaria. “mi oficio de zapatero me brinda la oportunidad de contar con 2 actividades, la lechería es una actividad de toda mi vida…” comenta. La ventaja de ambos negocios es que cuenta con clientes frecuentes, la desventaja son el clima del lugar que ocasiona la falta de forraje para las vas y cuando llueve debe abandonar su oficio de zapatero porque trabaja al aire libre. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo, el desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para criarlo y aumentar su producción de leche. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Adolfo solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para su cría y aumentar la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 59 years old, married and has two children aged 22 and 17. His business is a shoe store. He is a good father, patient, consistent, enterprising, responsible and hard-working. His business takes place in 'Batallas’ close to the sacred lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where they raise cattle and sheep. They live from fish and also vegetables, cereals and tubers from the region like quinoa, dried potato, broad beans, potatoes etc. It has a cold climate at an altitude of approximately 4,000 meters above sea-level where the sub's rays strike the earth.

Adolfo is dark-skinned, has short black hair, dark eyes short in stature and thin. His native tongue is Aymara which they speak in his community and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for his business. He shares his life with his wife who raises cattle and his children who are independent. They live in their own house made of adobe with a metal roof which has well water and electricity.

His business is a shoe store. He repairs shoes, changes soles and others. His second business is milk. He raises milk cows to sell milk to the cheese producers of the area. The two activities take up his whole day. "My work as a cobbler allows me to have two businesses. The milk I have done all my life" he commented. The advantage of both businesses is that both have regular clients. The disadvantage is the climate. at times there is no grass for the cattle and when it rains he has to give up his cobbling as he works outside.

His dream is to build a brick house. He wants to buy cattle to raise and increase his production of milk. This is his first loan with the institution in the 15 years he has done both activities. For these reasons Adolfo is requesting a loan to buy cattle to raise and increase his milk production.

loans.use: to buy milk cows to raise and increase milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him supply more milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, bread and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him supply more milk, to make more income to educate his children and support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a small dairy and poultry farmer who very much wants to get into horticulture. She has been farming crops, but only for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and some grass for her cow. Now she is requesting a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale to sell. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. Even though they have become one of the top-traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand and Elizabeth is very excited to enter this field. With a Kiva loan, this can be easily achieved and in no time, her farm will start making money. She will plough the profits she expects to earn back into her business to fuel further growth. The increased income she expects to earn will help her improve her family's life.

loans.use: to expand her farm

loans.name: Callebu

texts.en:
Callebu is 55 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 5 and 28 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 35 years. His wife is a farmer also. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Albinah

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Albinah, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley.

Albina, 39, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Albinah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Albinah could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Albinah, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Albinah believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Albinah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik lives in Armavir town with her husband and 23 year old daughter. She is a teacher and has been working in the local village school for many years. She also cultivates sunflowers and sells in local markets.

Realizing that the income from sunflower selling is important for the family, Sofik decided to enlarge her agribusiness. She asks for this loan to purchase sunflower seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers for land cultivation.

She took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it all back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Sofik has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments on this loan. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for sunflower seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers for land cultivation to enlarge her farming business and increase her family's income.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines, de 46 años de edad, estudio bachillerato general, está acompañada y su pareja tiene un taller de reparación de bicicletas, tienen una hija que ya es mayor de edad y viven en casa propia.

Ines, se dedica a lavar y planchar a otras personas desde hace muchos años y por las tardes vende pupusas en su casa, decidido comenzar a trabajar para obtener ingresos para apoyar con los gastos de la casa; su hija le apoya en la pupuseria y el horario es de 4:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m.
 
Ines, solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio, de esa manera atenderá mejor a sus clientes y tendrá mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Ines, es que su hija se prepare academicamente para que sea profesional.- El préstamo le ayudará a que su negocio sea más productivo y a obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ines is 46 years old. She received a general high school diploma. She is in a common-law marriage, and her partner has a bicycle repair workshop. They have a daughter who is an adult, and they live in their own house.

For many years, Ines has made a living washing and ironing for other people. In addition, she sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) at her home in the afternoons. She decided to start working in order to obtain an income and help with household expenses. Her daughter helps her with her sale of pupusas. They work from 4:00 pm until 7:00 pm.

Ines is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs for her business. This way, she will be able to serve her customers better, which will increase her earnings. Ines's dream is for her daughter to prepare herself academically to be a professional. This loan will help Ines make her business more productive and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Liridon

texts.en: Liridon is 27 years old and the father of one son. He is very hard working and does a lot in order to provide for his family and satisfy their needs. Because his wife stays home to care for their son and the house, Liridon is the main source of income, working several areas right now. Not only does he install electricity, he also is raising two horses to sell, sells and transports wood for heating, and sells milk and dairy products from his cow. Now, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase another cow. He hopes that an additional cow will provide more income with the milk and dairy and help to secure a better financial future for his family. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Ticamaya Group

texts.es: José, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo y reside con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Lleva 5 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, anteriormente, solo cultivaba maíz y frijol con sus padres. El cultivo lo tiene en una zona agrícola y vende el café en pergamino. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a la institución en forma grupal por 6,000 lempiras para compra de abono, foliar y fertilizantes para aplicarle a su finca y mejorar la cosecha. Su plan es crecer como productor y tener una familia digna. El grupo se llama Ticamaya, formado por 8 miembros que también se dedican al cultivo de café, viven en la misma zona y solicitan un préstamo grupal por 43,000 Lempiras para poder fertilizar su finca y mejorar la cosecha. En la foto esta: Jose Dagoberto a la izquierda, sigue Jose Idaldo, Maria de los Angeles, Mirian, Lidia, Dominga de blusa negra, Dominga de blusa morado y María Luisa a la derecha.
texts.en: Jose is 25 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife with whom he has a child. He lives with his family in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. For 5 years he's worked in coffee growing, previously he only grew corn and beans with his parents. He has his crop in an agricultural area and he sells pergamino coffee. He has applied for a second loan from the institution in the amount of 6,000 lempiras, as part of a group, to purchase manure, leaf and soil fertilizer to use on the plantation and improve the harvest. His plan is to grow as a producer and provide a respectable life for his family. The group is called Ticamaya and consists of 8 members that also work in coffee growing. They live in the same area and are applying for a group loan of 43,000 lempiras to be able to fertilize their plantation and improve the harvest. Appearing in this photo are: Jose Dagoberto on the left, then Jose Idaldo, Maria de los Angeles, Mirian, Lidia, Dominga in a black shirt, Dominga in a purple blouse, and Maria Luisa on the right.

loans.use: To purchase manure, and leaf and soil fertilizers to use on the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Don Ronald nació en una comunidad llamada Kuskawas en el año 1972, a sus 10 años comenzó a trabajar y aprendió labores de agricultura y en los cortes de café. Actualmente esta casado y tiene 6 hijos con mucho esfuerzo logró comprar una propiedad  y poco a poco está haciendo su casa y sembrando café. El quiere en el futuro comprar unas vacas para tomar su leche y hacer cuajada  para el consumo. En la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  un sistema solar que será de beneficio  para toda la familia.  Estaría muy agradecido si le dan la oportunidad de este préstamo.
texts.en: Ronald was born in a community called Kuskawas in 1972,. At the age of 10 he started to work and learned agricultural activities and coffee harvesting. Today he is married and has 6 children. With much effort he manged to buy a property and little by little is building his house and growing coffee. In the future he wants to buy some cows to have milk and make curd to sell. There is no electricity in the community and for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy a solar power system that will benefit the whole family. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is being given with this loan.

loans.use: buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en: Augustina earns a living by selling plastic items and sauce pans. She is 51, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school. She has been engaged in her business for six years, working from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M. every working day so she can earn a small return each month. She is requesting her fourth loan from ID-Ghana. She has repaid her prior loans in full after using them to buy items to sell to her customers and using her profits to cover family expenses and school fees. She believes that with Kiva's help, her business will grow and her family's life will improve. Augustina's dream for the future is to greatly improve her family's standard of living. She will share this loan with her group partners, Godfred, Philomena and Elizabeth. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy plastics items and a sauce pan to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 6 años y una hija mujer de 3 años, y estudia la carrera de chef.
Ella es inteligente, constante, comprometida con sus estudios, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en la escuela hotelera situada en la zona Central de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por estar situarda rodeada de edificios que albergan a oficinas comerciales, públicas, restaurantes, plazas y todo tipo de comercios, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Jacqueline es de tez trigueña, cabello rojizo largo peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia, trabaja y vive en la ciudad, habla español para estudiar y para trabajar. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela, la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia, construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de chef y se encuentra en 2 año de 3 años que dura la carrera; disfruta cocinando y deleitar a las personas con sabores exquisitos, le gusta entender las combinaciones de esencias, su carácter es de ayuda. Paralelamente trabaja como secretaria, actividad que realiza desde que terminó sus estudios, “hace 16 años que trabajo como secretaria, ahora quiero independizarme y abrir un restaurante junto a mi mejor amiga…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que le pagan mensualmente, la desventaja son los horarios y la dependencia de sus superiores. Su sueño es ser chef para abrir un restaurante con su mejor amiga y administrarlo, ella desea realizar el pago de todas las cuotas de su carrera para recibir un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que trabaja y 1 años que estudia. 
Es por esos motivos que Jacqueline solicita un préstamo para pagar todas las cuotas de su instituto para recibir un descuento, terminar su carrera de chef y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 37-year-old woman. She is single and has a 6-year-old son and a 3-year-old daughter. She is studying to be a chef.

She is intelligent, dependable, committed to her studies, responsible, and very hard-working. She is studying at the hotel school located in the central part of the city. The area is surrounded by buildings that contain commercial and public offices, restaurants, plazas and all sorts of businesses. The climate of the area is cold and dry, with daytime temperatures varying from 4-16 degrees Centigrade.

Jacqueline has coloration reflecting her mixed ethnic heritage, with long reddish hair worn in a fashionable style. Her mother tongue is Aymará, but she is not currently speaking it, since she lives, works and studies in the city. She speaks Spanish for her work and her studies. She shares her life with her children; the older one is in school, and the younger one is not yet of preschool age. They live in a house of their own, built of brick and cement with a metal roof. The house is connected to the water, sewer and electricity services. 

She is studying for a degree as a chef, and she is currently in the second year of the three required for the program. She enjoys cooking and delighting people with exquisite flavors, and she likes to learn about ways to combine ingredients. Her character helps her in her studies. At the same time, she is working as a secretary. She has been doing this work since she finished secondary school. "For 16 years I have been working as a secretary, but now I want to become independent and open a restaurant together with my best friend," she comments. The advantage of her work is that she is paid monthly, but the disadvantages are the working hours and her dependence on her supervisors. Her dream is to become a chef so that she can open a restaurant with her best friend and manage it. She wants to pay off the rest of the tuition for her degree program so she can receive a discount. This is her first loan sequence with the institution during her 16 years of work and one year of studies. 

For these reasons, Jacqueline is requesting a loan to pay off the rest of the tuition for her institute in order to receive a discount, finish her degree program as a chef, and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to pay off the rest of the tuition for her institute in order to receive a discount, finish her degree program as a chef, and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to get more milk to sell and increase his income which will enable him to support his family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 57-year-old mother from the Kisumu region of western Kenya. She is married and supports the seven people in her family by working hard at a food kiosk, which she has been operating for 15 years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 4,000, and is requesting her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to expand her business by buying more tables and seats. Jane plans to use the additional profit she expects to earn to further expand her business. Her dreams for the future are to continue to expand her business and better support her family.

loans.use: to make more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Marina works hard to support her family. She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening businesses. 

Marina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of firewood to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is 44 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pelagia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Pelagia has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tolobai

texts.ru: Толобай, 55 лет, женат, 6 детей. У него - среднее образование, 37 лет назад начал заниматься животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 9 коров, 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, для увеличения поголовья. Толобай является лидером группы "Киреше", в которой кроме него состоят еще 3 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита помогут Толобаю в дальнейшем увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Tolobai is 55 years old, married, and has six children. He has a secondary education. 37 years ago, he started to raise livestock. Thanks to his hard work, he currently has on his homestead nine cows and ten sheep. With the aim of further developing his homestead, he applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for increasing his headcount. Tolobai is the leader of the Kireshe loan group, which consists of three other people besides him.

Profits from the loan will help Tolobai to further expand his livestock count.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase his headcount

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine, 42, is a mother who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for two years. Her primary income sources are maize, vegetables, and profits from a small-time personal business. Josphine is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. She realized that she is working increasingly longer and harder on her farm. The farm work women in the area are currently doing was previously done by males. Women have been forced to take over as their husbands migrate to find wage labor in urban areas. Therefore, the tools women use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields, and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well from using poor traditional tools. The increased income from the use of better tools will help her meet business-related expenses. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Josphine replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Malyuda

texts.ru: Малюда, 34 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Малюды высшее образование, на протяжении 16 лет она занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 9 коров и 50 овец. Разведение и перепродажа племенного скота приносит Малюде хорошую ежемесячную прибыль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Малюда является одной из 4 участников группы "Киреше". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Malyuda is 34 years old, married, and bringing up three children. Malyuda has a college degree. For 16 years she has been raising livestock. She has nine cows and 50 sheep on her farm. Raising pedigree livestock for resale brings her a good monthly revenue. 

In order to develop her business further, Malyuda has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to increase livestock. Malyuda is one of the four members of the Kireshe borrowers’ group. She plans to invest her revenues from this loan in an additional expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to buy   livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Shqipe

texts.en: Shqipe is a single woman who lives with her parents in the southern part of Kosovo. Her parents both receive a pension. She works as a nurse in a clinic but is involved in agriculture in order to make a living. Her parents help her on her farm as she has her regular job to do. Currently, she has one cow and is requesting a loan to purchase five calves to raise and then sell at a profit.  She is very hard working and wants to save for her future. Her goals is to extend her farm. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase five calves to raise and then sell at a profit

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
In a grocery store in Haja city, Yemen, Mohammed sells simple items such as canned food, soft drinks, hair creams, eggs, and other goods for the local residents. This business is the sole source of income for Mohammed, who is 30 years old, and his family. He is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase various grocery items to expand his business. With this loan, Mohammed will create jobs in the community because he needs workers to help him run the grocery store. He is confident this loan will increase his business and profits. By purchasing various kinds of groceries, he will be able to attract more customers. Mohammed hopes this loan will help him to purchase many bags of sugar and flour, corn, and gallons of cooking oil for expanding his business.
Mohammed hopes to expand his business and open a large supermarket to be able to create more jobs in the community.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of food for his grocery store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel un padre de familia de 40 años de edad, cuenta que ahora su vida y su negocio ha mejorado  pues eso ha sido gracias al crédito al que tuvo acceso, porque antes del crédito el comercializaba hojas de Maxan en poca cantidad, pero ahora ya lo realiza con más productos, y se encuentra muy agradecido.
Manuel ahora solicita un nuevo prestamo que lo invertirá en la compra y venta de bananos por ciento de diferentes clases como: seda, oro, y plátano, porque él no cuenta  con  el capital suficiente, con las ganancias que obtiene de  su venta de Maxan sostiene a su familia.
Él tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para poder comparar un terreno.
texts.en:
Manuel is 40 years old and the father of a family. He says that his life and his business have improved thanks to the loan he was awarded. Before that loan, he sold a small quantity of Maxan leaves, but now he sells more products, and he is very grateful. 

Manuel is now asking for another loan that he will invest in the purchase and sale of different types of bananas, such as silk bananas, golden bananas and plantain. He needs this loan because all of his income from selling Maxan leaves goes toward supporting his family. 

In the future he hopes to take out another loan in order to buy a field.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Mouvman Peyizan Plantè Mago

texts.en:
Mouvman Peyizan Plantè Mago (MPPM) is a community-based organization with its head office in the 8th section of the town of Pilate (north of Haiti). It’s been helping for nine years in the socio-economic development of Margot through activities such as the rehabilitation of agricultural roads, reforestation, soil conservation, marketing of bamboo and agricultural commodities. 

Edouard, the coordinator of MPPM, is married and has five children. Before founding MPPM in 2005, he spent more than seven years in the management of grassroots community organizations in Cap-Haitian. Now MPPM focuses mainly on the production and marketing of bamboo. They would enhance the activity by purchasing a larger quantity of bamboo, on one hand to preserve the agricultural potential of the area by avoiding the erosion of arable land; on the other hand, to develop a more certain market to sell the bamboo to generate a source of income for the farmers. To reach these goals, MPPM refers to Zafèn to solicit a loan.

From left to right in the picture, Edouard, Berthilde, Wilson, Joseph, Luckener, Saintil, Edner, Istal, and Claudette.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and pots of black bean seeds

loans.name: Miranda

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Miranda  est une femme mariée vivant dans le quartier d’ Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants à sa charge. Miranda est très dynamique et vend des produits cosmétiques. Son activité lui procure le bénéfice pour venir en aide à son mari dans les besoins de la famille. Miranda s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Miranda demande ce crédit pour commander des défrisants et des mèches pour vendre et gagner encore plus de revenus.
texts.en: Miranda, aged 30, is a married woman living in the Adidogomé district with her two dependent children. She is very energetic and sells cosmetic products. Her business brings in a profit for helping out her husband to meet family needs. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Miranda is asking for this loan to order hair straighteners and hair extensions in order to sell and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase 14 triplets of hair straightener and 26 hair extensions

loans.name: Impac

texts.en:
IMPAC is both a school and a high sewing workshop led by Lesly. After his studies in high fashion in 2000, he spent six years teaching it in several professional centers in Cap-Haitian. In 2009, he launched IMPAC to respond better to certain weaknesses in the sector. Since its opening, about 50 students are graduated from high fashion. Each year at least five scholarships are awarded to young people in difficult economic situations. 

His workshop manufactures for schools, musical groups, ready-to-wear stores and individuals in Cap-Haitian and Port-au-Prince. Over the years, IMPAC has become a renowned school in Cap-Haitian, and the demand for his studio products increased simultaneously. Yet, IMPAC's available supply fault is being unable to fulfill some contracts on time, and facilitate students to purchase supplies locally. Lesly turned to Zafèn to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes rollers, collars for T-shirts, wood fiber and other supplies.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: На фотографии Ханифа. Ханифе 54 года. Она вместе с семьей живет на районе Рудаки. Ханифа жизнелюбивая и активная женщина. Она дома предоставляет услуги по шитью женской одежды. Она любит свою деятельность, ей нравится сам процесс работы. Но она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Ее дом срочно нуждается в ремонте,  Ханифа скоро начнет ремонт и ей необходимо еще купить некоторые стройматериалы. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Ханифу!
texts.en:
This is a photo of Hanifa. She is 54 years old. Hanifa lives with her family in the Rudaki Region. She is an optimistic and energetic person. Hanifa works as a seamstress out of her home. She is enthusiastic about her work and enjoys doing it. 

However, she applied for a loan in order to renovate a house. She needs to renovate her house urgently. She will start the renovations soon and is still lacking some of the construction materials. Because of insufficient funds, she has applied for a loan. Please support Hanifa!

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home renovations.

loans.name: Mirzonazar

texts.ru:
Мирзоназар веселый и гостеприимный житель района Шахристон. Ему 58 лет. Он очень дружелюбный, любит детей, и проводить время с двумя внуками. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. С Мирзоназаром и его женой также живут сын с женой и детьми, и его дочка. 
   Мирзоназар с юных лет проводил время с отцом на скотном дворе, и сейчас животноводческая деятельность для его семьи является основным источником дохода. Он научился у отца всем тонкостям этой деятельности, и непременно примерят их в его бизнесе. На данный момент у него 3 голов крупнорогатого скота и 6 мелко рогатых. Он хочет купить еще одного скота, чтобы обеспечить его большую семью молоком. Так как корова стоить очень дорого и ему не хватает еще немного средств для реализации покупки и он обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Mirzonazar is a joyful and hospitable resident of the district of Shahriston.  He is 58 years old.  He is very friendly; he loves children and loves to spend time with his two grandchildren.  Mirzonazar is married.  His wife is a homemaker.  They live together with their daughter, their son, their daughter-in-law and the grandchildren.

Since his youth, Mirzonazar has always helped his father on the farm and taken care of the livestock.  Today, animal husbandry is the family's main source of income.  He learned all the details of the business from his father and he now makes sure to implement what his father taught him, on the job.  At the moment he owns three head of large cattle and six head of smaller livestock.  He wants to buy an additional cow in order to provide milk to his large family.  A cow costs a lot of money though, and Mirzonazar doesn't have quite enough money for this purchase.  This is the reason why he is taking a loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for the bakery and a bigger oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various shop goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pork and beef.

loans.name: Florfin

texts.en: Florfin is 43 years old and married with three children. Her furniture business is her primary source of income, so she would like to improve her finished products to encourage more customers. To do this, she is seeking a loan of PHP7,000 to buy wood, varnish and nails for her furniture shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her furniture business to be successful.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish and nails to improve her furniture products.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking mother from Oroquieta. She is 65 years old and a widow. Rebecca is a businesswoman; she buys whole coconuts to make copra. She has also been a wholesaler of bananas. From this long time experience of selling, she already has a high knowledge of dealing in this business. Rebecca has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to pay for 200 kilos of bananas. She hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts for making copra and to pay for 200 kilos of bananas

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is from Tangub. She is 49 years old and is a widow. She owns and manages a specialized retail store selling fancy jewelry and fashion accessories in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2009, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her jewelry business and for working capital

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Her name is Glenda, 43, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Edward, a driver, and has four children, two of whom are married, one is in High School and the other one is at the Elementary Level. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's schooling.

Glenda operates a tricycle. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Palawan, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even travel from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is really a need in their place. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial that will be given her.

Glenda dreams of being successful in her business so she can give her children the best education. She prays that they will always lead a happy and harmonious family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lorena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Lorena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of banana to resell.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of banana to resell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is single and does business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 24 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly works hard to support her family. Dolly is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, eggs, coffee, chips, etc.

Dolly has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Dolly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, eggs, coffee, chips, etc.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Silva and she lives with her daughter-in-law and granddaughter in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Having no specialty and never having been employed for many years until today, her only occupation is farming in which she now helps her son’s wife. Silva’s farm is not very big but always cared for and cute. Here she takes care of cows, calves, heifers, sheep, pigs, a lamb and chickens. Her farm meat, milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and eggs she sells at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Silva says that with coming of spring, she feels stronger and she is sure that this year will be greatly productive for her farm. She has a lot of new plans connected with it and she hopes that in the future, Kiva lenders will have a great function in that, but still she has another request. 

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams she asks for, because her cattle lacks fodder and with this money, she wants to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle until it is time to take her cattle to the pastures.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 27 лет она занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров и 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Бурулкан является одной из 4 участников группы "Киреше". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Burulkan is 45 years old, married, and is raising three children. She has a secondary education. For the last 27 years, she has been raising livestock. On the farm, she has six cows and ten sheep. Monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, Burulkan applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock headcount. Burulkan is one of a four-person loan group called Kireshe.

She plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her headcount

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гулзина, 28 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы и 30 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Гулзина является одной из 4 участников группы "Киреше". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulzina is 28 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education. For the past ten years, she has been raising livestock. On her homestead, she has four cows and 30 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 30,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, Gulzina applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock for fattening and sale. Gulzina is one of a four person group called Kireshe. She plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 37-year-old married man from the village of Zeda Etseri. He lives with his wife and school-aged son and daughter. The family earns a living with a small agricultural business. Malkhaz sells agricultural products at the local market and earns a small income that is hardly enough for a four-member family to satisfy even basic needs. He has great desire to earn additional income and make better living conditions for his family. 

In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self employment helps residents to make a living. So, Malkhaz decided to start a business of buying and selling clothing with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. With the loan of 1,500 GEL, he will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in his community door-to-door. His wife will greatly help Malkhaz in this new business and they will work on private orders as well.
 
He is very enthusiastic and a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his children have a good education for progressing in life. This loan will be a great support for the family. Malkhaz is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: to start a business of buying and selling clothing.

loans.name: Claudia Jasmin

texts.es:
Claudia, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, no continuo porque se casó a los 17 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como motorista, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya están en la escuela. 

Claudia, es costurera desde hace 11 años, este oficio lo aprendió estudiando en una academia, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.- Antes, solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar; ahora ella disfruta su trabajo porque lo realiza desde su casa y no descuida a sus hijos.- Ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. y cuando tiene demasiado trabajo termina hasta las 9:00 de la noche, actualmente está elaborando los uniformes para 2 escuelas y por eso labora hasta esa hora, su esposo le ayuda a empacar los uniformes. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar hilo, zippers, botones y una maquina de cocer que le hace fata para su trabajo y que es de gran importancia, para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Ella sueña con ver sus hijos graduarse en la universidad, poner un negocio de alta costura y darle trabajo a más personas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old and studied through the first year of high school. She did not continue because she got married at the age of 17. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver. They have three children, two of whom are already in school.

Claudia has been a seamstress for 11 years. She learned this trade while studying at an academy. Claudia decided to devote herself to this trade in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Prior to that, she only handled the household chores. Now she enjoys her work because she gets to do it from home without having to neglect her children. Claudia wakes up at 5:00 A.M. When she has plenty of work, she will finish at 9:00 P.M. She currently produces uniforms for two school, so she works according to that schedule. Her husband helps with packing the uniforms.

This loan will be used to buy thread, zippers, buttons, and a sewing machine that she lacks for her work. This is of great importance because it will allow her to provide better service to her customers. Claudia dreams of seeing her children graduate from university, starting a high fashion business, and providing jobs to other people.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, buttons, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elisabeth de 29 años habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 5 años al sur occidente d ela ciudad; allí tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones que inició hace tres años, aunque su experiencia data desde cuando a sus 18 años aprendió el arete de confeccionar y trabajó en talleres diversos. Elisabeth ha pefeccionado su oficio estudiando y mediante la cnsistencta de su tarea diaria, pues quiere ampliar su taller de confecciones y mas adelante tener su propia vivienda.  Su principal clientela está concentrada en colegios y almacenes, ella vende de contado y produce de lunes a sabado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, comprando a sus proveedores en el centro de la ciudad donde tiene almacenes especializados en costura. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana, una recubridora y una fileteadora. Con esta inversión mejorará su producción en tiempos y en calidad, para que sus compradores de uniformes, bermudas, ropa deportiva etc, logren cada vez mas satisfacer sus deseos y necesidades de vestir en cada momento, mientras ella les produce en mayor escala.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 29 years old and lives with her spouse and her 5 year old daughter in the South West part of the city. There she has a small sewing shop that she started 3 years ago. Her experience dates from 18 years ago when she learned the art of sewing and worked in various workshops. Elisabeth has perfected her work studying and the constant daily work. She wants to expand her sewing shop and later on have her own house. Her main clients are concentrated in schools and stores. She sells in cash and works from Monday to Saturday from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening. She buys from specialized sewing stores in the center of the city.

She is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy a flat-bed machine, a serger and a cover stitch machine. With this investment she will improve her production in quality and time so she will be able to satisfy the desires and needs of her buyers of uniforms, Bermuda shorts, sports clothing, etc. at all times while she produces on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine, a serger and a cover stitch machine

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: El joven David nació en el municipio de el Tuma. A la edad de 7 años empezó estudiar,su secundaria la estudió dominical y durante la semana le ayudaba a su padre  a trabajar en labores de agricultura. Actualmente está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos. Con esfuerzo ha podido comprar sus herramientas para trabajar en la pequeña propiedad de su padre. En la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica y sus madre se levanta por las madrugadas en los tiempos de corte de café a realizar el desayuno y se tiene que alumbrar con foco y su padre a veces le agarra la noche despulpando en los tiempos de corte de café, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar, comenta que ya teniendo este sistema solar ya se podrán alumbrar y vivirán un poco mas diferente, David estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar que será bien útil para todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
This young man, David, was born in the city of Tuma. He started school at the age of 7. He studied middle school on Sundays, and he helped his father perform agricultural work during the week. He is currently single, and he lives with his parents and siblings. With effort, he has been able to buy his own tools in order to work on his father's small property.

There is no electricity in the community. His mother gets up at dawn during the coffee harvesting season in order to make breakfast, and she has to use a flashlight. In addition, his father sometimes pulps into the night during the coffee harvesting season. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system. He states that having this solar energy system will allow them to have light, and they will live a bit differently. 

David will be very grateful if he is given the opportunity to use this loan to buy a solar energy system, which will be very useful for every member of his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Anita to improve her business.

Anita opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, like slippers and soap.

She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy slippers and soap

loans.name: Continental Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONTINENTAL” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de materiales escolares, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa, venta de videos, venta de chompas de lana, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, aprendiendo la comercialización de estos productos al trabajar con sus primas, es por esta razón que con el pasar del tiempo y con el ahorro de un capital decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas y verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

Al grupo acompaña el asesor de crédito, él esta con una corbata roja.
texts.en:
The A.C. "CONTINENTAL" will start its first cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima.  The group is made up of nine members and a board directs it.  Justina is the Treasurer.  The businesses that the group members work in are varied, such as: sale of school supplies, transport services, clothing sales, video sales, sales of wool sweaters, and food sales.

The loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Justina is a member. She indicates that it has been three years since she's joined the group, Pro Mujer.  She entered by the invitation of a friend that is client of the institution.  In actuality, she has a business selling fruits and vegetables that she has implemented for several years.  She has learned the marking of products and to work with her cousins.  It's for this reason that with the passage of time and the savings of capital, she has decided to implement her own business independently.

The loan that she will take is for the increase of capital (purchase of fruits and vegetables wholesale) that she would acquire from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz.  Afterwards, she will sell the products in her own retail space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, especially since she's married and has five children.

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she responds by saying she likes the trainings that are offered by the institution.

The credit counselor accompanies the group. He is wearing the red tie.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
Уктаму 39 лет. Он муж и отец семейства. У него двое сыновей школьников. Уктам очень активный человек. Он занимается земледелием. Во всей его работе его опора и поддержка является его жена. В этом году Уктам посеял картошку и помидоры. Он хочет иметь еще один источник дохода, чтобы полностью покрыть расходы семейства. Он как глава семейства чувствует ответственность за свою жену и детей, поэтому он должен обеспечить их едой, одежной, здравоохранением и образованием. 
Уктам решил открыть собственный продуктовый магазин. Он нашел помещение, обустроил под магазин и поставил стеллажи. Ему остается только пополнить полки товаром. Ему не хватает не большой суммы денег для привозки и купли товара, и он видит выход из данной ситуации в получении кредита. Уктам верит и надеется, что найдутся люди, которые поддержат его в начинаниях, и он заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en:
Uktam is 39 years old. He is a husband and father. He has two school-aged sons. Uktam is a very active person. He is involved in agriculture. In all his work, his wife helps and supports him. This year, Uktam planted potatoes and tomatoes. He wants to have another source of income, in order to fully cover the family's expenses. As head of the household, he feels a responsibility for his wife and children, therefore he must support them with food, clothing, health, and education.

Uktam decided to open his own grocery store. He found premises, arranged them as a store, and installed shelves. It remains only for him to bring in the food products. He does not have sufficient money for the transportation and purchase of goods, and he sees a way out of this situation by getting a loan. Uktam believes and hopes that there will be people who will support him in the endeavors, and he gives his thanks in advance.

loans.use: to open a grocery store and to buy his first goods to sell.

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Курбонгул. Она уроженка района Рудаки. В Таджикистане многие улицы, районы и города переименовывают в честь великих писателей и ученых таджикского народа. Рудаки был назван в честь основателя классической таджикской литературы Абуабдулло Рудаки. 
  Курбонгул является вдовой, она выкарабкалась после смерти мужа и нашла в себе силы дальше жить. Она поставила себе цель – начать собственный бизнес и решила открыть продуктовый бизнес. Курбонгул потратила свой  стартовый капитал на ремонт помещения и обустройства магазина. Курбонгул поставила стеллажи и ей остается только пополнить магазин продуктами питания. Для приобретения товара ей необходимо еще $2000 и она надеется эти деньги получить за счет заемных средств.
texts.en:
Her name is Qurbongul. She is a resident of the Rudaki region. In Tajikistand, many streets, regions, and cities were renamed in honor of great authors and scientists of the Tajik people. Rudaki was named in honor of the founder of classical Tajik literature Abuabdullo Rudaki.

Qurbongul is widowed. She scrambled after the death of her husband and found in herself strength to carry on living. She set a goal for herself: to start her own business and decided to open a grocery business. Qurbongul spent her own starting capital on repairs of the premises and fitting out the shop. Qurbongul installed shelves and it remains only for her to stock the groceries. To acquire goods, she needs another $2,000 and she hopes to get the money by borrowing.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and open a store.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos, ambos ya trabajan.

Jorge, es agricultor y se ha dedicado a ese trabajo desde muy pequeño, ya que trabajaba junto a su padre en los cultivos, también compra ganado y cuando el precio es bueno los vende y vuelve a comprar ganado pequeño.

Jorge, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y veneno para preparar la tierra, ya que se acerca el invierno y tiene que comenzar a cultivar.

Jorge, quiere seguir trabajando y en un futuro descansar y ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 59, studied up to sixth grade.  He's married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have two children, both of whom are already working.

Jorge's a farmer and he has earned his living in this work since he was very young, when he worked in the fields with his father.  He also buys cattle to sell when the price is good, then buys more young cattle again.

Jorge needs the loan to buy fertilizer and poison to prepare the land.  Winter's approaching and he has to begin to plant.

Jorge wants to keep working and, in the future, rest and watch his grandchildren grow up.
